Over the past 7 years I have been a life and career coach as well as a business consultant to many, what I have encountered through my countless interactions with many people of all backgrounds, is that most of us are harboring some  form of heart ache, resentment,  or pain. Pain is inevitable in life, but we must be careful not to allow our negative experiences to permeate the way we live and relate through the medium of barriers, fears, hang-ups, and dysfunctions.

Summary

Hello! My name is Eli Summers, an indie author of gay romance books. I have a tendency to turn late nights and copious amounts of caffeine into romantic novels about boys loving other boys. This is where the idea of a collection of novels came from. The Seasons Experience Collection is a combination of four novellas: Winter, Summer, Fall and Spring. I have worked endlessly to write the first two of the series and have published them to ebook websites. As you read this, I am actually working on the next two installments. I want to take the next step now, which would be publishing these books to paperback format so I may hold them in my hand, petting them like Golum pets his “precious” ring. (Yes, I would probably even do the voice). Sadly, this takes money and even though I have been trying to raise the funds, sometimes life likes to squeeze lemons in your eyes and give you unexpected expenses. That’s where you come in, you can punch life in the face for me by donating to my dreams in life. With your donations, I will be able to publish these books to paperback where I can make a splash for the gay community. All books published from this campaign will be given to libraries, given out to fans and followers and I will also be giving out some at the Pride Parade in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada in June. Want to help a brother out?


About Me

I haven’t always wanted to be an author, it just sort of happened over the years. When I was younger, I was actually quite adamant about being a police car. When that dream was struck down by a quite horrified mother, I turned my attention from fighting criminals as a car to writing out my feelings in poetry. As time progressed, I actually moved on to writing short stories and eventually, I started writing novels. Once this series is complete, I have quite a few other ideas rolling around in the bin I call my head. A dystopian science-fiction trilogy, a vampire novel, and other short yet interesting stand-alone books. For information on all my current or upcoming projects, please check out my website.

About Indie or Self Publishing

I am an Indie Author and self publishing is quite the learning experience. There is a lot that goes into publishing that you don’t even realize until you’re there learning the hard way it’s not just write and whalah you have this fantastic book that people can’t wait to get their hands on. If only… There is a lot of work that goes on behind the scenes from editing, revision, editing, more revision, marketing, marketing, marketing. For those of us who go it alone, or mostly alone, there are a lot of out of pocket expenses that authors with big publishing companies don’t even have to worry about as it’s included with their publishing package. For example editing, cover art, marketing images, printing, book trailers, virtual book tours, and marketing packages for digital and real world marketing campaigns.

What Your Donations Are Covering

Lucky for me, my editing is taken care of by my volunteer manager and friend, Rebecca King.  What I am needing these expenses for is to cover the following costs:

*Printing-- 100 copies of each book, which will be used to donate to libraries and handed out at Pride this coming June in Calgary, Alberta, Canada.That’s 200 books for an approximate printing cost of $800

*Marketing--Creating a trailer, promotional materials, virtual book tour, technology and software for marketing artwork, and the perks and shipping for this campaign. $1200

About My Books

These two books follow Mattie Hawkins through his journey of love, loss, and learning to love again.
column3:
/>


In this heartfelt romance, Mattie Hawkins, a coy, quiet fifteen-year-old, leaves his old homophobic classmates behind when he moves to the town of Saskatoon. Mattie is late for his first day at his intimidatingly large new school, but he isn’t the only one. When Mattie and seventeen-year-old Morgan Winters both reach for the door, their hands touch and electricity erupts through their bodies, and both boys know they have found the one. Mattie is coy, quiet, and easily flustered when he sets his eyes on the cool and collected Morgan.  From his constant bedhead hair and carefree laugh to the way he always had a camera attached to his shoulders, Mattie was drawn to the crazy carefree charming and lovable mess that was Morgan Winters.

These two boys navigate friendship, acceptance, growth and love with their two best friends: Jenny, the lovable spitfire, and Julian, the teddy bear jock. Along the way, Mattie and Morgan discover a love so strong, so deeply intertwined in each other’s hearts that nothing can come between them, or can it? A faraway college looms over their heads and an unforeseeable circumstance threatens to break their seemingly impossible bond.  Join these two on their journey to see if Mattie and Morgan’s love will prove strong enough to beat the odds or if the love they’re building will come crashing down around them.
column5:
/> 


Five years after losing Morgan, the love of his life, Mattie is merely existing, drifting through life without the hope of ever opening his heart again. When his feisty best friend,Jenny, marries her high school sweetheart, Julian, Mattie saddened that it was supposed to be his wedding, drinks a little more than he should and ends up sleeping with Myles Summers, Morgan’s “cousin.” Mattie wakes up feeling devastated for cheating on Morgan and runs.

A year passes by and the Winters take it upon themselves to give Mattie one last push toward happiness. Mattie finally accepts Myles into his life and things are good until a night that should have been a happy memory tears the two apart. Both men realize Myles is fighting against Morgan’s memory for the man he loves, but there is only room for one man in Mattie’s heart. Mattie comes to the realization that he must let Morgan’s memory go if he is to open his heart to Myles, but can he do it? Even if he can, will Myles still want to be with a man still so in love with a memory? Book 2 in the Seasons Experience collection delves deeply into Mattie’s emotional growth towards what one can only hope will be his second chance at love.

La historia

Las han asesinado en Guadalajara y Ciudad Juárez. Pero lo regular es que las exploten de manera cotidiana en lugares nocturnos de cualquier ciudad de México.  Chicas venezolanas con ambición y buen ver se lanzan a ser modelos en el mercado mexicano pero terminan alimentando el negocio de las ""teiboleras"" o bailarinas exóticas. Sea en sitios lujosos o tugurios, muchas veces trabajan para redes criminales que administran la violencia. Esa violencia las acaba consumiendo.

El proyecto

En Armando.info, el sitio venezolano de periodismo de investigación, nos proponemos con aliados mexicanos poner a la luz esos casos y revelar la organización que está detrás de ese comercio de cuerpos y sueños.´

La colecta

Por su carácter binacional y los requerimientos de una cobertura riesgosa y precisa, este proyecto necesita recursos. Intentamos reunir un monto de US$ 4,000.oo, que se usarán para la contratación de reporteros locales, gastos de viajes y dispositivos de seguridad. Si pasamos esa meta, cualquier saldo sobrante lo reutilizaremos para cubrir otra historia mexicano-venezolana, que ya tenemos definida, pero que se hará conocer oportunamente.

Cómo puedes ayudar

Si quieres conocer esta historia, dona lo que puedas. Cualquier cantidad sirve para hacer periodismo, lo que equivale a decir: para saber la verdad.
Why Are Venezuelan Girls
Getting Killed?
If you want to know this
story, make the donation of your choice. Any amount is good to do journalism,
which is equivalent to saying: to know the truth.
They left in pursuit of a
dream, but ended up in a nightmare. Help us find out how and why.
The story
They have been murdered in
Guadalajara and Juarez City. But for the most part, they are exploited daily in
nightclubs of any Mexican city. Venezuelan ambitious good-looking girls put
themselves on the Mexican market to work as models, but end up feeding the
table dancing business. Whether in luxurious clubs or in dives, they often work
for criminal networks that manage violence. In the end, they are consumed by
this violence.
The project
In Armando.info, the
Venezuelan website for investigative journalism, our goal is to, with Mexican
Allies,<span>  bring these cases to light and
reveal the organization behind this trade of bodies and dreams.
The donation
Due to its binational
nature and its requirements of an accurate and rigorous coverage, this project
needs resources. We are trying to collect € 3, 671.07, which are going to be used
in the hiring of local reporters, travel expenses and safety equipment. If we
surpass that goal, any surplus will be reutilize in the coverage of another
Mexico-Venezuela story, which is already defined, but will be made public in
due time.
Thank you for your support

""Incredible. Unlike any book I've read on depression.""
-Joseph Earsom
The Gist
• We are getting more men involved in the public discussion about depression and mental illness. In a nutshell, we are fighting stigma.

• There are few books specifically about Male Depression, a secretive yet prevalent disease that affects the majority of Americans either directly or indirectly. Those books that do exist are primarily written by healthcare professionals - not by the survivors.
• That lack of material exists not because of an absence of a market but because very few men are willing to talk about it. Suicide rates among men are at an all-time high.
• I successfully published the memoir Van Gogh in Peppers to fill that void, battling against the stigma in a new way.
column7: pageNumber=1"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">Reviewers have been overwhelmingly positive (on Amazon, for instance). Prior to publication, the book went three rounds with editor Amy Butcher of ArtsyFartsy Copyediting.

column1:
“Christopher's honest, authentic, and courageous journey battling depression and other linked problems, such as dysfunctional relationships, self-defeating thoughts, anger, unhealthy lifestyle habits and substance abuse, normalizes what other men face and signals that they are no longer alone.”
-Rachel Dack, MS, LCPC, NCC
Exactly What The Book Needs
The book is evolving from online distribution (Amazon.com and Barnes&
column2: Noble.com) to universal distribution (Indie book sellers and mainstream brick and mortars). This will allow our mission to reach more men (and their families) in need.

column1:
We are also finishing an outstanding audiobook performed by stage actor Henry McNulty (excerpt available below).

  • $250 moves us from Createspace to Ingram Spark, allowing book stores to order copies with a reasonable margin. This includes purchasing the necessary ISBN from Bowker and the associated fees at Ingram.

• $1000 goes directly toward the audiobook production. Professional quality and strong voice acting is paramount to the success of this media. This price is mid-range, and the details of audiobook costs are found in the Gallery tab.
• Any extra funds will go toward marketing at Indie book sellers.
• If we don't meet our entire goal, we press on. We're on a mission to save lives, restore families, and offer solidarity - and that won't stop. Ordered Perks will still be shipped out, no problem.

<blockquote>
""Your book provides an excellent format for a discussion on depression in men
- and sets the stage to question why many men attempt to ""go it
alone"" in handling depression (and to determine best ways to overcome this
obstacle). Van Gogh in Peppers also offers great clinical applicability, as you
paint a vivid picture of male depression that is consistent with how men very
often present in treatment.""
-Dr. Marla Reis, Ph.D.
The Big Why
While considering contributing to this campaign, bear in mind its goals:
<ol>
• to encourage men with mental health concerns to begin “talking about it”
<li>
to showcase symptoms of Major Depressive Disorder that are not considered “depressive” by the general public (anger, anxiety, substance abuse)
• to tell a great story, appealing to men (and their loved ones) of any reading level
• to give 2% of sales from all media toward mental health advocacy (already in action here)
<ul>
If you share these goals, please review our Perks!

OVERVIEW

The African American Folklorist newspaper is distributed by the Jack Dappa Blues Heritage Preservation Foundation. Founded by Lamont Jack Pearley and co-founder Denise Pearley, the newspaper went from idea to reality with a group of great people.  Our organization felt the urgency to raise cultural and ethnic awareness of the Black Experience in America. We wrote and printed the first two issues. 

We need your help to ensure that the voices representing the many cultures, traditions, and expressions of the people can continue to be heard and shared. Our print newspaper serves readers in America, London, and Canada. 

What is The African American Folklorist?

The African American Folklorist is a quarterly Newspaper that contains articles about traditions, traditional beliefs, the cultural context, geographical locations, music, and vernaculars of African Americans and the role each element plays in the lives of the people past and present. AAF furthers the mission of Jack Dappa Blues Heritage Preservation by publishing articles that discuss the evolution of our traditions, and that present research about blues people. We include interviews with and articles from musicians, historians, ethnographers, Community Scholars, and academics who specialize in and are enthusiastic about the Black Experience in America. AAF includes a variety of perspectives on the black experience and seeks to educate and share perspectives with people of all colors.  We also are proud to incorporate youth that show interest in studying, researching, and preserving our heritage. There is an entire section dedicated to them called the ""African American Folklorist Kids &
column2:
Youth Section,"" which publishes articles and research papers from young people aged 10-17.​

What We Need &

column1: • We are looking to raise $10,000 to cover costs for the next year of issues for The African American Folklorist Newspaper - taking us from March 2021 through March 2022.
<li>
By contributing to The AAF you will
<ul>
• help catapult a significant publication from the ground floor up and
• receive some cool perks that include but aren't limited to special thank you videos, year-long subscriptions, shout-outs in upcoming issues and more.
IMPACT
• Currently The African American Folklorist contributing writers  and columnists are volunteering their time and content. With your help, we can pay stipends.
• Your donation will allow us to expand our reach within and outside of the United States.
Risks &
• $10,000 will help us get going, but it won't last forever.

• Our ultimate goal for The African American Folklorist is to develop enough revenue from partnerships with local and national vendors via sponsored advertising, content creation, and monthly publication.

• We need to continue printing our product, attract a bigger following, and develop our reputation. We'll be using this campaign to help potential sponsors and advertisers see why they should be part of The African American Folklorist.

Other Ways You Can Help

If money is tight...
• Reach out to us about being a contributing writer!
• Spread the word by sharing our campaign with people who might be interested in helping us make our goal, or even take it further.
• Subscribe, SHARE, COMMENT!

Who are the founders?

Lamont Jack Pearley

FOUNDER/PUBLISHER/EDITOR

As an NYC-born descendant of the Great Migration, Lamont's life changed dramatically in the mid-2000s when he returned to Louisiana and Mississippi to bury close relatives. Returning to those regions and their deep associations with Blues history, he felt the urgency to raise cultural and ethnic awareness of African American Traditional Music as it pertains to the Black Experience in America. Over the last 12 years, Lamont's work documenting African American vernacular narratives, music, and cultures resulted in an extensive collection of field interviews with historians, documentarians, blues and folk musicians, and the children of Black music legends. This body of work earned him an induction into the New York Blues Hall of Fame as Great Blues Historian and TV/Radio Producer (2017) and Great Blues Artist (2018).

Denise Pearley

CO-FOUNDER/PROJECT MANAGER

Coming from a background in restaurant management with a degree in Digital Film and Multi-Media and now an entrepreneur, Denise has applied those skills to the production of Jack Dappa Blues Public Media content, as well as a healthy plant-based cooking regimen that heightens the energy necessary for the team to work full-throttle on programming and projects that resonate with the African American Folklorist Newspaper audience.

Contributing Writers

Virginia Jimenez

Virginia is a performing arts educator and writer in NYC. She’s a co-director for Blues Dance New York, where she invests her love of blues music and blues dance in order to share it with others.

Michael Jones

Michael is an author and journalist whose research and writing reclaims the African American Traditions and music popularized in Kentucky and traveled the world.

Nascha A. Joli

Nascha is an African-American author from Harlem in New York City. She has released her debut novel, Smoke Gets In Your Eyes.

Doug Curry

column3:
BLUES since 1982, airing Friday’s 9 pm-midnight EST at www.wrur.org, and Saturday’s 10-11 pm CST at www.wdcb.org.”

Courtland W. Hankins, III

The President of Hip Hop is a music producer, activist, and teacher.

Karleton Thomas

Karleton Thomas is a business professional with extensive experience in retail, eCommerce, apparel manufacturing, and social enterprises. He previously was the chief operating officer at LocalLux, a high-end boutique marketplace, and a sales director for an Alexandria, Va. based tech company.

Chief Elwin Warhorse Gillum

Queen of Tchefuncta Nation and the Chief of the Chahta Tribe. As appointed by the 365 Elders (Blood Members) of the Tribe, she was appointed the Chief of the Tribe in 1998 and took the throne of the Nation in 2009.

Columnists

Corey Harris

Guitarist, Songwriter, Singer, Performer and Revolutionary, Corey Harris is a current Black Traditional Music Practitioner. Corey Harris has earned substantial critical acclaim as one of the few contemporary bluesmen able to channel the raw, direct emotion of acoustic Delta blues without coming off as an authenticity-obsessed historian. He's also a Graduate Teaching Assistant at the University of Virginia, prophet at E.A.B.I.C, and Founder/CEO/Owner at Nattyworks.

Kids and Youth Section Columnists

Lamont Pearley Jr.

Lamont Pearley Jr. is a 13 years old columnist for the African American Folklorist newspaper kids section. He is a coder and gamer that records and edits his own videos.  Lamont enjoys drawing and having fun with his family, all while working to uplift and encourage all those he encounters. 

Gideon Wiesen 

A native New Yorker from Inwood, 10-year-old Gideon Wiesen loves to use his imagination and needs to listen to music constantly when he works. He's inspired by the graphic novels he reads and loves dogs, especially his pitbull, Sheridan, who proofreads all his work.

Samara Pearley

Samara Pearley is a young columnist for the African American folklorist kids section. She is a student of arts and culture currently learning to play the piano while working with her vocal/acting coach. She writes songs and poems, and love llamas and alpacas. Samara thinks llamas are cute and has two stuffed llamas named q.t. and j.t.! Samara loves singing and acting!

THE CAUSE

10 million+ young black boys. In chains. Bound up. Held down by a master unseen. Unable to flex their power within. Born into plenty yet left scraping for leavings. With every step the same message rings.
""You can't make it.""
""You shouldn't try.""
""Not meant for people like you.""
Living the dream but selling the nightmare. Fear is the master while hope is rejected.
Ignorance persists while my people perish.
The unfortunate story of our days.
It ought not to be so.
Quoting the American Enterprise Institute and the Institute for Family Studies' Report on Black Men Making it in America:

""More than one-in-two black men (57%) have made it into the middle class or higher as adults today, up from 38% in 1960, according to a new analysis of Census data. And the share of black men who are poor has fallen from 41% in 1960 to 18% in 2016. So, a substantial share of black men in America are realizing the American Dream—at least financially—and a clear majority are not poor.""

""Black men who score above average in their sense of agency— measured by reports that they are directing the course of their lives versus feeling like they are not in control of their lives—as young men or teenagers in the late 1970s are more likely to be prosperous as fifty-something men in the 2010s""
https://www.aei.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/BlackMenMakingItInAmerica-Final_062218.pdf
Need I say more?
THE MESSAGE
There is another story our boys need to hear. Another message.
It is the message of success. The message of hope.
The untold stories of BLACK MEN MAKING IT IN AMERICA.
This initial book contains 100 stories of success of black men from all walks of life. Some you may know and some you may have never heard of.
Read it to your boys. Have them read it. Purchase it for your neighborhood kids.
Help change the rhetoric. Show them these men made it. Tell them
“They did it. Therefore YOU CAN!”
History will remember not only those who buried the stories of these hardworking, successful black men, but also those, like you, who played a part in spreading this message of hope.
Will you join me spread hope today?
THE AUTHOR
I am a Registered Nurse raising 3 black boys in Bailey, North Carolina, where I reside with my husband. (Read more about me here: https://quintacaylor.com/)

If you’ve ever raised boys, you know how inquisitive they can be. This past year has left us answering so many questions. Watching their confusion as they see things not adding up. What they were being ‘told’ by society and what they have known to be true conflicted.
There is no disagreeing that in today’s world of the fight for racial equity, social justice is being confused for the discarding of personal responsibility.

We have watched as the efforts of countless hardworking black men are being discounted with statement such as ""You can't make it as a black man in America"". Not only that, but salient messages are being passed on to our young black men - to shirk hard work and personal responsibility in favor of handouts that always leaves them at the level of less than.

After answering question after question and telling our boys story upon story of one successful black man after another, we decided many more black boys needed to hear this. Maybe, just maybe, we can help the cause for black boys in a more practical way.
This therefore, is our shooting-2-birds-with-one-stone strategy. Read our impact story to find out more.
THE REWARDS
Here is what we are trying to raise and why:
<ul>
•  We hope to raise at least $25,000
<li>75% of the funds are going to 3 organizations addressing root causes and other practical solutions in the black community as follows:<ul>
• 25% to 100 Black Men of America https://100blackmen.org/ - successful black men mentoring youth across America
• 25% to Fathers Incorporated https://www.fathersincorporated.com/ - national organization working to ensure the rights and inclusion of fathers in the lives of their children
• 25% to Cross Assembly Foster Parenting Program https://crossassembly.org/foster - local organization working to bring hope and change to the lives of children and teens across our local community.
• 25% goes to book publication cost and fees
What You Get
<ul>
• $27: 1 paperback book
• $40: 1 hardback book
• $200: 10 paperback books
• $300: 10 hardback books
• $10: 1 electronic book
THE IMPACT
He who controls the story, controls history.
We can rewrite history starting today. Your purchase/contribution today will help
<ul>
• Shine the light on the successes of black men in America
• Paint a picture of the future for black boys in America, especially for those with no role models present
• Contribute to practical, long-lasting change in providing mentors, present fathers and temporary families for those children who need it.
Other Ways You Can Help
Times are hard. We know. Help spread the word if you cannot contribute (and even if you contribute, do spread the word as well)
<ul>
• Share this campaign on your personal social media and community groups
• Point us to men you know whose stories of success need to be told
• Hit the share button and help spread some HOPE!

Why am I writing this book.....

The short answer is.....it's a dream of mine !  I am not an author but I consider myself an artist . I am a photographer by trade but in my spare time I love to paint with acrylics and oils more than anything.  Originally I wanted to write this book about 20 years ago.  I remember sitting in my car with my laptop, watching my youngest son practice flag football, when I started writing this exact story.  Unfortunately after that day I never wrote again.  Life takes over and we set our dreams aside, however now is the time to make my dream come true.

The story is based off a dream I had over 20 years ago, a very vivid dream.  I have always been a person who dreams in detail and I actually remember most of my dreams after I wake up.  This story is one that has stuck with me for a long time as you can see.  I recently decide that is was time!  Time to start this book and share it with the world.

I am very excited about this book because it will be so much better now than it would have been if I had wrote it 20 years ago.  The characters are much more complex, the storyline is more exciting, the twists and turns will keep you wanting more!  I am hoping that this will be a 3 book series.
The Story.....

Maria is a beautiful, middle aged woman who wakes up from a coma that she has been in for about a month.  She learns that she has amnesia from being in a tragic car accident.  The family doctor puts Maria on medication to help with her memory loss but is told she may never recover her past memories.  As time goes on, she learns he has a loving and protective husband, a housekeeper who is not only a friend but a mother figure, and a small group of devoted 'friends.'  From the very beginning she struggles to figure out how to live a normal life again.  Struggling to trust the people around her, she starts questioning everything when she comes across old photographs, hidden rooms in her house and questionable stories from her 'friends.'  Eventually Maria learns about her true medical condition, her husbands criminal business in human trafficking and her former life.
My Goal.....

My goal is to self-publish versus traditional publishing.  Self-publishing is more costly for me upfront but it provides me with more control over what happens with my book such as the platforms it will be sold on and the marketing of the book.  I plan on having hard copies printed, ebooks made and eventually audio books.  The printed book will be 6x9.
Potential Book Cover.....
Money raised will go towards the following.....
1.  The Editor - To revise and publish book.
2.  The Cover Design of my Book - the mockup you see currently is a possible cover.
3.  The Layout Design - for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats).
4.  The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
5.  The Launch &
column2: Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish.  Goal date is by January 2021.

column1: Risks and Challenges.....

The risks are minimal.  My book is a little over half way written.  I am determined to finish writing within the next month or two so that I can move on to having it edited and formatted.  The main risk is if something would happen to me to where I could not finish the book or that I have to find another way to help fund the book.
A Big Thank You !.....

First I want to say thank you for considering my campaign!  When I started to write this book all I thought about was that I was going to make my dreams come true, I started writing, got through a few chapters and realized I needed to research the costs and the best ways to publish.  I never considered the price tag of putting my book out into the world!  I also found out the unbelievably low chance I had of a traditional publishing house accepting and printing my book without a literary agent.  I have thought about many options to save money, such as binding the book myself, developing a new and unique way to print my book but the fact is that there are no low cost options.  Self-publishing is the cheapest way to go for my first book.
Thank you again for helping me!  I look forward to hearing your feedback.
Dena McDonald

Launch Party Information:

For those living in Prague, donating 95kc ($4) will get you into Chapeau Rouge on April 23rd for the launch party (100kc if you pay at the door) and will register you for a ticket that could win you a prize! We will have tons of great prizes that you can win including magazine copies, free workshops, tours, gifts and more!

All donations will go towards printing the magazine and startup costs. 

For those not in Prague:

We wish you could make it to the launch, but you can still sponsor a ticket through donation and support the magazine from afar. Right now all expenses are being paid out of pocket by Prague Pulse staff so your donations will go towards printing and start up expenses. We appreciate every amount, even $1 goes a long way in Prague.

About Prague Pulse:

Prague Pulse is a non-profit monthly magazine founded by English speaking creatives based in Prague to serve as an outlet for the expansive community of expats, tourists, and Czech natives living in the city that have stories to tell. We focus on social, cultural, and political events around the Czech Republic as well as covering issues of life abroad and travel.

Our first issue was released April 15th. Please take a look at it on our website: www.praguepulse.org

We want to keep this project going so we can engage and support the large creative community here while giving those outside of Prague an insight into life in the Czech Republic.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donating funds is not the only way you can help Prague Pulse! There are so many other things you can do to grow our project. Some suggestions...

  • Read the magazine! We will have a new issue each month on our website. 
  • Like us on facebook for updates, behind-the-publication photos, and more. And check out our Instagram @praguepulse
• Tell your friends about Prague Pulse Magazine!

Hi I'm Fergal and I've never done anything like this before, but after a few family scares and lots of soul searching about life and family and how life is not a dress rehearsal and all that lark, I decided I'd like to do something positive, something constructive, I was chatting to my mum whilst busy tinkering along in the kitchen and noted the old tattered orange copy book that only comes out at  Christmas or that time of year when the jams need to be made during the summer and autumn, now I've never had much interest in baking but this day I decided i'd give my mother a hand and in conversation and much questioning about the history of the old tattered copybook the seed was planted.

Now this book was handwritten by my Granny back in the late 20's and thirties, with not only her recipes but other people from the same era and locality, I'm sure many of these recipes are unique for the small Irish town I come from...

I'd like to create a book that immortalises those recipes  bring them to life in a book that is easy to follow by young and old, full of pictures and tips on how to make a good cake and a fine jam, be it strawberry, gooseberry, marmalade or indeed a unique Christmas cake and variants of it.

What I'm looking for in this campaign is not only to raise funds to publish the book but to bake the contents and make sure that these recipes are given the due care and respect they deserve before publishing and sharing with the world, so that when the book does make it to the shelf, it is of the highest quality and the imagery of the contents will make your mouth water and ooze with a temptation to bake whats there.
I'm looking for £4000 to create, bake and publish this unique book of variants of  60 odd recipes from a generation that is no longer with us.

Some of the money will go into purchasing the ingredients and to bring the recipes to life,  Some will go towards a specialist to put these recipes together for those finer touches... not sure my 80-year-old mum is able anymore.
I would like to film the process get it up on youtube and ensure the photographs are of the highest quality, leaving the publishing, editing and refining of the book for the remainder.
Any monies left over from this will be donated to fighting blindness.
Anyone who donates and pending how much will get a copy of the book so I'd like to do this justice not only for Granny but for you guys as well.

Indeed if you can't donate to the funds but you have publishing, editing, youtube baking experience all help is welcome to make this a success...

I'm Looking forward to the challenges and culinary journey ahead...

Are you ready for this?

Who are we?

         My name is Paige, I'm a single mother living in Austin Texas. As I mention above my co-author’s name is Jason. He is a 'Sugar Daddy' who is also on the same dating site. He lives on the other side of the country, and is sharing his experiences from the other side of the sugaring rabbit hole. Having the opportunity to hear a male’s opinions, stories, and thoughts about this unique dating world is quite rare and isn’t something I’ve seen before. When he agreed to write about this provocative and exclusive society from a male’s perspective, I was very excited! Reading some of Jason's stories helped me understand how unique a man’s mind is and learn more about how men’s minds work in general...and trust me...it's much different than how us ladies think.   Within the pages of this book, the two of us will share stories that involve every scenario you can think of. From Skype dates, to million dollar penthouses, fast cars, first dates to Belize, strip clubs, boats, and late night parties of three (or four). Even moments of intimacy, love and matters of the heart. I don't want to glamorize this lifestyle, because I wouldn't wish it on anybody, but I wouldn't change that year for anything. This was a bittersweet moment in my life. It was equally as magical as it was cold. You are about to hear true stories about what both of us went through  as we embarked on this unique dating journey.

Who are we?

Excerpt from Chapter 1:

         ""For the most part, when looking at the profile of a 'sugar daddy', it basically lists their financial status, relationship status, and what they are looking for. Almost every man selected 'Single' or 'Separated', and you would see an occasional 'Married but looking.'  Most men’s profiles had a private picture that you had to request to see, obviously because they were married or had an important job title. At first, I was answering messages from men, about 20 a day, and attempting to figure out how all of this works. I quickly realized that we were knee deep in a very different type of dating situation.  The things that happened over the next 7 months were so incredibly unbelievable, that I quickly started taking notes about my dates. I knew I wanted to write a book sometime around the 3rd 'Sugar Daddy' that I dated.""

 

Sugaring

           Being a ""sugar baby"" definitely had these moments of glamour and fun. I went to Belize on a first date, was wined and dined constantly, and was made to feel special every time I went out with these men. But then there are these moments of loneliness when they go home to their wives, never contact you unless they want something, or when you meet one that treats you like an object. This was a life changing journey that made me learn a lot about myself. I also learned a lot about men, and how their minds work. I became cynical after a while, and felt a bit skeptical about love.  I also became more keen in my abilities to know who was decent. That time period helped me to become a very happy and confident woman. Hopefully, our stories will make you laugh, but they will also make you cringe.  

Challenges

              The biggest challenge we are facing is how we can tell a true version of our story without hurting the people who love us. There is a stigma surrounding this type of relationship, and stories that we don't regret, but aren't proud of. So keeping ourselves anonymous is the biggest obstacle on this journey so far. We have children to consider, and they mean much more to us than fame. The crowd funding sites stress that the biggest network of backers come from a large support system of family and friends. Not wanting anyone to know we are doing this has proven very difficult when attempting a crowd fun. This is why we need your help! Please share and help us out!

 

Reason for funding         

   We looked into the publishing options.  For us, self-publishing the book will be more rewarding. We aren't printing a million copies so our cost per book is higher than we anticipated.  A run of 3,000 books - with editors, artists, promoting, and other marketing costs included - is nearly $10 per book.  We are not looking for fame and fortune, we simply want to have a successful book that everyone enjoys, and to have a more hands on experience.

               This is our ""test the waters"" approach and a crowd funding experiment in a way.   What we do next depends a lot on how this campaign goes.  We need your help to gauge interest and in return we are delivering to you a work unlike any other! We have shared several chapters with both strangers, and close friends, and are very confident that it can be very successful given the right tools to promote and get the book noticed. With your help, we can make this happen! 

Perks for your help

           To say ""thank you"", we have some really interesting perks for your support. Some of them include pre-releases chapters, un-released chapters, a skype call Q&
column2:
A with the authors, a launch party invitation, a marked rough draft of the entire book, and even the chance to name a character after yourself!  Any help we receive over $20 will also receive an autographed hard back copy of the book! Lets make this happen!

In the mid-1980s, two years out of college, I moved into a squatted house in West Berlin, Germany.  My first house, Potsdamer str. 130, was populated by a vibrant community of journalists, activists, artists and teachers who had all come to this city to escape the toxic silence of the holocaust generation.

Germany was an unlikely place for a half black, half Jewish American to find herself, but I was powerfully drawn to this 'alternative' scene of people who were willing to confront their country's dark history in a way I had never seen people in the United States do.

The people at Potsdamer str. 130 had come to Berlin to heal and reshape the social and political conversation of their country. Potsdamer str. 130 was part of a network of occupied houses and communities established throughout the city.

After living in Berlin from 1985 through 1991 and witnessing the fall of the Wall, I realized that I could no longer ignore or sidestep the unresolved issues of race and history in my own country. These were the stories that mattered most to me
column2: the stories I had to tell and the realities I needed to confront.

column1: In 2011, I published my first book, Great Space of Desire: Writing for Personal Evolution, a memoir and creative writing guide for people who want to learn how to tell their own stories.

Now, in Occupy Berlin, I’m returning to the city that captured my heart, to learn the fuller stories of some of the most fascinating people I've ever known and to find out what parts of their alternative vision succeeded what failed.

Some of the people I intend to interview were important figures in creating the Alternative movement and are now prominent journalists in Berlin and Hamburg.  Others are active in the Initiative of Black Germans (ISD).  Yet others are artists involved in nurturing various art spaces throughout the city.
One of the big questions that Occupy Berlin will explore is this: what can Americans learn about our own history from this amazing time and place?
Your Donation Will Support
<ul>

column2: travel costs to collect interviews and write the book

column1: • Editing
<li>Layout &amp
What Happens Next
For anyone who makes a donation, whatever the amount, I will keep you updated by newsletter on the progress and interesting developments of this project.
And Next

After the book is finished, I'm taking it on the road to colleges, coffee houses and all sorts of groups across this country to share  these amazing stories and create discussions about what's possible when people are willing to confront their history and fully occupy their stories.
How You Can Help
Please donate whatever amount you can manage. Tell your friends about this campaign and please SHARE on Social Media.
Become a member of the #OccupyBerlin Support Network and together let's get this conversation started!

column1: In 2011, I published my first book, Great Space of Desire: Writing for Personal Evolution, a memoir and creative writing guide for people who want to learn how to tell their own stories.

Now, in Occupy Berlin, I’m returning to the city that captured my heart, to learn the fuller stories of some of the most fascinating people I've ever known and to find out what parts of their alternative vision succeeded what failed.

Some of the people I intend to interview were important figures in creating the Alternative movement and are now prominent journalists in Berlin and Hamburg.  Others are active in the Initiative of Black Germans (ISD).  Yet others are artists involved in nurturing various art spaces throughout the city.
One of the big questions that Occupy Berlin will explore is this: what can Americans learn about our own history from this amazing time and place?
Your Donation Will Support
Time & travel costs to collect interviews and write the book
Editing
Layout & cover-design
What Happens Next
For anyone who makes a donation, whatever the amount, I will keep you updated by newsletter on the progress and interesting developments of this project.
And Next

After the book is finished, I'm taking it on the road to colleges, coffee houses and all sorts of groups across this country to share  these amazing stories and create discussions about what's possible when people are willing to confront their history and fully occupy their stories.
How You Can Help
Please donate whatever amount you can manage. Tell your friends about this campaign and please SHARE on Social Media.
Become a member of the #OccupyBerlin Support Network and together let's get this conversation started!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column2: >Story story - The Book of Job
column4: >The book of Job is considered by many to be the oldest book in the Bible. In it, Job, a very rich and godly man, lost all his material possessions, all his children, and his health in a matter of minutes. Adding pain upon pain, his wife gave him no support and his three closest friends condemned him rather than consoled him. Job very much wished to meet-up with God and present his arguments against God Himself. Yet, even God seemed to be ignoring Job.
column5: >When God eventually came, His response to Job’s questions and pleas was rather unexpected and intriguing. And Job’s final words to God were
column6: >“I had only heard about you before, but now I have seen you with my own eyes. I take back everything I said …”.
column7: >So, what could have God possibly said to Job to make him take back every ‘sound’ argument he previously prepared?
column8:
>Can a child, whose parents are going through a divorce and doesn’t understand why this is happening to her, eventually say to God “… now I have seen you with my own eyes… “? Or can the 7 year old, who is punished by his parents for a fault he didn’t commit relate to Job’s story? Or as Job was continuously asking the reason for his suffering, is it possible to explain the ‘why’ of a child for his mother’s death?  

 

In July 2014, I took up on the task of teaching this book to children aged 7 – 9 years at a Sunday school, at which I have been serving for more than five years. The book contains tough and seemingly contradictory concepts, which made the challenge of teaching the book of Job to children very daunting. Yet, with the grace of the God of Job I began.

My journey of teaching (and learning) the book took around 15 Sundays. Every week’s lesson was very lively, beautifully challenging, and highly enlightening for all of us. By using the book of Job as our torchlight, we were able to understand: the mystery of unmerited misery
column9: how to console our friends who are sad
column10: maintaining hope and integrity amidst suffering
column11:
and even rejoicing in the middle of all the pain we are facing.

I documented each of the role plays, stories, games, puzzles, audio-visuals, home take exercises and activities I used for all the lessons. I hoped that one day, I would be able to compile all these and publish it as a parents’ guide. That day has never been this closer. Moreover, the compilation evolved into both a parents’ guide and a story book.

Story book  

Children aged 6 – 10 were read paragraphs of the story of Job and they made drawings for each of these paragraphs. These drawings were then used to develop concepts for the illustrations of the story book. These concepts were further refined maintaining the initial concepts so that the children reading the story can relate to it.

Story of Job – Parents’/Teachers’ guide

The parents’ guide, that can also be used by Sunday school teachers, comprises of 14 lessons. By tapping into the world of childhood, that of games, puzzles, role plays, and activities, it allows parents to teach the different concepts addressed by the book of Job.

The guide also contains a complementary CD based on the last chapters of the book of Job. These are the chapters at which God started responding to Job, taking him on a tour of His creation and the CD contains an audio-visual representation of God’s response. 

 

What have we done so far?

column1: • Text – The lessons have already been conducted with children and their effectiveness proven. In addition, the book has passed through multiple proof readings by an early childhood education expert and a veteran Sunday school teacher.

• Illustration – For each of the paragraphs of the story, a minimum of four concept drawings were done by children. Based on the commonalities of the children’s drawings, all the illustrations for the storybook were then drafted, refined, and completed.
• Design - Numerous revisions were made on the design, resulting in a beautiful final production-ready package, thanks to the talented graphic designer and awesome creative director.

• CD (God spoke CD) – High quality footages and images were sought for, corresponding to the different elements that God mentions while responding to Job. The narration has already been recorded, the CD edited and finalized.

What remains?

The final stride – production

The objective of this campaign is to cover the production cost for 5000 copies of this package. By doing this, it is my aim to significantly reduce the retail price to as low as $4 per package. Hence, your contribution will allow a quality package to be available to more families, for whom it might otherwise have been expensive to buy. More so, you are partners in a project which aims to simplify and breakdown difficult and challenging concepts to children.

And if more funds are secured, I’ll work on other segments of the project: translations into another local language and English, so that it reaches even more families
column2: and even preparing the next book in line, which I’m currently teaching :).

RooakNews is a new independent news corporation. It is one of very few not owned and operated by the 6 major media corporations who control over 90% of the media produced today. We are fighting an uphill battle, but one we hope will bring the public to the truth of what is actually going on in our nation.

Rooak in Hebrew means breath or wind. More specifically, the breath of God. When God created Adam, he laid before him as flesh molded from dust. He had form. Eyes, nose, lungs, heart, etc. He did not have life. God breathed His life inside of him and that is when Adam came to life. The word used in the original text is “rooh-ahk”. It is what separates mankind from the rest of creation. We are the only ones, out of all of creation, that God breathed His life into. Our highest calling is to use this breath, this life, and return it back to the one who gave it to us.

The work we’re doing at RooakNews is meant to breath life into our readers. Bring them to an understanding and a hope for the future. Yes, the articles are about how our nation is in the process of bringing a powerful, evil cabal down and shedding light on things that we have not been told by the major media networks. They will ultimately reveal the deepest, darkest parts of our humanity. We all need to know there is still hope.

The rooak of God is still in us. And with our voice (those who are helping to produce the content you find through RooakNews), we’re setting out to show our audience their’s.

We live in a moment in time that is unparalleled.  Let us all rise to the occasion and show how beautiful we, as humanity, can be.

Why Fairies?
<ul>

• My name is Persephone Vandegrift. I am an award-winning screenwriter, playwright, filmmaker and have been a loyal fan of the fairy realm since a little girl. I've been writing fairy stories for many years and am passionate about publishing a book series that inspires, amuses, intrigues, and entertains other fairy fans around the world. We know you're out there!

• Contributing to The Very Fairy Series will bring this long-awaited dream to fruition. The only path open to us to achieve this is self-publishing. Our goal is to get our 1st book, Rosehip: A Very Curious Fairy, to its feet, out into the world, and generate enough interest that will help us publish the rest of the series. All books in the series will be published as an ebook and print.

• Knowing this series will be in the hands, the laps, on the nightstands, bookcases, and on the Kindles, will be a dream come true for me, my illustrator, and fairy fans worldwide. Supporting campaigns creates an unforgettable community. Fans of the series will always be with us every step of the way.
Where are the fairy funds going?
<ul>
• Every penny of the $3K raised will be invested in the 1st book, Rosehip: A Very Curious Fairy.

• Costs: The initial expense is hiring someone to format Rosehip (ebook and print files) - costs @ $600. We also would like to pay our illustrator for his amazing and tireless hard work, and help cover the administrative, advertising and marketing costs ($900).
• We'd like to be able to hire a website designer and a social media/book marketing professional ($1500) so we can focus on finishing the rest of the books in the series.

• I have written/produced two of my short films (All Things Hidden and The Last Light) by crowdfunding. We could not have done that, or continue to try and achieve these dreams, without the world's support.
Fairy Perks...Did we mention those?
<ul>
• We have an array of fun fairy perks! We'll have original artwork by Rosehip illustrator, Kristijan Vostner, hand-made items, pillows, totes, cakes, fairy wands, shirts, and yes, even FAIRY HOUSES!

• We want to make this fun, imaginative, creative, inspiring, and worthwhile. We want it to be something you all will look forward to seeing out there. We want you to be able to point and say - 'I helped make that happen.'

• We know raising funds isn't easy. If we don't raise the entire amount, whatever we raise will put towards getting Rosehip available for purchase. Whatever Perks were picked up will be fulfilled, and if we have to wait on the website, marketing, etc. then that's what we'll do!
• If you have any services you'd like to offer us, we'd be fairy relieved for any help.
<h3>Fairy Stretch-Goals &amp
• We'd love the series to be successful and have a positive, inspiring impact. The more we raise, the more we can do! If we can meet and beat our goal, we'd love to do a few more fairy things:
If we can raise over $3K:
<ul>
• We'd LOVE to animate the stories! And everyone we've talked to about the series wants us to animate it too!
•  Hire a composer to create magical music while reading the ebook!
• To take the book into schools and bring a little magic to kids and help them create their own fairy houses and pictures.
The Very Fairy Impact

For centuries, writers have given us a plethora of magical, intriguing, and timeless stories of fairies, elves, gnomes, trolls, pixies, brownies, devas, ballybogs, selkies, will o'wisps, merpeople (the list could go on). Those stories are what inspired me to write my own. Whether you've had a run-in with a fairy or not, their lore is enchanting, quirky, and mysterious.  This is what I aim to capture in The Very Fairy Series.
<ul><li>

What this series has to offer? The stories are engaging, positive, interactive, humorous, and thoughtful. The artwork is truly exceptional. Print books will include coloring pages so that you can feel like you are a part of the story and add your color to the world.
Fairy Challenges

Finding a traditional publisher over the past couple years has been impossible. Self-publishing allows the impossible to become possible. The product is available immediately and no more waiting for permission to see the light of day.
Fairy Help
We realize not everyone can contribute funds. You can help the series by sharing the campaign link around the world via email, Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn - or wherever you find a fairy friend!
<ul>
• The more noise we make, the more we can make this series happen!
• IndieGoGo has some wonderful sharing tools - check them out!
Thank you fairy infinitely for considering our campaign for your support!
Please pop us a message if you have any questions.

Youth Speaker.  Pastor.  Business Owner. Author.  Husband.  Father.  I have spent the last 20 years of my life working specifically with youth and young adults. As a former Youth Pastor, I know how important it is for students to grab hold of their own faith. I started a non-profit speaking ministry called Passion for Christ Ministries 15 years ago because I am passionate about two things. I am passionate about Jesus and what He has done in my life, and I am passionate about students.

Todays youth are caught in the middle ground of life.  They are not little kids anymore and are growing in their responsibilities.  They are not quite adults able to make every choice for themselves. They have so many voices speaking into their lives at one time and often it can hard to determine which voice is really from God. This is why I believe this book is so important for every student to read. It is packed full of fun illustrations, engaging stories, and practical day to day action steps to help facilitate growth in their walk with God.

How is this book unique?  Most devotionals are short maybe a paragraph or a page leaving students wanting something more in depth.  Each chapter of Rise Above the Noise will take you further than your average devotional, give you more content, and yet will not be so long that you cannot finish it before you go to school each morning.
Partner with me to impact a generation!
I need you!  You are an integral part of my team!  I need your help to spread the word.  Here is what I am looking to do during the launch phase of my book.
Phase #1 Copies upon copies of the devotional.  I need copies to give away, copies for students who cannot afford, and copies for promotions and outreach.
Phase #2 Promotional materials.  Bracelets, t-shirts, website, creating the Rise Above the Noise experience, (a weekend experience based on the contents of the book).

Phase #3 Outreach Initiative.  Promotional packets for youth groups that include all things Rise Above the Noise allowing the group to go through the month together.  Promotional boxes for youth pastors, filled with books and swag to give freely to youth leaders.
Dream Breaker  What happens if we raise more than the target goal?  What happens if you get so caught up in the vision and we raise more money than we initially dreamed?
Dream #1 Create a workbook for students that goes along with each chapter and day to take them further in their walk with God.
Dream #2 Create an accompanying video project to give to youth groups that takes them even further in depth into the themes and ideas of the book.

Dream #3 Create an all inclusive 3 month youth group power pack.  Included would be everything a youth pastor needs to do 3 months worth of lessons, games, discussion questions and icebreakers all geared around the book.
Whats in it for you?

Its just a book right?  I mean why should you give to it anyway?  Because you can help impact the life of a student who may be listening to the wrong voice. Your gift could help get the message that God has into the heart and minds of students everywhere. Also, with your donation you could score a copy of the book for yourself or someone you love.  You could snag some cool swag, or even have an entire Rise Above the Noise weekend experience for your youth ministry.

This is Laura :) She loves Zac Efron (don't get her started), ice cream cake and painting. Her aide, Hannah Lee, and her husband, Hiva Lee, recognized she had a real talent to share. Many people with disabilities have talents that are overlooked, but they realized they could do something about it.  

Hannah and Hiva started Laura's Greetings, a company that allows individuals experiencing disabilities to be artists. Disability is not inability, and the world is slowly beginning to see that! We are proud to present Laura's first collection of greeting cards and are excited to introduce you to our newest designer Aram!
column3:
>

We have a created a subscription service for your convenience. You will receive our cards delivered, straight to your door several times a year, just in time for special occasions and major holidays!

We have offered special Indiegogo rewards at a deal for being some of Laura's customers. We plan to ship all around the world (please be mindful of the duties/shipping arrangements of your respective country), but enjoy free USA domestic shipping on us!

 

Risks and challenges

The risks facing our company are relatively low and we have taken measures to ensure the companies success. The greeting cards, boxes and materials have already been printed and are ready for shipment! Like many consumer products, there is always competition. However, we have a unique subscription model that not only provides convenience but purpose behind every purchase.

Other risks could include supply chain challenges, including hiccups in shipping. However we have an established team of entrepreneurs with experience not only in crowdfunding projects but in sales, distribution and customer service. As our company grows, these risks will be mitigated.

Short Summary

My name is Durale Harper and I am a person who has seen life from the bottom and now I am striving to be the best person I can be. This book is so important to me, because I want people to see that it doesn't matter who you are or where you come from, life happens to everyone, but it's how you stand back up and keep moving forward.  Any supporter who helps with this venture will be supporting me in helping to encourage lives of others through my story.  I know we can say this is just another book and in a way it is, but how many people would be very transparent and give you their life on a platter, in order for you to be encourage to keep going? I am hoping that someone would take the chance on me and help me impact the lives of others.
<h3>What We Need &amp
<ul>
• All funding goes to publishing the book and to help build a website to support it.
• People who support me will not only get a signed copy of the book, but the chance to be at one of the book events that is set up for the book.
• If my goal is missed, then the funds that are donated will go directly to helping me publish the book.
The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:
<ul>

• I believe my calling is to make a positive Impact on this world.  What that looks like, I am still trying to figure out, but God put this book on my heart to share with the world, I just need some help to get it out there.

• I have yet to fail in anything I have done, since I have let God take the lead in my life.  He has allowed me to do so much to serve others in this world and I am grateful that he has chosen me like many others to do so.

• The one thing about me is I'm not afraid to ask for help.  There was a time in my life, where I let pride and stubbornness take over and I tried to do it myself, but those days are over.  I need help and it takes people who are willing to take chances on others like myself to impact the world in a positive way.
<h3>Risks &amp

It can be hard to step out and trust people, this is something I know for certain, but I never stop losing faith in people.  Sometimes in life, people just need that one break, that one opportunity to reach that next level and I'm hoping that people are willing and open to take that chance with me.  the only risk that I see ahead of me, is getting help and getting the book in front of people who need to be encouraged and inspired.
<ul>
• Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
• Describe your plan for solving these challenges.
Other Ways You Can Help

Another way for people to help, is to share this campaign with others.  Sometimes just getting the word out the others is just as big, if not bigger.  Thank you in advance for all of your help.  God Bless.

About United Front Entertainment (UFE)

We are multi-media story tellers based in the Greater Toronto Area. Our team researches, develops, publishes and distributes compelling content. With the assistance of an international team made up of military historians, and scholars based in the UK, UFE is currently developing the untold life-story of Scottish radar pioneer Sir Robert Watson-Watt, and his Canadian wife, Lady Jean Watson-Watt.
UFE was founded by award winning author Bryan Davies, and media/distribution veteran Rob Herholz in 2016.

Bryan was recently in Brechin, Scotland where he met with Sir Robert Watson-Watt expert Steve Nicoll. A retired Royal Marines Major, and Falklands War veteran, Steve recently joined our UFE/Watson-Watt research team.
Rounding out the Sir Robert Watson-Watt research team are Blake Parnham, Rick Parnham and Bruce Richard.
The news of the discovery of the memorabilia collection was so exciting, it captured the attention of a regional newspaper:
https://www.thecourier.co.uk/fp/news/local/angus-mearns/736314/watson-watt-biography-on-horizon-after-canadian-treasure-trove-reveals-personal-story-of-brechin-son/
For more information about UFE please visit:
https://unitedfront.media
<h3>What We Need &amp
<ul>

• We are seeking to secure $70,000 (CAD) in funding to continue the massive task of researching and writing Sir Robert's complete and untold life story. We will be completing, and publishing a minimum of 3 books in 2019-2020.
• We have several wonderful, and exclusive perks that lovers of history, science, technology and biographies will love.

• Once our story has been told, the entire Parnham/Watson-Watt memorabilia collection (assessed at approximately $200,000 USD) will be donated to the people of England and Scotland where it will reside in the appropriate historical institution(s).
The Impact
<ul>
• Our story is international in scope. It will resonate strongly in England, Scotland, and Canada.

• There are hundreds of items in the memorabilia collection that include letters, speeches, articles, medals, and many other documents. The world has never seen or are aware of its contents. They shed incredible light on one of the most complex, and unsung heroes of World War 2.
• Your support will help us make history and bring the Watson-Watt legacy back to its home in the UK.
• The following images are only small sample of what can be found in the Parnham/Watson-Watt Collection:
<h3>Risks &amp

• We do not categorize this project as high-risk. Quite the opposite. The overhead on these projects are low, The funding we are seeking will help us accelerate the writing process, and to maintain the ongoing worldwide marketing and development of this unique and amazing project.
Other Ways You Can Help
• Help us spread the word about our campaign on social media!
• Kindly use the Indiegogo share tools!
• Tell any and all of your friends and family who are history, science and/or military or war buffs about this historic project!

How I Came Up With The Books?

I am Tiffany Williford, the author of ""Daddy Has an Owie"" and ""Mommy Has an Owie"".  

For the last three years I have held these stories close to me. Three years ago, I wrote these books while my late husband was going through chemotherapy to explain to my young daughter her dad’s cancer.

Prior to writing this story, I searched online for books, blogs and at the library for the right words to explain such a serious situation in a simple way for my daughter to understand. I didn't find anything and it created a desire to make something for others.

Your support of this project will mean:  other parents or caregivers may never have to struggle or search for the right words to say to their child, and children will have a story that can help them understand what their parent is going through.
The All-Star Team!

HELP US HELP OTHERS!

Daddy Has an Owie and Mommy Has an Owie has been written and ready to get out to the world for three years now, it’s time! The story is written, illustrations are drawn up and it is now time to make it a book for families.

The goal is to raise $15,000 in 60 days through pre-sales. All contributions will support the book and help the book be a resource to families with young children in need of its dialog and the amazing message it delivers!

 

$15,000 will allow us to:

• $4,000 Publish and print the first run of 1,000 books for Daddy Has an Owie and 1,000 for Mommy Has an Owie. First books will be shared with backers of this campaign and the rest will be initial inventory (mailers, launch kits, in person sales, donation books for families in need).
<li>$5,000 Marketing costs:<ul>
• Websites and hosting
• Social media ads
• Launch event
• Prepacks for hospitals and cancer centers
• Cancer awareness events
• $1,500 Indiegogo platform and holding costs
• $500 Shipping costs
• $4,000 Establish distribution and fulfillment through online retailers such as Amazon and Barnes and Noble with second run of inventory

What you get for your support:

Tier 1: Handwritten thank you card by the author - $10

Tier 2: Thank you on website for being a $25 contributor - $25

Tier 3: A signed copy of DADDY HAS AN OWIE - $35

Tier 4: 2 Books (1 signed copy + 1 with a personal message) of DADDY HAS AN OWIE - $50

Tier 5: 3 Books (2 signed + 1 with a personal message) of DADDY HAS AN OWIE - $75

Tier 6: 5 Books (4 signed + 1 with a personal message) of DADDY HAS AN OWIE - $125

Tier 7: 9 Books (8 signed +1 with a personal message) of DADDY HAS AN OWIE and thank you on website - $250

Tier 8: 30 Books (25 signed + 5 with a personal message) of DADDY HAS AN OWIE + Thank you on website + Handwritten thank you card - $1,000

Tier 9: Author speaking appearance (plus applicable travel fees) - $2,500

Donate a book -

Tier 1: A book donated in your name to a family in need - $30

Tier 2: 4 Books donated in your name to families in need - $100

Tier 3: 15 Books donated in your name to families in need - $300

Tier 4: 25 Books donated in your name to families in need - $500

The Impact

With your help, we will be able to get these books out to the world! Daddy Has an Owie and Mommy Has an Owie will be available to help parents communicate to their children issues of illness and cancer their parent, caregiver or grandparent is going through. The vision is for these books to be a resource for many people that are struggling with this issue.  These books can also serve as a gift to give a family with a loved one newly diagnosed with cancer. The books as a gift, is given in the hopes that the recipient will have one less stress by not having to worry about what words to use for their child to understand cancer but not be fearful. Your help with this campaign will make this a reality.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to contribute or not, spreading the word is so helpful!!! You can support our cause and help spread the word by sharing this pre-sale campaign!  Please share by:
• Share our project on social media – Facebook, Instagram, Twitter…anything you have, we appreciate!
• Tag your friends, if you anyone who should know about our project
• Email campaign to friends
• If you know of or are connected with media outlets that would run a story on this campaign, please send us a message.

You can also follow me on Social Media:

Instagram: @tiffanywilliford_

Facebook: tiffanyhwilliford

Short Summary

Cooking with Keish project is designed to provide food formulas which eliminate the typical triggers for chronic migraines.  As a chronic migraine sufferer since the age of twelve, I began a real journey in trying to determine the cause of the misery in my life AKA The Migraine. I have tried it all and the only consistent remedy has been changing the way I eat.  My goal is to give people who suffer as I do, some relief and tasty food options that the whole family can enjoy!
What We Need &
Ok, here's the breakdown:
<ul>
• We need money for editing and self publishing my cookbook along with advertising and travel and Expo fees for promoting the book.

• This project involves creating a YouTube channel with me actually cooking a few of my recipes and sharing my experiences with various migraine treatments. We need money for better equipment and editing.
• Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
• Every dollar counts so even if we do not reach our goal all donations received will go toward producing as many books as possible and getting it promoted.
The Impact
Your money at work:
<ul>

• Migraines prevent people from being able to work, enjoy family time, it causes depression and relationship issues. You can't even be reliable for a night out with friends. Your donations can help push out information that could be a game changer for not just the sufferer but their families and friends who have to be understanding.

• If you have ever had a migraine which is worse that the worse headache or have family or friends who suffer through, think of them when you donate. I might have just what they need to live a happier life and through your donations you can be a part of that.
<h3>Risks &amp

My food formulas have all been written up and I am working on the additional information content but on those days when that Migraine Monster wants to creep in, I have a wonderful supportive team that keeps things moving.
We understand money can be tight so if you cannot put anything into the pot feel free to fan the flames:
<ul>
• Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
• You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
• Be sure to check out our website and follow me on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and like anything you can!
