Heartworm

Chapbook by JGT

Two years ago, I experienced an episode of hypomania. I was filled with unstoppable energy and impenetrable confidence for almost a week. I declared that I was going to write a book titled ""Hip Hop and Weed Saved My Life"" to anyone who would listen. The book would be a memoir beginning in childhood, portraying events that caused me to lose my voice and self-esteem. It would follow me through the important experiences of young adulthood and end with my moment of mania, which I believed at the time to mean my voice had come back to me. After all, I could not stop talking.

When mania faded and reality returned, I was embarrassed. My other declarations were that I would become a rapper and a skateboarder: two feats that require daring and bravery, traits that I had been missing for some time. It was not that these dreams were not true. They were but, without the hyper-confidence of a manic mindset, self-doubt returned and depression set in.

I wrote chapters to my memoir, planning on fulfilling my promise. I wrote poems and songs, too. Rhyme and rhythm come easily to me, which is why writing rap verses was an attractive avenue. I spent many years as a painter, and writing poetry feels like painting. I use my subconscious to place words on paper (like strokes on canvas) and they become pictures, layered and subjective. 

Eventually, I realized that hip hop and weed did not save my life. They did, however, keep me alive when life felt its most difficult. I graduated college with a 3.9 GPA and stepped into the world with little belief in my ability to accomplish anything that was not required of me. It was time to make my own goals and deadlines, but I was failing miserably. My anxiety was through the roof. My body followed suit, and I fell through the attic floor of my new apartment and sustained injuries that will affect me for the rest of my life.

Injured and lacking company, I filled my days with music and television. I fell in love with Drake, like I had fallen in love with celebrities before him. The attraction here, however, was musical and lyrical. His voice gave me the comfort of a warm blanket. I listened to my favorite tracks on repeat during three months of bedrest. I took up smoking pot, and found that the drug + bass beats (especially Drake's) acted much like Xanax (which I had never taken). I found a place of peace, a place without worry. When I was stoned, my anxiety and depression were less severe. I could shake the tendency to wish I was dead, which was obviously a huge relief. I had not faced my fears, but I got better at hiding them.

I started to avoid making artwork about myself when my teenage years were closing. I heard the call of my Jesuit university to lead a life of service, and turned my creative focus to Louisiana's dying coast. I stopped listening to pop and hip-hop, genres that I loved, and kept my radio tuned to jazz, following the opinion of my boyfriend at the time. 

At some point, I lost myself. I lost my ability to stand up for myself or form my own opinions. I lost the healing benefits of creativity when I refused to manifest the feelings inside of me. I also lost self-compassion, if I ever had it. 

The poems that I wrote in post-mania depression were inspired by the loss of a lover. For months and months he did not leave my mind, so I dedicated many words of him. Ultimately, the poems of Heartworm are about me. The poems are a record of grief and growth. They contain my secrets, my insecurities, my mistakes, my pain and my longings. This book is the work of art that I avoided making for years, the memoir that I no longer have to write, a picture of obsession and addiction, and the confession of a woman who relied too heavily on love songs. These poems saved my life. 

Each poem in Heartworm is named after a song that I have been obsessed with at some point in my life. They are songs that gave me confidence, helped me mourn, and kept me company. You can listen to the Heartworm playlist at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLLtSc8hh... .

*Heartworm contains adult themes and language

Budget Breakdown

Materials required to print 100 books
• screen: $40
• ink: $25
• transparencies: $15
• paper: $500
• cover paper: $260
• computer repair: $775
• Adobe Indesign: $90 (3 months at $30/month)

Fira Production / Heartworm Lagniappe 

A sour taste hit my tongue when a doctor informed me that mania could cause someone to believe themselves capable of writing a pop album. She did not know that I had told the world I would become a rapper, nor that my journal was full of pages of song lyrics.

I used to listen to nothing but hip hop, because I could not stand hearing music that expressed raw emotion that didn't have a soothing beat behind it. The majority of music that I couldn’t bear was written by or sung by women.

After mania, nursing a broken heart, I spent plenty of time listening to female musicians. My favorites were the princesses of pop and R&
column2:
B. Their music did not hide their vulnerability or emotions, and it simultaneously showcased their power and confidence. These were traits that I was trying to solidify in myself.

I can't play an instrument and I can't carry a perfect tune, but neither can most pop artists. I can dance. I do a great Britney Spears impersonation. I do not believe that making music was an unrealistic goal that came to me in mania. I believe that it is a form of creativity that I have always wanted to explore. Musical talent runs in my veins, and I am determined to manifest it.

No longer embarrassed to flaunt my love of pop, I have accepted that it is one of my passions. If my laptop is repaired, not only can I design and print the pages of Heartworm, I can turn my pages of lyrics into an album. I already have a microphone and a program for production. I simply need to get to work.

 Those who doubt my ability should know  that I have the same Myers Briggs personality as Britney Spears and Michael Jackson. I told my talented singer of a big sister that I am about to Jamie Lynn her Britney and Solange her Beyoncé, so please give your support so I can prove myself right.

The album will be titled Fira after my cat, a fearless female who I love more than life. 

 

Thank you for your support!

Love,

Julia

Ex-RAF, motorbike racer, newspaper editor, Premier League football and rock photographer, self harm and suicide survivor and transgender. 
Sophie Cook is a media personality and activist whose wide portfolio of work includes presenting, producing, writing and photography.
She became the first transgender woman to work in football’s Premier League as club photographer for AFC Bournemouth following her transition from Steve to Sophie in the summer of 2015.
Europe’s first trans TV newscaster, Sophie has hosted her own TV and radio chat shows and is an experienced broadcaster.
In April 2017 she was selected by the Labour Party to contest the East Worthing &
column2:
Shoreham seat, increasing the Labour vote by 114% and narrowly missing out on becoming the UK’s first trans MP, for now.
Sophie is currently working on her autobiography ’Not Today: How I chose life’ which charts her personal journey from despair to redemption and acts as a self help book for anyone struggling with their mental health and identity.

About the author

Hello to everyone!

My name is Daniel and, in fact, I’m from Russia. Daniel Foster is my creative pseudonym. I want to introduce you to my fantasy novel, which I dream to translate into English, but before let's get acquainted.

For the first time the desire to write a book has arisen in me at the age of 11, but after I had written half of the notebook, I put this idea aside. Since then it seems to me that I was waiting for something: a bright idea, inspiration, the right moment, free time...I don’t know. But suddenly I realized that writing makes me happy and if I will do nothing my dream to write a book will die.

From that moment I started writing my first book in the subway, getting to work and home.

The result of my work was a fantasy novel ""On different shores"". The first book from the conceived trilogy.

About the book

It is believed that fantasy is a way of escaping from reality into a fictional world, where it is easier to distinguish between good and evil, and problems and difficulties are easier to solve. Perhaps there is some truth in this, but I wrote about something else. This book is about real people and problems in their relationships, their aspirations, dreams, love, betrayal, cunning.

Half-forgotten legends of the past and the harsh reality of the coming war, the age-old rivalry between powerful lords, the dramas of ordinary people, all this is intertwined on the epic canvas of a fantastic world. 

There are 3 parts in the book.

The first part of the book tells about a young blacksmith apprentice looking for his path of life. Berth is burdened by the gloomy routine of his native village, lost in the forests of the severe North, and he already did not hope to escape from the vicious circle of the everyday. However, the arrival of a stranger to his village brought frightening news about the upcoming changes. Forgotten fears return from the depths of antiquity, and now Berth has to make a difficult choice, on which depends not only his fate.

The second part tells how, on a usual working evening, a simple cabman from Larcia named Seyrong received an unexpected expensive gift, which one cannot reject. However, will this oddity bring happiness to the poor man’s family or become a cruel mockery of fate? In fact, the gained treasure opened the way for demons from the past, who had almost ruined his marriage some time before.

The third part of the story is told by Jane – the Prince’s wife. She was left alone – her beloved, the heir of the whole Empire, had completely disappeared. Unwilling to steep her pain in tears, Jane went down memory lane to about twelve years ago, into her childhood. Could she again challenge the inexorable fate? The path of life of the young girl, who survived the brutal raid of the northerners, propels the history, which changes the fate of the whole world and the life of each hero of the book.

Why you should be interested in this fantasy novel?

Despite the fact that the action of the fantasy novel ""On different shores"" is taking place in a fictional world, we, as a modern readers, in real life face the same questions that solved by heroes of the book. This is a matter of life choice, opposition to destiny and acceptance of one's destiny …

To make your choice and decide whether you like this book and whether you want to support the project, I offer you to download  free chapters from the novel which are available on my website.

And if you like the world I created, if you like my oeuvre, then I ask you to help me and support the project.

Why your contribution matters?

To be honest  I have already invested a lot in the creation of the novel itself. The money were spent for editing, the illustrations, making up and other things. But I can no longer afford it alone. That is why I ask you for your help. On the pic below you can see what all the invested money will be spent on,

I hope very much that this campaign will be successful and millions of fantasy lovers around the world could read the first book of trilogy “On different shores”.

Also I am writing now second book, which will be published in 2018.

Support this project and become a co-publisher!

 

What if we exceed our goal or fall short of the target?

If with your help and support we raise more than our goal, we could not only translate the book to English but also fund a small print edition for the first backers.


If we don’t reach our full funding target we will continue to work on the project to make it done.

What else can I do to help?

Support the project every way you can!

Every contribution, whether $10 or $1000, helps us reach our goal, so, please donate if you can, or help us to reach more people.
• You can shout about this project on Twitter and Facebook.
• Tell your friends about the project over coffee.
• Post a link to the campaign video.
• Share the art illustrations on Instagram!
• Visit my website: www.danielfosterwriter.com
Follow me:
• Instagram: @daniel_foster_writer
• Facebook: www.facebook.com/danielfosterwriter
​Contact me: d.foster.writer@gmail.com

","About the authorHello to everyone!My name is Daniel and, in fact, I’m from Russia. Daniel Foster is my creative pseudonym. I want to introduce you to my fantasy novel, which I dream to translate into English, but before let's get acquainted.For the first time the desire to write a book has arisen in me at the age of 11, but after I had written half of the notebook, I put this idea aside. Since then it seems to me that I was waiting for something: a bright idea, inspiration, the right moment, free time...I don’t know. But suddenly I realized that writing makes me happy and if I will do nothing my dream to write a book will die.From that moment I started writing my first book in the subway, getting to work and home.The result of my work was a fantasy novel ""On different shores"". The first book from the conceived trilogy.About the bookIt is believed that fantasy is a way of escaping from reality into a fictional world, where it is easier to distinguish between good and evil, and problems and difficulties are easier to solve. Perhaps there is some truth in this, but I wrote about something else. This book is about real people and problems in their relationships, their aspirations, dreams, love, betrayal, cunning.Half-forgotten legends of the past and the harsh reality of the coming war, the age-old rivalry between powerful lords, the dramas of ordinary people, all this is intertwined on the epic canvas of a fantastic world. There are 3 parts in the book.The first part of the book tells about a young blacksmith apprentice looking for his path of life. Berth is burdened by the gloomy routine of his native village, lost in the forests of the severe North, and he already did not hope to escape from the vicious circle of the everyday. However, the arrival of a stranger to his village brought frightening news about the upcoming changes. Forgotten fears return from the depths of antiquity, and now Berth has to make a difficult choice, on which depends not only his fate.The second part tells how, on a usual working evening, a simple cabman from Larcia named Seyrong received an unexpected expensive gift, which one cannot reject. However, will this oddity bring happiness to the poor man’s family or become a cruel mockery of fate? In fact, the gained treasure opened the way for demons from the past, who had almost ruined his marriage some time before.The third part of the story is told by Jane – the Prince’s wife. She was left alone – her beloved, the heir of the whole Empire, had completely disappeared. Unwilling to steep her pain in tears, Jane went down memory lane to about twelve years ago, into her childhood. Could she again challenge the inexorable fate? The path of life of the young girl, who survived the brutal raid of the northerners, propels the history, which changes the fate of the whole world and the life of each hero of the book.Why you should be interested in this fantasy novel?Despite the fact that the action of the fantasy novel ""On different shores"" is taking place in a fictional world, we, as a modern readers, in real life face the same questions that solved by heroes of the book. This is a matter of life choice, opposition to destiny and acceptance of one's destiny …To make your choice and decide whether you like this book and whether you want to support the project, I offer you to download  free chapters from the novel which are available on my website.And if you like the world I created, if you like my oeuvre, then I ask you to help me and support the project.Why your contribution matters?To be honest  I have already invested a lot in the creation of the novel itself. The money were spent for editing, the illustrations, making up and other things. But I can no longer afford it alone. That is why I ask you for your help. On the pic below you can see what all the invested money will be spent on,I hope very much that this campaign will be successful and millions of fantasy lovers around the world could read the first book of trilogy “On different shores”.Also I am writing now second book, which will be published in 2018.Support this project and become a co-publisher! What if we exceed our goal or fall short of the target?If with your help and support we raise more than our goal, we could not only translate the book to English but also fund a small print edition for the first backers.If we don’t reach our full funding target we will continue to work on the project to make it done.What else can I do to help?Support the project every way you can!Every contribution, whether $10 or $1000, helps us reach our goal, so, please donate if you can, or help us to reach more people.

Short Summary
I am the author of five previous books: Mal Occhio: The Underside of Vision (North Point Press: 1981), Dream Streets: The Big Book of Italian American Culture (Harper &
column2: Row: 1989), Una Storia Segreta: The Secret History of Italian American Evacuation and Internment During World War II (Heyday Books: 2001), Esty: A Novel/Memoir (Sanniti: 2012), and Branded: How Italian Immigrants Became ‘Enemies’ During WWII (Sanniti: 2016). I have also reprinted the first two under my own Sanniti Publications imprint: The Big Book of Italian American Culture (Sanniti: 1996), and Mal Occhio (Sanniti: 2008).

column1: Publishing books under a small imprint is not easy
column2: bookstores shy away and publicity is hard to come by. Nonetheless, controlling a book all the way from conception to design to printing has its rewards, mainly that the writer’s concern can focus on the integrity of the end product, rather than the market. So I am trying, once again, to publish Earth Breath under my own Sanniti Publications imprint.

column1: To be sure, no one person can do this alone, so by joining me once again, you can help by acting as the book’s primary encouragers, readers and supporters.
Sample from the blog Earth Breath:

…at some point, as I observed how I was breathing, and how it still seemed to be something like, ‘I am breathing, this body is pulling oxygen in from outside and pushing carbon dioxide out to somewhere else,’ a changed perception, momentary but very real, occurred. It suddenly felt as if it were not “I” who was drawing in air from the outside, but as if the exchange were simply transpiring of itself
column2: more, as if outside and inside were “not two” as the saying goes. As if there were not just an individual self seizing a few quarts of oxygen from the air outside, but something very much larger pulsing in a rhythm with others. As if a kind of universal rhythm were in play. And that that rhythm, which included all else in its pulsations, was breathing me. And I it. Hence the power of the above image of the earth, each year breathing in, and breathing out: earth breath.

column1: <h3>What We Need &amp

In times past, book publishers often relied on “angels,” wealthy donors who wanted to associate themselves with the gentile world of publishing. Now you, as a supporter of small publishing, can become an “angel” for this book—helping to get Earth Breath into print and also into the hands of hundreds of readers.

I have the book designed and it’s ready to be printed. With a modest initial print run of only 100 copies, with the rest to be printed on demand, I figure I need about $1200.00 to begin with. The virtue of a “print-on-demand” operation, of course, is that I don’t have to keep an inventory of hundreds of books in my living room.

Here’s how you can help. Any donation, from $25 up, is gratefully accepted. For a donation of $50.00, you get an autographed copy of the book. For $100.00, you get two autographed copies (give them as gifts). For $150.00, you get the two autographed copies and are mentioned in print on the Acknowledgments page as a Sponsor. Each person who gives $200.00 will receive the two copies and be mentioned in print as a Patron. Beyond that, a $300 donation gets you the two books and acknowledgement as an Angel.

NB: in order to be acknowledged in the printed book, the donation must be received before we go to press in July. If there is a second or third printing, we should be able to acknowledge donors who miss this initial deadline.
The Impact

Frankly, I’m not sure what the impact of this book of past blogs will be. But in this age of historical amnesia, especially in America, perhaps it can provide some historical perspective on our politics, our crises like global warming, our food habits, and our ways of thinking. It can also  demonstrate the power of one person’s work in the aggregate and over a wide range—something that blogs appearing one at a time cannot do. I hope it will also provide an example that writing and thinking a matter through are still things of value in our 140-character culture.

The shared method of bringing this book out might help in this endeavor, confirming that there is still a reading audience for thoughtful, carefully-crafted opinion that credits its sources. And trying something new this time—“print-on-demand,” whereby a book only gets printed when it is ordered—will be exciting, both for this book, and, if it works out, for future ones. It means that the amount I need to raise initially is far less, besides putting me in touch with Ingram (the POD printer), a major book distributor.
<h3>Risks &amp

Though there are risks in any publishing venture, I think my experience in producing two previous books, Esty and Branded, via crowd-sourcing on Indiegogo gives me a leg up for this project. I know what the costs will be, and what the distribution challenges are, though in this case, my use of Ingram, a major distributor, for printing, should help. So should the audience I already have on my blogsite, distasiblog.blogspot.com.
Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone understands that money is tight and prices are rising these days. But even if you can’t contribute monetarily, you can still help get the word out. Indiegogo has share tools that allow you to spread the word on the web via social media. More personally, you can tell your friends about the book, and about this campaign. You can suggest it as a great book for bookstores, colleges and libraries. Every bit of help, no matter its size or reach, will be greatly appreciated. Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

From epic 60-page stories to short and sweet 3-pagers, with everything in between, ‘Step Into The Magic’ is a new book concept that combines stories with experiential exercises, insights and real life applications, all of which are designed to help people live life to the full while teaching them to create what they most want.

The book aims to give each reader a positive experience. An opportunity to transform their life through play, laughter and insightful entertainment.

Inspired by the author’s desire to share his love for play and exploration as a tool for transformation, ‘Step Into The Magic’ shows the power storytelling has to entertain and open minds to ideas, laughter, feelings, visions, empowering questions and new choices. The book has its own unique rhythm which combines insight, exploration and entertainment through fiction.

 

The writing of the book is complete. But, as many authors and publishers will tell you, that’s only half the battle. And it’s the next phases of the book’s development that require your support.

 

If we meet the targets below through this crowdfunding campaign you will recieve the added bonus of what that chapter unfolds. 

 

Hi, I’m Damion Sharpe. Author, actor, filmmaker, musician, improv-artist, workshop facilitator and now seeker of crowdfunding.

Curious from a young age, I began exploring meditation and the world of energy, spirituality and transformation. My deep rooted connection with the earth and desire for a peaceful existence has motivated me to follow a philosophy that incorporates play, humor, body awareness and depth.

Today, I share my unique understanding of the world with those who are inspired to lead the life they want to live. I’ve been teaching improv and acting since 2001 and completed a two-year ‘Leadership and Transformation’ program at the Hendricks Institute.

All my learnings and experiences have inspired the content of my book, combining to deliver a unique, entertaining and life-affirming read. Writing ‘Step Into The Magic’ was an amazing process, full of constant surprises which I believe will be reflected in the spirit and intrigue the reader will experience.

 

 

Meagan Nicole Editor Extraordinaire 

Meagan Nicole is an editor and proofreader for fiction and nonfiction books, websites, and more. She has edited over 60 books and countless other short stories, blogs, and more and has a Certificate in Copy Editing from the University of California San Diego. When she's not editing, she enjoys writing her own books and outdoor activities with family and friends.
www.meagan-nicole.com

 

Alecia Hashem     Master promoter + Event Organizer

Alecia Hashem is a master promoter and event organizer, to name just a few of her skills. She loves to work with non-profits to support those in need. She has an eye for detail and a true blessed talent of connecting people, communities, and bussinesses for a focused cause. 

 

Damion Sharpe    Author + Promoter

Video and music man. Creative spiritual mentalist. As he used improv and stepping into the magic to create the book, he continues the adventure through orchestrating this campaign.

 

As with any publishing venture, the book stands or falls by the quality of its content and the public reaction to it. I believe the unique nature of my book will give it stand-out and talkability, both vital in this day and age where hundreds, if not thousands of books are being published daily, especially on digital channels. I believe each phase of my funding plan is achievable and expect to be able to meet my goals and deliver on the perks I’m offering.

look to the right of page to discover the perk that fits your fancy!

This book combines two amazing things – animals and feelings – in an inspiring way.
Create your own fairytales and stories. Color the drawings, frame them and place on the wall, or use them in emotional education to explore different feelings.
Let the colors and imagination flow and see what happens.

Children's emotional education plays a very important role today and, in our opinion, there is not enough good or quality material on offer. We decided to take matters into our own hands and start producing high-quality material for this purpose by ourself!

Illustrated by Scandinavian artist Linnea Bellamine.

What colors would I use to color this feeling? Different colors convey different psychological meanings but there are no right or wrong answers.

The book contains over 40 hand drawn animals that are full of different emotions. You can use it like a coloring book: express yourself through different colors and explore how they fit into different emotions. You can also come up with stories and fairytales based on the drawings or think about how emotions arise.
Printed on premium paper, so you can color the drawings with colored pencils, markers, or water colors. The book is suitable for all ages – even adults!

A book so enchantingly beautiful that you don’t want to put it away!

Why does the cat cry? Why is the hippo so happy?
What has happened? When do you feel sad?

This book can also be used to support emotional development and education in many environments – for example kindergartens, preschools, home-schools, schools, or mental health institutions. The book is a great tool for professionals such as teachers, therapists, and psychologists.

All feelings are accepted and equal.
column2:
/>
“Pictures are an important tool in my work as a mentor of children’s emotional skills. Pictures help children identify their feelings and discuss them. Above all, coloring the drawings gives children the opportunity to color their own story from their own perspective.

Linnea has captured a variety of emotions in the animal pictures in a magical way: the animals are adorable, attractive and easy to relate to. The drawings can be used for so many purposes, which I think is brilliant. I look forward to seeing how the Library of Feelings inspires children to express their feelings and use their imagination.”

Anne Kekäläinen
Mentor of Children's Emotional Skills, Annen Voimala Company
column3:
/> “Children need adult help to learn new skills, such as emotional skills. Observing and recognizing the different feelings a child has is very  important – but can sometimes be difficult.

I have been searching for good material to use in emotional skills education for a while. This book is exactly what I’ve been searching for. The book comes in handy in teaching because it appeals to children’s natural interest in animals, drawing, and painting, and because it can be used in so many different ways. This book inspires and motivates them to discuss their feelings more easily and openly. The pictures provide a gateway to discussing various emotions: “What are you afraid of? Why? Look at this hedgehog. It is frightened too. Why is it afraid?” After discussion the children can paint, color, or draw the picture.
This is an amazing idea and I look forward to using this book with children in early childhood education.”

Silja Jukkala
Kindergarten teacher

column1: <div>

We chose the Indiegogo crowdfunding as the book publishing platform because this is a self-publishing book project. We have no major company or publisher behind us, and everything that you see here is our design and work. We believe that crowdfunding could be a good opportunity for us to spread our designs around the world for everyone to see.
Crowdfunding is also an economically better option because this way we can print the right amount of the book.

These are the three amazingly beautiful postcards, that you can get via the Postcard Pack -perk! Hand-drawn by the book artist Linnea Bellamine. Printed on thick cardboard with gorgeous detail finishings! Seasonal theme: Winter Wonderland.

Want to sell Library of Feelings -book in your store? We offer retail and wholesale pricing.
For more details, write to us at toimisto@aitographics.fi

All contributors will get their perks even if we don't reach our goal.
We are both professionals in the field of graphics, so we know how to create a high-quality book. We have chosen only the best materials to make the book as good as possible. There are no major risks. The only risk we may have is that our printing company is not able to supply books according to schedule for some reason, and the delivery of books might be delayed.
But we will do our best to prevent this from happening!
 



We hope that our book campaign reaches people worldwide. You can help us by telling this book campaign to your friends and colleagues.
You can share this campaign page by using the Indiegogo share tools from the top right corner, below the financial counter.

Wonderful to see you here and welcome to the journey with us. We hope that you stay with us and that we will be able to offer you some great stuff in the future too! :)

Jack Be Nimble...

is important to me as a writer because children of color need to first, know their history and they also need to see representations of themselves in places that are scarce for people of color. This is a story of a little boy who comes from a family of men who bond and build relationships over the game of baseball dating back generations since Jackie Robinson was drafted in the 1940's. He is aware of how important the game of baseball is to his family for that reason, but has no idea how much it would impact his own life. He wants to continue this family tradition, but he knows he has some large cleats to fill and that scares him. This is a story of tradition, relationships between men of color and perseverance.

• Use the Indiegogo share tools to promote on your social media channels!

Thank you in advance for your continued support!

A note regarding the Lost Letters and the surrounding campaign: The Lost Letters are an ongoing project and do not represent a complete claim to be Shakespeare's own writing. There is a distinct possibility that they might be, but more research needs to be done, more perspectives given and more eyes on them before any such earnest claims are made. The editor and compiler, Terry Tamminen, believes that they are, but does not ask that his judgment be accepted on face value, only that you read and decide for yourself. 

The Lost Letters Project is about getting these texts into the public eye so that a given reader may experience them and decide for themselves, whether that reader be someone not experienced in Elizabethan history making a value judgment from their knowledge or a scholar who may be able to engage in a more in-depth dialogue with the text. We encourage and look forward to all points on the spectrum of learning. 

If these are, in fact, Shakespeare's letters, they are a find indeed. 

If they are not, they are a fascinating story and have their own history, also worth figuring out.

We encourage you to read the following story, to watch the video, and to check out our website (www.shakespeareletters.com) to find out more information and make your own value judgments. 

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

We know much about Shakespeare and have his plays and poems to speak for him, but there are many doubts about his life and work, beginning with a mystery of how this glovemaker's son goes from a quiet life in Stratford with his wife and children to, seven years later, a bustling theater career in London.

The Lost Letters of William Shakespeare are the first sixteen of these fascinating letters that may cover those “lost” years, written by Shakespeare to his lifelong friend John Combe. The letters provide extraordinary detail, including that Shakespeare left home bound for the New World, where he hoped to restore his family’s fortunes
column2:
but, knowing how risky the journey would be, he wanted to create a record for his two-year-old son (Hamnet) so that, one day, Hamnet would know why his father left home (especially in case Shakespeare was unable to return). Although he never made it to North American shores, these letters uncover the truth about the earliest pilgrims and reveal that Shakespeare was kept closer to home to fight in a pivotal battle for England against Spain (and that he used his theatrical talents to help win it).

 

Overall, these first sixteen remarkable letters represent a wealth of as-yet-undiscovered knowledge about Shakespeare's relationships, personality, and career as he carves out his place in the chaotic world of 16th-century London, describing vibrant details from his arrival in London to the premiere of Titus Andronicus, his first play to be staged.
column4: >Our Indiegogo Campaign aims to raise $100,000 to:

column1: • Produce the audiobook with professional actors.
• Design and publish the Lost Letters e-book and print editions.

• Post the Lost Letters and my research on an exciting interactive website where you can help to discover more about the people, places, and amazing events described by William Shakespeare in his letters.
<li>

Fund experts and scholars working to confirm Shakespeare’s authorship of his plays and poems as they analyze the Lost Letters and new historical discoveries, uncovering his surprising array of collaborators.

Our goal is to make the Lost Letters easily accessible to everyone worldwide at the same time! The Lost Letters will be published this year, regardless of how much this campaign raises, but your help in any amount will go a long way to making that possible.
column2:
>Advisors to the Lost Letters Project say: 

JC, English teacher: Historically accurate, funny, gritty, bawdy engaging
column3:
I will be very surprised if there's an English lit course in the world that won't use it as a text--and millions will read it for fun. Shakespeare has never been this approachable.

DB, literary critic: You've found something second only to the same kind of find regarding Jesus Christ. Overall, the story is engrossing and would be, even if I wasn’t aware of the back story. Enjoyed all, but the final three letters are the best. 

LL, high school teacher: Truly an incredible masterpiece! Now I am dying to know the next chapter, and the next!! Just Letter 14 could be most of one season in a TV series. And the blood and gore!!  I had no idea that was such a hit centuries ago.

LM, member of the film review board for the MPAA (retired): I am bewitched, such a magnificent tapestry of Shakespearean England
column4:
it 's magnificent and truly a work to be reckoned with. The reading needed my more complete attention than other books, but that too was part of the charm as it transported me more easily into the other world. I can see it as a movie SO easily.

RR, PR professional: I was a bit intimidated by all the old English text, but when I started reading it, I really got into following the Bard on his “Elizabethan Road Trip.” The prologue is a brilliant start and really draws the reader in. The annotation is critical in quickly understanding the meaning of old English terminology. I can’t wait to read about his later life as he ascends in recognition.
column6:
>Help Shakespeare speak for himself

Terry Tamminen in his one-man show that started it all.

Your donation in any amount helps Shakespeare’s voice come to life after 400 years in “hiding”! To say THANK YOU for your donation, you will receive…

column1: • $5: a personal thank-you on our website (www.shakespeareletters.com)
• $10: a copy of the Lost Letters of William Shakespeare (e-book only)
• $20: a copy of the Lost Letters of William Shakespeare (print, audiobook, or e-book)
• $50: a Lost Letters t-shirt plus a print, e-book, or audiobook copy of the Lost Letters
• $100: a valuable first edition print copy (1 of 500) of the Lost Letters autographed by Terry Tamminen (plus Lost Letters t-shirt)
• $250: a call with Terry Tamminen to learn more directly from the discoverer of the Lost Letters (plus the $100 gift package)
• $1000 or more: Executive Publisher credit on all forms of the book and a personal meeting with Terry Tamminen (plus the $250 gift package).

If you can't donate, please share this page on Indiegogo, Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram, whatever else you please! We want to get the word out as much as possible to scholars, theater-makers, and anyone who wants to get a closer, more intimate look into the life of one of history's most elusive figures.

""Kiss my boy and maids in my name and omit nothing else which thine honor deem'st best for their tender need. I am thine ever loving servant in all else, Will.""

For more information about The Lost Letters, visit www.shakespeareletters.com.

 About Me

I started writing at the age of 13 and over my 30 plus years as a writer, I’ve become an Award-Winning, National Bestseller with:
• 11 published novels, (the 12th and 13th will be release this year)
• a Chapbook  (""Southern Snow"")
• contributor to three anthologies.
• Writing Workshop Instructor (http://www.mjhwritingworkshops.net/)
• Writing Student Mentor (http://www.mjhwritingworkshops.net/past-worksho...
• Book Cover Designer (http://bookcoversbymjh.weebly.com/)
• and novelist, where my works have been described as ‘visceral and brutally honest’ (Publishers Weekly), ‘poignant and lyrical’ (Booklist) and ‘a solid work’ (Quarterly Black Review.)

I’ve done a lot and am doing more. Here's what's needed:

Staffing:   $2500

With the myriad of events I'm planning, support staff is a must.  

 

Pre-Publicity $500

While you can't ‘buy’ a good review, you can secure an honest one.

 

Publishing Costs: $1300

 

The Why: Celebrating My Journey and My Two New Books! 

 

Impact

Books have the power to change lives.  I know because a single book—Dr. Mya Angelou's ""I Know Why the Caged Birds Sings"" changed mines, inspiring me to become a writer and with everything tome I write, my goal and vision remains the same—continue the legacy that Dr. Angelou started in my life: changing the world, one reader, one writer, one book and one book event at a time.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Purchase my works on my website http://www.mjhodge.net/book-store.html. 

Get invited to my book event and share it with someone else by sending an email to  mjhbookparty@yahoo.com stating you’d like to be on the guest list.

 

Final Thoughts:

I dream the impossible and make the impossible come true. Because so many believe in me, I’m nearly to that finish line. My request is simple: please help me cross it…

The Backstory

One day at about 6am, I was sitting at my desk and wrote the first stanza in the book, ""I was so sleepy, I was so tired."" I didn't know where the story was going, but kept writing to see what would happen. Soon the story began to evolve as I added different elements. After many iterations, edits and changes, I found the story I wanted to tell.

Often when I write, I am writing to my children. I ask myself, ""What lesson do I want my children to learn?"" After having Conquer Your Dragons edited, I knew that this was a powerful story to share with young people and adults alike. Each of us has our own set of challenges, and Conquer Your Dragons gives us the hope that we can overcome each of them. It is also a fun and exciting story.

After completing the book, I knew that I needed to publish it. I turned to my buddy Darrin Haggard and asked him to sketch out some drawings for the story. As always, Darrin didn't disappoint, he has absolutely done a stunning job on these illustrations. For more info on Darrin, visit his website: www.darrinlhaggard.com.
An early sketch of the protagonist. I loved this one, however, I wanted the boy to look a little older, around 10 or 11 years old.
This is a mock up of what the book will look like.

Soon after the editing of the book, I knew I wanted to share this story in other ways. I have always been a people-person and have enjoyed public speaking, therefore, I decided to create a keynote presentation on this message. I have spoken in front of several audiences and the feedback has been great. For more information on Conquering Your Dragons with Adam Friday Woods, please see this video on the program: https://adamfridaywoods.com/program-description

Thank you for all of the support and love. I feel the encouragement and the overall good vibes. I hope to be able to one day spread this important message, through this book and keynote presentation, to millions of people around the world.
New to Crowdfunding?

Indiegogo's platform of raising money for indie projects like this is amazing. By pre-ordering the book in this manner, your contributions will allow indie artists like me to publish this book and get this message out to people all over the world. As a trade off for your help, I have created some great perks only available through Indiegogo. Contributors will have the first editions of the book and other items before anyone else.
Timeline

The book manuscript is edited and finished. Darrin is working hard on finishing the illustrations. He is almost done. Once the pictures are done and after the end of this campaign in December, I will work with book designers to get this to press. I expect that the book will be available by March 2018, but hopefully sooner. I will begin shipping everything to you along with the book at this time. I know it's a long time to wait, but am working with all vendors involved to get these items to you as quick as possible.
Where will the funds go?

My campaign goal of $3500 is simply a minimum for this kind project. I hope to raise well past that. The majority of the funds will be used for printing, shipping, other production costs, admin costs, and illustrations. The rest of the money will be used to spread this message and to get the book into as many bookstores and schools as possible.

One day at about 6am, I was sitting at my desk and wrote the first stanza in the book, ""I was so sleepy, I was so tired."" I didn't know where the story was going, but kept writing to see what would happen. Soon the story began to evolve as I added different elements. After many iterations, edits and changes, I found the story I wanted to tell.

""The book's cross-cultural relationship is refreshing and its peek into sites around Lahore is delightful,"" Kirkus Reviews.
The Folded Notes (Inspired by true events)

Bath 1898, Catherine embarks on a trip with her mother to Lahore in India to meet her father who is posted at the Punjab University. There, her path crosses with Kharak, a recently qualified engineer from Lahore who works for the Indian Railways, and a mutual friendship blossoms. In disapproval, her father with the help of a colonial engineer conceive a plan to avert her from falling in love with him by managing to get him sent away to work in another British colony. He manages to leave two notes for her before departing. Realising that her feelings for him are overwhelming, she leaves Lahore following him to Mombasa without her parent’s knowledge.  Little does she know that, not only will the colonial engineer be there as Kharak’s supervisor, but as her pursuer. With everything to lose, hope is what she has, to enable her to triumph in expressing her enduring love for him.
The author

I was born in Nairobi, Kenya, lived in Australia for five years and currently reside in England. My first indie book titled, 'The Secrets of The Indian Hockey Dribble' was a tribute to my late father who was a double hockey Olympian.
It was in 2007 when I started writing this, my first historical fiction novel that has been inspired by true events and it has taken 10 years to complete as it now goes to the publishing stage.

I would like 'you ' to be a part of this personal project as it comes to its final stage by backing it by pre-ordering the book, thereby being the 'first recipient' of a personally signed copy of the book. You can choose the level of backing you wish to undertake.
It has been a pleasure writing it and it is my hope that you enjoy reading and being involved with it as much as I enjoyed writing it.
Use of funds

The funds collected through this pre-ordering process will go towards the costs involved in the design (£200), copy editing (£600), formatting (£300), printing (£800 for typesetting) and marketing of the book (£200).
The release date for sale of the book is in 5 months, July this year.
Rewards

For £10, excluding £5 postage and packing, you get a personally signed book. For £15, excluding £5 postage and packing, in addition to the signed book, you also get an ebook version of the book. For £50, excluding £5 for postage and packing, you get a signed book, an ebook and an afternoon tea for two with me in the City of Bath (for those visiting or living around London).

It would be great if you could spread the word to your friends, family members that you are involved in backing this campaign and encourage them as well to pre-order the book. Use your social media presence as well as word of mouth to announce your involvement. You could also use the Indiegogo share tools.
Your support is much appreciated
Thank you.

The Raw Approach To Events

Fil Magazine is a biannual vegan event planning publication and online community for like minded vegan, creative, and animal saving enthusiasts. Our mission is to inspire others to create stunning events while treading lightly. Each issue will be filled with real vegan events and weddings, international travel inspiration and raw stories on inspiring vegan individuals and businesses in the global vegan event industry.
Issue 1 Featured:
<ul>
• International weddings from Canada, Spain, and South Africa
• World Vegan Day Melbourne
• Recipes
• Raw stories from talented vendors
• ...and so much more
Issue 2 Will Feature:
<ul>
• International weddings from California, Malaysia, and Spain
• Cairns Indigenous Art Fair
• Recipes
• Inspiration from International Floral Designer Francoise Weeks
• Raw stories from talented vendors
• ...and so much more

We also provide readers with access to a variety of vendors within the vegan event industry through a comprehensive online vegan vendor directory. The purpose of the directory is to give vegan vendors a platform and community to showcase their work and advertise to potential clients.
The Founder
Lauren Kimble

I created this platform to deal with the raw moments of event planning. Where could a vegan bride or an Eco-conscience party planner turn for inspiration? Being in the event industry for ten years I realize that there is a misconception about event planning being full of glitz, glamour and everything going according to plan.

However, the blood sweat and tears that go into turning a vision into realty, are often overlooked. Yes, the finished product looks amazing however, I wanted to give readers real stories from real people about the good, bad, and in between of planning a vegan event. I also wanted to give readers a raw glimpse into the inspiration behind the businesses they might use/hire for various aspects of their events.
Special Honor
I also created Fil Magazine in honor of my grandmother. Growing up I remember how much she loved to write. Unfortunately her dream of writing a book was not realized before her passing.
Where did I get the name for the magazine?

My grandmother's favorite animal was an elephant hence the name Fil, which means elephant in Iceland. When creating Fíl Magazine it was important for me to ensure that an allocated portion of the magazines proceeds go towards helping elephants in need throughout the world.
How The Money Will be Used

So why $50,000? We want to make sure we are creating a magazine with integrity. We make sure that no animals are harmed and that we are reducing our carbon footprint as much as possible. With that in mind, our magazine will be published using sustainable printing methods  versus traditional printing which increases the price. The bulk of the funding will go towards printing the first and second issue, which includes print production and shipping costs. We will also be paying our contributors, photographers, editors, etc.  Lastly, it will go towards an office space where we can host workshops and events.  Other fees include: IndieGoGo fees, marketing, editing, web design/hosting development, marketing, and design administrative services/supplies.
Fil Magazine will be independently distributed to select bookstores, vegan shops internationally, and via online retailers as well as our own website.
The Impact

We make sure that our features and vendors are value living or in transition to a vegan lifestyle.  By creating awareness that you can have a stunning event without harming animals, it is our hope that there will be a shift in the way individuals view the event planning industry.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot support us financially, we appreciate you spreading the word. Please share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or any other avenues where you feel individuals will be inspired by what we are doing at Fil Magazine.

Don't forget to check out our website www.myfilmag.com

Thank you all so much in advance for every like, share, and contribution. We truly appreciate it!

Background

Let’s talk about representation and being heard as individuals! As Asian Americans who grew up in the Bay Area, we saw a gap in the way our stories were packaged and shared with the rest of the world. In a society where Crazy Rich Asians, a wonderful film that we love, is deemed a pivotal moment that brought Asian storytelling to the rest of the world, we can’t help but feel like there’s still much more to be done and many more stories to tell. We have to keep the momentum going. To be Asian is so many things and it can look so many different ways. Our community shouldn’t be painted with one broad stroke. Since modern society moves slowly to address gaps in representation, we decided to create a project to tell the stories we’ve been missing. We want to foster deeper connections with the people around us. We’re committed to changing our narrative - one story at a time. Our visual storytelling platform aims to highlight the different perspectives, cultures and individual experiences that go beyond a label of our identities. We invite you to join the conversation.
Project Overview

The founders of More Than Asian, Lawrence Ricardo and Alex Hallmark, are passionate about filling a gap in Asian-American representation. Our goal with this project is to drive the conversation through a series of topics that are relatable and relevant to the Asian-American community and their allies. In preparation for a formal launch, we are in the development stage of profiling, photographing and conducting written interviews of Asian American young adults as they tell their individual stories. The more stories we share to the world, the more of a permanent place we create for ourselves as Asian Americans.

In order to maintain the integrity of this kind of storytelling, funding is needed to sustain this project long-term. Please support us in creating a platform for content that focuses on real Asian-American identities and experiences.
<h3>What We Need &amp

We are extremely grateful for our dedicated team of creatives who are working completely pro bono because of our shared passions and goals for the Asian-American community. However, developing an important passion project such as this requires more than the love and support of our friends, family and community. We want to be able to sustain this project long-term, so we need the financial stability for all inevitable costs of operations including printed collateral, transcribing interviews, productivity software, and most importantly, paying for the domain and subscription of our storytelling website platform. In the next phase, we want to elevate our platform by hiring consultants and creatives that will be instrumental in pushing our project to the next level.

We are appreciative and thankful of everyone’s contributions and support. As a thank you, the MTA team will write and sign a MTA-branded and handwritten card and will highlight you on the legacy wall of our website.
To those who have contributed to our success so far, thank you! We look forward to launching this project to represent you and our community.
What We've Done So Far
<ul>
• Developed the brand, messaging and creative direction of our project, including designing distinct logo marks and brand elements.
• Brought on a talented photographer and graphic designer who will help bring our stories and brand to life visually.
• Paid a one-year subscription for our website domain and host: morethanasian.com
• Pinpointed more than 15 individuals who are interested in telling their individual stories of living as Asian Americans.
• Pinpointed more than 10 individuals who have expressed interest in helping sustain our project on a creative and management level.
Our Reason For Being

More Than Asian is a conversation starter focused on Asian American identities and experiences, drawing connections within communities and individual spaces. We visually stimulate and empower our audience through positive, open and diverse storytelling.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, we encourage you to please visit our website, join our creative team, join our online mailing list, follow our Instagram @morethanasian and share to your friends about this project and Indiegogo campaign! Thank you for taking the time to learn more about More Than Asian.

What's been going on?

For me, Laura Lobo, ""wearing a lot of hats"" has always meant more than just a cute gimmick for the video you just watched. My whole life has been exciting and filled with a variety of roles and experiences. With many ""ups"" and a good handful of ""downs"" too, I've always felt blessed to be alive, learning and growing by making astute observations along the way. This collection of valuable insights has clearly resonated with other adventuresome dreamers.

During the past 12 years, my speaking and training career has revealed just how useful these tips and perspectives have been for people in all walks of life and at any age. Now they are finally collected into one volume, ""Give Your Talent Wings"" which exists only in an edited manuscript form on the date of this campaign launch, November 4, 2019. It's time for some page design, cover art and printing! Ready? Set? Go!
The POWER of synergy

Teamwork and community are inarguably the best tools for getting a job done right. Now that this book is getting published, it's thrilling to include YOU in the process. You are Part of a Miracle by joining my side, encouraging me and reinforcing what a worthwhile endeavor this is!

After having researched several options, my valuable advisors and I are ready to make use of our relevant business experience. Our next steps behind the scenes will be to choose the best printer, select appropriate options, and get designs and layouts for the cover and pages, lickety-split. We just need to know that we've got readers!
By jumping in now, prior to printing, you can help us do two very important things, in this order:
<ol>
• Ensure the best pricing on the initial print run, accumulating a large order (Goal: 500 books)

• Drive awareness for Give Your Talent Wings, to exceed the goal and reach more readers - paving the way for more successful performers, artists, speakers and dreamers to achieve their full potential and generate innovative successes that make the world better for all of us!

So enough about ""ME"". From now on it's ""WE"". This is about ALL OF US creating a movement and reaching a world in need with a message of hope and encouragement. Giving wings to talent that would otherwise be under-expressed. It's a revolution worth fighting for!
<h3>What We Need &amp
It's really this simple. Your willingness to be Part of a Miracle is valuable in ways that money alone can't buy. Let's break it down with just a few details:
<ul>

• With only 250 of you pledging to order two copies of the Limited Edition first-run book, we get there in an instant! You might even want to be part of our Generosity Perk, with one book for you, and one copy to be used as a promotional give-away prize at a neighborhood concert or performance next year.

• Maybe two Limited Edition books isn't in your budget right now. That's no big deal. Honestly! When you sign up for even the minimum $2 perk, you'll get a digital download (MP3) of the inspiring original song Part of a Miracle and be included in our online community of support. Observe as awareness for this movement grows and watch as lives are transformed into higher levels of creative expression and positive collaboration!

• The fun is only now beginning! We've got some creative events to plan together, both in Minnesota and Florida, and you get to help decide how these play out! Just be sure to accept the invitation to our facebook community.
• For those super enthusiastic participants with deeper pockets, personalized music-driven experiences and book study groups will be formed, adding to a more sizzling wow factor!

<li>Then, if for some odd reason we don't reach our entire goal, please know that we are prepared to modify the printing strategy, still keeping our promise to deliver finished books to those who jumped in with participation pledges. The adjustment from color pages to black &amp
column2: white pages will make it possible for us to print a smaller volume and still fulfill our delivery expectations. Either way, the cover of the book will be dynamic, colorful and exciting for this one time Limited Edition first-run collectable version of Give Your Talent Wings.

column1: The Impact

Maybe you know someone first hand who could use some practical guidelines and supportive advice in their creative pursuits. Is it your nephew? Your church's worship leader? Your neighbor? Maybe it's YOU.
In all reality, who DOESN'T have an unfulfilled dream on the back burner?

With Give Your Talent Wings and its accompanying study guides, hope resurges and winning strategies unfold. Communities feel the effects of authentic leaders rising to the fulness of their own potential. Conversations shift from ""what's the problem?"" to ""how are we going to solve it?""
With so much division in our nation and in our world, simply starting the right conversations is a critical need!

Give Your Talent Wings comes with a long term plan to keep the right dialogues going. In 2020, we will be rolling out a limited time offer for free online training of leaders willing to facilitate study groups, which will ensure the activation and implementation of the unique and valuable lessons buried deep in the pages of these thought-provoking materials. Each person's experience of Give Your Talent Wings is bound to be completely unique, yet by sharing our take-aways and building close-knit accountability teams, the learning will come to life before our eyes!
This truly is a creative revolution. Let's be part of growing this momentum together!
<h3>Risks &amp

","What's been going on?

For me, Laura Lobo, ""wearing a lot of hats"" has always meant more than just a cute gimmick for the video you just watched. My whole life has been exciting and filled with a variety of roles and experiences. With many ""ups"" and a good handful of ""downs"" too, I've always felt blessed to be alive, learning and growing by making astute observations along the way. This collection of valuable insights has clearly resonated with other adventuresome dreamers.

During the past 12 years, my speaking and training career has revealed just how useful these tips and perspectives have been for people in all walks of life and at any age. Now they are finally collected into one volume, ""Give Your Talent Wings"" which exists only in an edited manuscript form on the date of this campaign launch, November 4, 2019. It's time for some page design, cover art and printing! Ready? Set? Go!
The POWER of synergy

Teamwork and community are inarguably the best tools for getting a job done right. Now that this book is getting published, it's thrilling to include YOU in the process. You are Part of a Miracle by joining my side, encouraging me and reinforcing what a worthwhile endeavor this is!

After having researched several options, my valuable advisors and I are ready to make use of our relevant business experience. Our next steps behind the scenes will be to choose the best printer, select appropriate options, and get designs and layouts for the cover and pages, lickety-split. We just need to know that we've got readers!
By jumping in now, prior to printing, you can help us do two very important things, in this order:
Ensure the best pricing on the initial print run, accumulating a large order (Goal: 500 books)

Drive awareness for Give Your Talent Wings, to exceed the goal and reach more readers - paving the way for more successful performers, artists, speakers and dreamers to achieve their full potential and generate innovative successes that make the world better for all of us!

So enough about ""ME"". From now on it's ""WE"". This is about ALL OF US creating a movement and reaching a world in need with a message of hope and encouragement. Giving wings to talent that would otherwise be under-expressed. It's a revolution worth fighting for!
What We Need & What You Get
It's really this simple. Your willingness to be Part of a Miracle is valuable in ways that money alone can't buy. Let's break it down with just a few details:

With only 250 of you pledging to order two copies of the Limited Edition first-run book, we get there in an instant! You might even want to be part of our Generosity Perk, with one book for you, and one copy to be used as a promotional give-away prize at a neighborhood concert or performance next year.

Maybe two Limited Edition books isn't in your budget right now. That's no big deal. Honestly! When you sign up for even the minimum $2 perk, you'll get a digital download (MP3) of the inspiring original song Part of a Miracle and be included in our online community of support. Observe as awareness for this movement grows and watch as lives are transformed into higher levels of creative expression and positive collaboration!

The fun is only now beginning! We've got some creative events to plan together, both in Minnesota and Florida, and you get to help decide how these play out! Just be sure to accept the invitation to our facebook community.
For those super enthusiastic participants with deeper pockets, personalized music-driven experiences and book study groups will be formed, adding to a more sizzling wow factor!

Then, if for some odd reason we don't reach our entire goal, please know that we are prepared to modify the printing strategy, still keeping our promise to deliver finished books to those who jumped in with participation pledges. The adjustment from color pages to black & white pages will make it possible for us to print a smaller volume and still fulfill our delivery expectations. Either way, the cover of the book will be dynamic, colorful and exciting for this one time Limited Edition first-run collectable version of Give Your Talent Wings.
The Impact

Maybe you know someone first hand who could use some practical guidelines and supportive advice in their creative pursuits. Is it your nephew? Your church's worship leader? Your neighbor? Maybe it's YOU.
In all reality, who DOESN'T have an unfulfilled dream on the back burner?

With Give Your Talent Wings and its accompanying study guides, hope resurges and winning strategies unfold. Communities feel the effects of authentic leaders rising to the fulness of their own potential. Conversations shift from ""what's the problem?"" to ""how are we going to solve it?""
With so much division in our nation and in our world, simply starting the right conversations is a critical need!

Give Your Talent Wings comes with a long term plan to keep the right dialogues going. In 2020, we will be rolling out a limited time offer for free online training of leaders willing to facilitate study groups, which will ensure the activation and implementation of the unique and valuable lessons buried deep in the pages of these thought-provoking materials. All Rise is a non-profit social justice publication based in Portland, OR, developed, written, and curated by currently and formerly imprisoned people. Our mission is to help transform how those with lived experience of imprisonment are perceived and treated by providing a platform for creative expression, political advocacy, and connection-building between imprisoned people and the broader community. 

COVID19 and the ongoing violence of police brutality targeting Black people and people of color in the U.S. has brought much needed national attention to racial, economic, and health inequalities--all of which also define the U.S. prison system.

Your support will catalyze the launch of All Rise as an organization by helping to fund our operations, working towards paying currently and formerly incarcerated people for their contributions, and getting copies of the magazine into prisons.

You can follow our work on Instagram and our website:

http://allrisemedia.org 
http://instagram.com/allrisemag 

THE MAGAZINE

All Rise is a digital and physical publication that provides a platform for the human stories of discrimination, redemption, and transformation that lie behind the numbers of mass incarceration. Issue 1 of the print magazine is finished and ready to ship, and your support will help us tell richer stories, from podcasts and video to data visualization.

Prisoner-written and -curated content will live on our digital platforms, with a year-end physical volume being printed and sold annually. The print version of the magazine is more than simply an incentive for donations. It’s a vital part of our mission. A portion of magazine sales will go directly towards getting print magazines into the hands of imprisoned people and soliciting submissions from them. We aim to create a living archive of life under mass incarceration.

The magazine was developed by incarcerated people inside Columbia River Correctional Institution in Portland, OR, in collaboration with volunteers. Through our editorial work, we bring awareness to issues directly impacting currently and formerly incarcerated people. Through action and collaboration with other organizations, we advocate for the issues brought to light in the magazine.

ADVOCACY

Your support will also help us to continue developing our advocacy strategies:

Legislation: Work through institutions and legislative avenues to achieve meaningful changes in criminal justice.

Agitation: Intentionally poke holes in the foundations of the prison industrial complex. 

We work closely with currently and formerly incarcerated people to ensure we focus on the most important and urgent issues affecting their lives.

IMPACT

Your contribution will directly impact the lives of persons in prison systems around the US. 

It will help get All Rise off the ground and established as an advocacy organization and publication.

Together, we can build momentum towards large-scale systemic change.

Short Summary

First of all, I am a native Spanish speaker. I wrote what you are about to read, therefore, please forgive me for any mistakes I may have made. I respect the English language and I apologize for any grammar or spelling problems. THANK YOU :)

• My name is Andrea Amosson, I am a Chilean and I currently live in Texas with my husband and two  boys. I am an author and I have written 2 books in Spanish: a novel and a short stories collection. My novel, Rictus, has been described as ""an original, attractive and well delivered narrative voice"" by the critics. It was published in Chile four years ago. I am a journalist and I have graduate studies in literature. 
  • My husband is an American and he claims to be my #1 fan, only that he can't read my books! I wish to share my writing not only with him, but with everybody. My novel Rictus has literary merit according to the critics
column2: because it is an honest attempt to brake with masculine stereotypes in writing and it has a woman as a protagonist: a young undertaker who feels compelled to find out why another woman died.

column1: • With your help, I believe we will add an interesting piece of work to the English speaking market. You will also help me with my writing career here in the U.S. Rictus took me five years: from first to last page, I broke a leg, got married, became a mom, changed countries 3 times.  My novel has meaning for me and I hope it can have meaning for you too. And because the book goes about life, work, mystery, romance, suspense, humor, only an independent editor could see the value in it, beyond commercial criteria. After a long search and plenty of rejections, I got a publishing contract for the Spanish manuscript. And the book sells really good. So it was a win win for all of us!

<li>Nowadays Orange Production, an independent publishing house here in the U.S., is about to launch my short stories collection in English. ""TOLD FROM THE HIPS"" (<a href=""http://www.amazon.com/Told-Hips-stories-Andrea-Amosson-ebook/dp/B00SXHEHRO/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&amp
column7: keywords=told+from+the+hips) Please visit the link, where you can download a fragment of the book and verify the quality of my writing.

column1: • This same publishing house is interested in publishing the English version of RICTUS (their editor is fluent in Spanish and has read the original version and praised it) and they will invest their resources in it too, providing that I submit a manuscript in English.

<li>I  need $2,820 dollars to pay the translator/Editor who will work with my Spanish manuscript and turn it into English. She is an American lady who teaches at The University of Texas at Arlington. She has a master's degree in Spanish. We have already worked together in the translating/editing of ""Told From the Hips"" Short stories (<a href=""http://www.amazon.com/Told-Hips-stories-Andrea-Amosson-ebook/dp/B00SXHEHRO/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&amp
column4: keywords=told+from+the+hips"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">http://www.amazon.com/Told-Hips-stories-Andrea-...). Her work is amazing, she can really capture the sense of my sentences and the wording. I am very thankful to her!!!

column1: • As a way of THANKING YOU  for your help and support, I have come up with some ideas that you can read on the right side of this page. Take a look and see if there is something that speaks to you.

• Even if I don't reach my entire goal, I would like to go ahead and hire the translator/editor, in order to translate as much as we can. After that, I hope to make enough money from my Creative Writing classes in Spanish, to continue with the translation.
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

I work with publishing houses, but not the big ones (they reject me and, I think, I would reject them if they impose a certain subject or minimum amount of pages on me). My work is mostly appreciated by independent editors, who can still take chances with new ways of telling stories. And I like to work with independent publishing houses, because then I only worry about keep on writing and not about the business side.

I have faced many obstacles in the past and I don't expect the future to be any easy. But you can count on my persistence.  I have been writing for the past 20 years and as I said, it took me five years to finish Rictus. I did not give up until my dream became true.
That is why I appreciate this crowdfunding initiative: we live in a different world and we have to open ourselves to new ways of doing things :)

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help me by purchasing my new book in English: TOLD FROM THE HIPS
You can help me sharing this campaign with your friends and colleagues.
You could help me connecting me with students that may want to improve their resume by translating this book!
I am open, thankful and humble to accept any help you could provide.

SELECTIVE MAILINGS
TRAVEL

column5: >My name is Alicia Nunn, and am a 45 year old single mother and abuse survivor. I have two children in college. I am a community organizer and former school social worker. In 2011, after being laid off, I started the journey of living my dreams. My first dream was to start a nonprofit youth organization to provide holistic wrap-around services so all youth have a chance to grow and prosper. My second dream was to become a writer. I accomplished both, but on the journey I lost everything. My house, car and other material possessions. Unfortunately, these losses have seriously impacted my third dream: to publish my novel and bring empowerment to the victims of abuse and modern-day slavery.
column10: >While working in Gary, Indiana schools as a social worker,  I met many courageous children living with the ravages of poverty. They survived daily trauma of hunger, violence, drugs and broken families. Many of them had been raped or sexually abused. I realized that these victims had no one to be an advocate for them. Through my work with these families, I was inspired to write.
column12: >My first novel is dedicated to children in Gary and around the world who have been raped or abused. My novel, Ashira, is an action-packed love story about a feisty girl from the hood who discovers she has superpowers and takes on sex trafficking.
column18: >I am seeking to raise $6,500 to publish and promote Ashira, which is written to empower survivors, bring awareness and help end modern day slavery. Too many people suffer in silence globally. Publishing this novel will give me the chance to continue to give back to a struggling community that is suffering in the silence of their abuse. My hope is that young women will read this novel and understand they are not alone, and they can fight for their own freedom.

as well as coming together to form a knit and close community. There are
various Facebook groups created through Psych2Go to get people involved with
supporting one another, sharing ideas, thoughts, and just expressing themselves
to people from all over the world. Psych2Go started on Tumblr and branched out to increase its following on  YouTube with 7,000 subscribers, a Facebook with an average of 30,000 likes,
and a blog page with a plethora of young aspiring writers and psychologists.
But what sets
Psych2Go"" apart from any other Psychology company out
there?
We aren't one of those pretentious
sites that won't respond to its audience. We are raw and real and we love
getting people of all ages engaged in our various projects and community in
general. People from all over the world are involved in Psych2Go! From New York
City to California, to Europe, the U.K., the Philippines, and all across the
globe. Not just geared to one specific place, we want to reach out to a large
demographic and make it seem as though we're all not really as far away from
one another as we may think.  Unlike Psychologytoday or other popular
psych websites, we think inclusion and entreprenuialship is so important. If
you'd like to get involved and are a lover of psychology, feel free to join the
community!
Where are the Funds from this
Campaign going?
We are accepting all donations
from audience members and supporters because we're launching a very cool
quarterly Psych2Go Magazine! In order to have actual prints,
there's a particular fee for cost of materials, paper, and ink. This is one of
the many projects we plan to implement, but as a small business, it's super
important and extremely exciting! We will have a digital version of the
magazine for a small fee at first - and it will become free after a month passes, but tangible print copies are unbeatable in terms of giving
you the real magazine feel, as any book might. We want to provide you with cool
psychological content that you can hold in your hand! Even if you aren't
looking to buy a print copy, the writers and designers of this magazine have
been working so hard to put this magazine together, and donations for the
launch of the digitized version of the magazine would be greatly appreciated!
Even by donating $1, you are helping
us so much!
All funds raised in this community
campaign will go towards the production and manufacturing process of the
'Psych2Go Magazine'.
Thank you!
