","A dedicated  mother is a woman easy to recognize. She is bold, imaginative, social, creative, health-conscious, open-minded, passionate, dedicated, seemingly fearless–all while being there whole-heartedly for her child.

Our blog & seasonal publications captures this lifestyle of motherhood by featuring ‘mama bloggers’, articles on motherhood, home design, food, fashion, travel, careers and by featuring the creative works of other moms to be sold on our etsy store.

We want more than anything to redefine how the lifestyle of motherhood is portrayed and to encourage the fact that a mothers place is not only in the home but also in the world...simple as it should be...

We need your help to turn this blog into a seasonal publication where we feature the creative works, passions, pursuits and ideas of mothers all over the world in hopes empower women and let them know that their creativity matters.
Funding & Gratitude

What’s This All About?
I’m Teshelle Combs, author of the CORE Series.
I wrote CORE because I wanted readers to be inspired, to be brave, to hunt
down their dreams. I was 24 when I made up this dragon shifter world, and let
me tell you, it took a lot of guts to bring my characters, Cale and Ava, to
life. And even more guts to share my story with the world! I want my characters to be real, even if they were fantastical. I want them to be vulnerable and scared,
passionate and brave. And more than anything, I want everyone who reads CORE to
feel like they can be as brave as Cale and Ava.
This campaign is designed to help me get the
CORE Series into brick-and-mortar bookstores (like Barnes &
column2: Noble and BAM). I am so thankful for all my fans

column1: who love me and love my work and buy up all my copies online. Now, my dream is to
get Cale and Ava in the hands of even more dreamers.
I steadfastly believe that CORE is meant to
help people. It helped me. I wouldn’t be who I am it wasn’t for the journey my
dragon shifters go on. Don’t you want to be a part of something amazing?

Something not only filled with fantasy, but with a message that could teach people how to dream? How to dare? How to be brave?

What Others Say About Core

Reviews from Fans and Authors:

""I'm so glad I stumbled across this book because I rather loved it. It's different from any of the other dragon stories I've read, is full of rich detail and history and honestly, sucks you in from the very first chapter."" - Author Madhuri Blaylock

"" I think it would appeal to a broad range of ages since it addresses topics like recognizing who a person is within the family group and society in general, how one deals with disappointments and triumphs, and finding love and trust in unexpected places. Well done."" - Delilah, Reader

""First of all, I give this book five stars. Five insanely fun stars. I finished this book in just a few days and I cannot wait to get my hands on the rest of the books in this series. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS BOOK to anyone who enjoys young adult urban fantasy/fantasy."" - Author Sarah Doughty
column7: pageNumber=2"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">Find more reviews here.

column1: What We Need &
Here’s the practical nitty gritty of what we
need to get CORE in stores:
<ul>
• We need super impressive editing
• We need fabulous design services (for the covers and interior)
• We need ISBN numbers for each format of each book
• We need to pay for printing
• We need an expert marketing adviser
Why do we need all
these fancy things?
I’ve gotten this far
with the help of my awesome team and my great loves (thank you thank you thank you), and now we
need more professionals to get on board to make the series truly glisten!
Risks &
There are risks to this massive undertaking.
Not only will I have to prepare the series for in-store publication, but I’ll
also have to convince bookstore that they NEED this series on their shelves. I am determined, equipped with loads of research and education, and I am
too passionate about what I do to let them think anything else. As soon as Core is ready, I
will prepare a killer pitch package that knocks the stores off their blocks.
Right now, you can help me by showing your
support. Every single word of encouragement is treasured. Oh, and I especially love
it when people message me about what CORE means to them. Do that!
Other Ways You Can Help
If
you don’t have the means to contribute, I love you no less. Thank you for
reading, for watching the video, and for liking what I do. Here are ideas for
how you can help if you can’t donate:
1.
Send me an encouraging
word or message ( or two of them. Or three.)
2.
Give someone else an
encouraging word or message. Love is love. Everyone could use some more.
3.
Read CORE!! Every time
you pick up a book, the world changes.
4.
Tell someone. Share
this. Share my book. Share my story.
And
that's all there is to it. I love you.

-TC

column1: <h3 style=""text-align: center
Israel and the
United States often speak of their shared values, but when it comes to African
refugees their practices are in stark contrast. Asylum seekers in Israel are denied the basic rights of refugees, and the government has employed various policies to pressure asylum
seekers to leave – including indefinite arbitrary detention, refusal to review asylum claims, denial of basic state-services, intimidation, and coerced deportation.

column2: ><b>Although the refugees and asylum seekers come

column1: from different places, they share a common experience of loss and hope. Whether
fleeing ethnic cleansing and genocide in Sudan or the brutal military regime in
Eritrea, they yearn for a normal life and a temporary safe haven where they can live until the situation in their home country improves. In spite of experiencing
horrific perils on their way to Israel such as being smuggled, kidnapped and
tortured in the Sinai desert, and sometimes shot at by the Egyptian border police, they receive
little sympathy and consideration from Israeli policy makers. African refugees and asylum seekers in Israel are treated as a security threat
and a demographic stain on the ethnic and religious character of the state.

column2: >African asylum seekers make up a mere 0.5% of Israel's population, and the construction of the Sinai border fence in 2012 reduced the flow of migrants by 99%, but policy makers continue to inflame demographic fears while refusing to acknowledge the crises in Africa that made them refugees.  The government's most recent policy forces African asylum seekers to make a seemingly impossible choice: deportation or indefinite imprisonment.

column1: Being Pro-Israel is the same as being Pro-Refugees

Like the ancient Israelites of the Exodus, the refugees and asylum seekers coming to Israel also escaped oppression in Africa and wandered across the Sinai desert, but upon arrival to the Promised Land they were rejected. The government of Israel initiated a rigorous campaign to label refugees and asylum seekers as a danger to the social fabric of the state. And just like that, being pro-refugees was conflated with being anti-Israel.

Yet, there is nothing more Israeli than support for refugees. As a country that was founded by refugees from all around the world, and as the greatest proponent of the international Refugee Convention, Israel must find a better way to help these people. The High Court of Israel agrees and has ruled against the government’s draconian policies on several occasions. The High Court has reflected the best of Israeli ideals along with the opinions of many Israeli citizens .
<b style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
The USA takes in an average of 70,000 refugees annually. A large proportion of them originate from the same countries as the African asylum seekers in Israel. In the USA these individuals &
column2: families are granted the same rights as citizens of the country - except for voting

column1: and running for public office. Although
they struggle with a sense of displacement, language barriers, culture
shock, and many other obstacles, they are afforded the basic conditions they need to begin their lives anew, and resettled refugee communities  in the USA abound with stories of hope.
In June of this
year the African refugees in the United States will send letters of support to
refugees and asylum seekers held at the Holot detention camp in the Negev desert.
In so doing, they will remind their brothers and sisters at Holot that they
have not been forgotten, and that there is solidarity with their plight in the
USA. This solidarity campaign will be
facilitated by the African Refugee Development Center, which has worked
tirelessly over the past 10 years to protect and promote the rights of African
refugees and asylum seekers in Israel.
<b style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
ARDC is an Israeli
grassroots nonprofit organization founded in 2004 by both African asylum
seekers and Israelis. Its mission is to enable and ensure that all refugees and asylum seekers
in Israel are free from persecution, live in dignity, and have the opportunity to
realize their aspirations. Through a myriad of initiatives that are essential
to the community, ARDC implements projects that assist, support, and
empower African asylum seekers in Israel. <b>These initiatives include, but are
not limited to, assistance in applying for refugee status and
relocation, technical support on visa issues, higher education consultations,
vocational training, language courses, leadership building, reconciliatory
dialogue, and awareness raising and advocacy.
ARDC employs a
unique methodology that prioritizes asylum seeker participation and
leadership in all activities of the organization. Asylum seekers play key roles
in all operations including governance, management, project planning, and
implementation. Asylum seekers are board members, project
managers, coordinators, community mobilizers, and translators. The ARDC is the only organization in Israel with an asylum seeker in the role of Executive Director. This close
connection and inclusion of the African refugees and asylum seekers has allowed the ARDC to map, design, and implement projects that genuinely meet the
most pertinent needs of this community.
ARDC delivers notable results with minimal
resources. In 2014, with only 5 full-time staff and 200 volunteers, it assisted
more than 2,000 asylum seekers among whom 1,288 entered the asylum process, 103
reunited with family abroad, 315 improved their Hebrew and English language
skills, 125 received assistance with higher education, 150 received tutoring
support, 30 gained skills and knowledge vital to community leadership, 71
received psycho-social therapy for trauma, and 21 were empowered through income-generation.
Over the course of its short existence the ARDC has served an astounding 10,000+
individuals from various African countries.
Read more about ARDC's work in its 2014 annual report.

Unwelcome in the Holy Land
Israel and the
United States often speak of their shared values, but when it comes to African
refugees their practices are in stark contrast. Asylum seekers in Israel are denied the basic rights of refugees, and the government has employed various policies to pressure asylum
seekers to leave – including indefinite arbitrary detention, refusal to review asylum claims, denial of basic state-services, intimidation, and coerced deportation.
Although the refugees and asylum seekers come
from different places, they share a common experience of loss and hope. Whether
fleeing ethnic cleansing and genocide in Sudan or the brutal military regime in
Eritrea, they yearn for a normal life and a temporary safe haven where they can live until the situation in their home country improves. In spite of experiencing
horrific perils on their way to Israel such as being smuggled, kidnapped and
tortured in the Sinai desert, and sometimes shot at by the Egyptian border police, they receive
little sympathy and consideration from Israeli policy makers. African refugees and asylum seekers in Israel are treated as a security threat
and a demographic stain on the ethnic and religious character of the state.

African asylum seekers make up a mere 0.5% of Israel's population, and the construction of the Sinai border fence in 2012 reduced the flow of migrants by 99%, but policy makers continue to inflame demographic fears while refusing to acknowledge the crises in Africa that made them refugees.  The government's most recent policy forces African asylum seekers to make a seemingly impossible choice: deportation or indefinite imprisonment.
Being Pro-Israel is the same as being Pro-Refugees

Like the ancient Israelites of the Exodus, the refugees and asylum seekers coming to Israel also escaped oppression in Africa and wandered across the Sinai desert, but upon arrival to the Promised Land they were rejected. The government of Israel initiated a rigorous campaign to label refugees and asylum seekers as a danger to the social fabric of the state. And just like that, being pro-refugees was conflated with being anti-Israel.

Yet, there is nothing more Israeli than support for refugees. As a country that was founded by refugees from all around the world, and as the greatest proponent of the international Refugee Convention, Israel must find a better way to help these people. The High Court of Israel agrees and has ruled against the government’s draconian policies on several occasions. The High Court has reflected the best of Israeli ideals along with the opinions of many Israeli citizens .
Connecting Refugee Communities

The USA takes in an average of 70,000 refugees annually. A large proportion of them originate from the same countries as the African asylum seekers in Israel. In the USA these individuals & families are granted the same rights as citizens of the country - except for voting
and running for public office. Although
they struggle with a sense of displacement, language barriers, culture
shock, and many other obstacles, they are afforded the basic conditions they need to begin their lives anew, and resettled refugee communities  in the USA abound with stories of hope.
In June of this
year the African refugees in the United States will send letters of support to
refugees and asylum seekers held at the Holot detention camp in the Negev desert.
In so doing, they will remind their brothers and sisters at Holot that they
have not been forgotten, and that there is solidarity with their plight in the
USA. This solidarity campaign will be
facilitated by the African Refugee Development Center, which has worked
tirelessly over the past 10 years to protect and promote the rights of African
refugees and asylum seekers in Israel.
African Refugee Development Center (ARDC)
ARDC is an Israeli
grassroots nonprofit organization founded in 2004 by both African asylum
seekers and Israelis. Its mission is to enable and ensure that all refugees and asylum seekers
in Israel are free from persecution, live in dignity, and have the opportunity to
realize their aspirations. Through a myriad of initiatives that are essential
to the community, ARDC implements projects that assist, support, and
empower African asylum seekers in Israel. These initiatives include, but are
not limited to, assistance in applying for refugee status and
relocation, technical support on visa issues, higher education consultations,
vocational training, language courses, leadership building, reconciliatory
dialogue, and awareness raising and advocacy.
ARDC employs a
unique methodology that prioritizes asylum seeker participation and
leadership in all activities of the organization. Asylum seekers play key roles
in all operations including governance, management, project planning, and
implementation. Asylum seekers are board members, project
managers, coordinators, community mobilizers, and translators. The ARDC is the only organization in Israel with an asylum seeker in the role of Executive Director. This close
connection and inclusion of the African refugees and asylum seekers has allowed the ARDC to map, design, and implement projects that genuinely meet the
most pertinent needs of this community.
ARDC delivers notable results with minimal
resources. In 2014, with only 5 full-time staff and 200 volunteers, it assisted
more than 2,000 asylum seekers among whom 1,288 entered the asylum process, 103
reunited with family abroad, 315 improved their Hebrew and English language
skills, 125 received assistance with higher education, 150 received tutoring

received psycho-social therapy for trauma, and 21 were empowered through income-generation.
Over the course of its short existence the ARDC has served an astounding 10,000+

I can't walk 500 miles, so how about Ride it? plus a bit more!

A little ditty about me and my mission:
• My Name is Eric Hites Artist and Writer from Indiana. I also wrote the book ""Everybody Loves Ramen"" This is my newest project.

• I blame the Proclaimers I really do. I will be riding a bicycle from east coast to west coast for a few reasons, 1 to prove things to my wife and my love. 2 to take back my health and to lose the pounds I have collected over the years. As of right now, I'm 560 pounds. I will be blogging and video blogging the whole trip and interviewing people along the way. After I complete my trip I will write a book on the experience. This fund raiser to help with supplies and equipment and any costs for camping, eating, etc. I'll need all the support I can get.

• By completing this ride, I hope to encourage others to get up and get moving no matter their weight. I have a lot to prove and a lot to make happen. I want to write this book to inspire others and inspire myself and show the love of my life, I still got it. There are a lot of naysayers out there and I am going to prove them wrong.
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Here is a Break down for you folks in more detail:

column1: • Honestly what I need your help with is to get a bike that will hold my massive size, camping gear, support to help survive on the road. I will also need printed materials, some advertising, and I am sure medical supplies and spare parts. Maybe emergency funds for a hotel if I cannot find a safe place for camping.

• My perks are pretty simple, some of you will get mention in my blog and book, others with the right pledge will get a chance to hang with me as I will ride to your location on my trip and even interview you! As long as you are in the Continental US, basicly the lower 48.
• If I don't reach my entire goal I will use to funds to get whatever I can and if I have to I will wash dishes, play guitar and sing the whole way to fund my trip.

The Impact

By funding me you will help change my life and hopefully others I can touch in the process. Maybe even start a movement to get up and ride and see the United States. I have goals to write my new book and even personal goals to shed the weight and prove to the love of my life I do care about myself and can care for her. 

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

The main risk is, will I make it? WIll he write this book? The answer is yes, I will I will put everything I have into this. Like I said before I have a lot to prove. Even if I made it half way thats going to be amazing and be worth a book. But I do not plan to fail and I refuse to. I will not come home until I make it no matter how long it takes. I also have a back up writer just in case I fall into the grand canyon or something else happens if you were thinking that.

Other Ways You Can Help

","I can't walk 500 miles, so how about Ride it? plus a bit more!A little ditty about me and my mission:
My Name is Eric Hites Artist and Writer from Indiana. I also wrote the book ""Everybody Loves Ramen"" This is my newest project.

I blame the Proclaimers I really do. I will be riding a bicycle from east coast to west coast for a few reasons, 1 to prove things to my wife and my love. 2 to take back my health and to lose the pounds I have collected over the years. As of right now, I'm 560 pounds. I will be blogging and video blogging the whole trip and interviewing people along the way. After I complete my trip I will write a book on the experience. This fund raiser to help with supplies and equipment and any costs for camping, eating, etc. I'll need all the support I can get.

By completing this ride, I hope to encourage others to get up and get moving no matter their weight. I have a lot to prove and a lot to make happen. I want to write this book to inspire others and inspire myself and show the love of my life, I still got it. There are a lot of naysayers out there and I am going to prove them wrong.
What We Need & What You GetHere is a Break down for you folks in more detail:

Honestly what I need your help with is to get a bike that will hold my massive size, camping gear, support to help survive on the road. I will also need printed materials, some advertising, and I am sure medical supplies and spare parts. Maybe emergency funds for a hotel if I cannot find a safe place for camping.

My perks are pretty simple, some of you will get mention in my blog and book, others with the right pledge will get a chance to hang with me as I will ride to your location on my trip and even interview you! As long as you are in the Continental US, basicly the lower 48.
If I don't reach my entire goal I will use to funds to get whatever I can and if I have to I will wash dishes, play guitar and sing the whole way to fund my trip.

The ImpactBy funding me you will help change my life and hopefully others I can touch in the process. Maybe even start a movement to get up and ride and see the United States. I have goals to write my new book and even personal goals to shed the weight and prove to the love of my life I do care about myself and can care for her. Risks & ChallengesThe main risk is, will I make it? WIll he write this book? The answer is yes, I will I will put everything I have into this. Like I said before I have a lot to prove. Even if I made it half way thats going to be amazing and be worth a book. But I do not plan to fail and I refuse to. I will not come home until I make it no matter how long it takes. I also have a back up writer just in case I fall into the grand canyon or something else happens if you were thinking that.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't help financially (which is ok, don't feel bad):
Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign! Tell your friends!
Share share share, you can even offer me a hot meal and safe place to cam p on my trip!",0.0,0,"3 Campaigns

""This unique memoir was written as if you and I were sitting around a porch somewhere with a cold beer and a hot dart in hand bullshitting over life and connecting on an intimate and real level. I obviously cannot be with you wherever you may be, but instead I have reached inside my emotional core and willingly pulled out my heart and literally put it right into your hands, ""Here you go my friend, here is everything of ME."" That is exactly how vulnerable I plan to be with you.

What you hold in your hands is every memory, sight, footprint, laugh, tear, pain, disease, lover, moment of honor, moment of selfishness, everything- the good, the bad, and the ugly- it's all right in your very grasp.

The task of getting Cold Beer and a Hot Dart available to you was no easy feat, and honestly, finding time to write while working a full time job and being a full time husband and stepdad to two little boys was actually the easy part. The hardest challenge of the book writing process was digging through eleven years of journals written all over the world and reopening memories and wounds that I had buried deep in my emotional closet. In the many, many hours spent writing this memoir, I found myself laughing hysterically at parts, waiting until the house was asleep to cry over parts, and slamming a few extra cold beers down to power through other parts.

In 2003 I set out as an innocent teenager around the world on a mission to find a source of happiness and personal direction for myself, but after going overseas for the first time and realizing that the world is a whole hell of a lot bigger than my little town of Vancouver, Washington, I knew that I needed to broaden my international backpacking mission to this:
<em>

In a world with so many people, cultures, mindsets, and ways of life, what is the ultimate global recipe for organic happiness and life fulfillment? What are the ingredients that EVERY human being has an equal access to whether it be a tribesmen in the amazon or a millionaire in Manhattan?
<em>
ONE recipe to achieve happiness for all of mankind everywhere...what is it?!
<em>

If I asked YOU right now, ""Are you happy with your life day to day?"", what would your answer be? If your answer is ""Without a doubt!"" then enjoy these crazy international stories and maybe this book will help you expand on your personal fulfillment. If your answer is ""Honestly, no, I'm not happy with my life"" then maybe my story and the recipe that I have assembled can help you in your journey.
<em>

Over a span of eleven years, I backpacked throughout fifteen different countries having been chased by wild animals, contracted the world's deadliest disease three different times, witnessed multiple natural wonders of the Earth, found myself in the middle of demonic deliverances, stepped foot in villages that had never seen white people before, and was also told in 2005 by medical professionals that I have around age 40 (give or take) to live...well, only time will tell on that one.
<em>

Fear not though! Through the incredible adventures and tribulations and every story in between I have discovered the ingredients to organic joy...how I got from point A to point B, however, is purely for your reading entertainment.....""- excerpt from CB&

Hi guys! My name is Brandon and I am a nearly 32 year old entrepreneur, aspiring author, husband, and step daddy to two adventurous little boys. I am currently in the middle of getting an incredible, inspirational memoir from my journals, heart, and mind into your very hands. This developing book follows love, friendship, and adventure on a quest around the world on the pursuit to discover the recipe to organic happiness.
Genre will be memoir, adventure travel, backpacking, inspirational, and self help.
Countries covered will be USA, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Malaysia, Solomon Islands, South Africa, Mozambique, Malawi, Zambia, Tanzania, Kenya, Germany, Netherlands, and Belgium.
10% of book proceeds will go to Malaria victim relief and aid as well.
Wanderology Publishing Group, LLC will be my self publishing company.

Having chosen to self publish I now find myself running a full time business essentially, and as we know, with any business comes expenses. The content of the book is just about in the can and ready to be sent off to editing. I have already paid $225 for wide distribution (ebook+ hard copy) through a company known as fastpencil.com. In addition, I have paid about $300 towards Facebook advertisement. Here are now my upcoming financial obstacles that I am facing, hence the opportunity for donation:
Editing- I have found an editor that will edit the entire manuscript (90-95K words) for 0.02 cents/word, which will total around $2,000+ tax.

Legal review and paperwork- I have a copyright attorney that I have already had a free consultation with, however I am looking at $1,000 more for further content review, Publishing LLC development and additional legal paperwork.
Website development- I have arranged a professional to create a full web page with mobile friendly options and book ordering capabilities...this is going to cost $1,200.
Advertising- as a self publisher I am responsible for ALL advertising! Obviously investment cost is endless for advertising, but I would like to start between $500-1,000.

Clearly my expenses outnumber the amount requested on this campaign, but I am just seeking any support that anyone is willing to throw my way. The process of writing this book has been life changing, and I know the final product will entertain, challenge, and inspire not only the WORLD, but YOU greatly!

However, it is not all about money! I cannot stress how much I need everyone to SHARE SHARE SHARE- everything, anything book related- share it! Like, repost, retweet...without your social media contribution I am literally all by myself on this project and operating solo on getting the word out!
facebook.com/cbandhd
twitter @CBandHD
Instagram- cbandhd
Website coming soon...
Thank you for your time, be blessed-
Brandon

On the 7th of January, 2014, the Nigerian government passed a law that practically approved state-sanctioned homophobia. Since then, Nigeria’s lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgendered (LGBT) population have lived in mortal fear and damaged self-worth. They believe that if their stories could be heard, maybe they would draw empathy and understanding from their fellow compatriots.

My name is Unoma Azuah, a professor of English at Lane College, USA and a Nigerian by birth. Please help me fund “Blessed Bodies,” an anthology of Nigerian LGBT stories, captured in their own words. The project will involve interviews with a diverse group of Nigerian LGBTs who reside in Nigeria and the diaspora. I have already started on my own but need support to continue. I humbly request the sum of $5000 which will cover:

· Flight fares to, from and around Nigeria ($2500)

· Accommodation, feeding and logistics ($600)

· Publication (e-copy and hardcopy) ($1500)

· Publicity ($400)

I hope that by this book, people around the world will have a first-hand insight into the plight of the LGBT Nigerian, and ultimately inspire calls for constitutional and policy reforms that protect the fundamental human rights of this marginalized community. Everyone deserves to be treated with dignity, and respect.

To find out more about me, please visit my website www.unomaazuah.com or read some of these articles below. Thank you.

Short Summary
About the Author
Hello, my name is Maureen Croissant Prairie. I am a published author of Rock and Roll, Crash and Burn: The Driver Story, my memoir from the time I spent with the band 'Driver'.
I have been involved in the entertainment industry since childhood and
now, as an author, I like to write novels based on the 'behind the
scenes' lifestyles and happenings around musicians, bands and the music
industry in general. Although fictitious, this and all my other stories have a personal
meaning. Themes and storyline are always inspired by some part of
actual experience. I just won't tell you which parts
About the Book
MacKenzie Ferguson, or Mac as he’s called, grows up in the
spotlight, ‘born on stage and incubated by the spotlight’ as his father boasts.
His parents are both theatrical actors and have explained to their only child
that performing is like ‘make believe’. Mac grows up often conflicted by the
‘make believe world’ and the ‘real world’.
As a young child in Scotland, Mac has worked in the
advertisement and entertainment industry
catalogues
column2: acting in commercials and having bit parts in movies. The outgoing

column1: child grows into a dark, conflicted teen when his best friend convinces him to
form a rock band, which takes him to super stardom. Mac’s professional career
is filled with controversy and danger.
Mac’s personality changes once again to a considerate,
loving man when he meets the love of his life, Lesley. The couple has it all
love, rock and roll, fame and popularity. Their beautiful love story turns to
tragedy and horror when their lives become exposed to treachery and heartbreak.
What We Need &

Any funds I receive through this campaign will be used to offset publishing, marketing, shipping and launch costs. If my goals are not entirely reached, any funds received will continue to go towards offsetting these costs as well.

I am offering perks to anyone who pledges a minimum of $25 CAD. For pledges of at least $25 CAD, you will receive a personalized, autographed book of The Real World of Make Believe!  AND for pledges of at least $50 CAD, I will send you a personalized, autographed copy of both books, The Real World of Make Believe.... AND........Rock and Roll, Crash and Burn: The Driver Story!!!!!!!!!

    The Impact

    Storytelling and literary works have been the backbone of societies all over the world. It is a way of expressing, fantasizing, stress reduction, education and passing on history. I am honoured to be given the gift of writing, a gift I enjoy very much.
I have attained success when I published my first full length book, Rock and Roll, Crash and Burn: The Driver Story. This book is being sold in selected Chapers/Indigo and Coles bookstores
column2: in smaller local bookstores and through Amazon Kindle. I am invited on a regular basis to hold signing events at these and other locations. I have received positive reviews from critics all over the world.

column1: I have also had a short story published in an anthology. My piece Of Days Gone By was published in Voices of Thunder.

I feel I have captured the same intensity with The Real World of Make Believe as I have been known for in my previous work.

    Risks &
column2:
Challenges

The challenges I face is my geographic location and therefor using Indiegogo as well as other social media to help spread the word and allow a larger population to have the opportunity to experience my books.

    Other Ways You Can Do to Help

column1: I understand that not everyone can contribute! You can still be part of my Campaign team by spreading the word, share my links, send me a friend request on fb (Maureen Croissant-Prairie) and message me that you saw my Campaign on Indiegogo so I can send links and updates that you can share on your pages.
The more noise the better!
And please, don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

About this project
First off I want to thank you for visiting this page.
Hopefully you have come here because you are curious about the story I

wish to tell.  If you are interested in stories about the human condition, personal growth, set in a world of mystical powers and intrigue, then I hope you help me in weaving such a tale.

Ever
since I was a child, watching the original Star Wars trilogy on a
continuous loop, the fantastical and surreal always captivated me.  As I
grew older I began to expand my scope to novels and other medium.  The
worlds of Tolkien and Jordan, the lands of the Forgotten Realms, and the
tales of Daventry and the Elder Scrolls took up much of my childhood

when not out playing sports and getting into trouble with my friends.

I
took science fiction and fantasy seriously in my post adolescence and
through my college years.  I took to jotting down short stories and
developing movie scripts when I should have been studying.  I aided in
creating home-made, video game plot devices and wrote fan fiction on
websites.  I would delve into the imaginations of others at every given
opportunity.  Any chance I could get to create my own story and test it

on my peers, I would take it.  

Where as those not of my thinking
see these genres as escapism, I do not.  The tales I adored would truly
dissect what it meant to be alive, to tackle the difficult topics,
guised in long swords and star ships.  The fantasy stories I loved had
phenomenal characters facing life's challenges, magnified by what is
different about their world from ours. The world they lived in was just
as much a character as they were, and how it adapted and was altered was

as much a part of the story's beauty as anything else.

The story I
wish to tell follows a man, a Paladin of the Church of Lane. Adanin
Lodair has no concept of what is in store for him as the world attempts
to bend him to it's will.  We follow him through his trials, twists and
turns, delving into themes such as choice and consequence.  Nothing is
at it seems, from the foes he faces to those he considers friends.  His
actions will determine his fate and that of those closest to him, and
with each step he loses more and more control of the outcome.  Adanin's
journey takes place over two time periods and we follow along as they
intercede and counter one another, seeing the outcomes from multiple

perspectives.

Here is a direct link to the first few chapters to get you started... mind you... completely unedited.

The Chronicles of Light's Demise - Nemesis     By Joseph Bernard

Hello! My name is Stephanie Toler. I am a former business manager turned creative who is passionate about my new book project: Ayahuasca Spirit Medicine.

Once very lost, my spirit was buried under layers of childhood trauma and social conditioning that had left me miserable. I was born into a family plagued with severe mental illness and alcoholism, and I suffered a great deal of physical and emotional abuse growing up.

At 25, I was diagnosed with PTSD and began healing through non-traditional means. At 35, Ayahuasca found me. The two years since have proven to be the most powerful and liberating transformation of my life. I learned that despite my circumstances - despite where I came from - I had been generating my own misery.

After sitting with the medicine, we become aware of the limiting beliefs and behaviors we engage in - the source of our problems. With just a few ceremonies and a couple years of integration, I have worked to peel back layers of anger, resentment, guilt, addiction, self-pity and hatred, self-doubt, neediness, as well as a misaligned career and relationships. 

I have purged the ugliness that used to reside within and have shifted into a more joyful and loving vibration. I have learned about self-respect and boundaries (abused children often lack this), increased my sense of self-worth, and have developed creative confidence, sharing my heart and my passions.

I have always loved to write, but was discouraged early on and pushed toward joining the military. Hungry for external validation, I studied and pursued a career in business. As part of my healing and integration work with this medicine, I have switched tracks and have begun sharing my writing.

Inspired by my own transformation and the hundreds of equally powerful stories that have been shared with me, I am called to write this book. It’s purpose it two-fold: 1) To demonstrate the healing potential of this ancient medicine and 2) To highlight the importance of real-world integration. The work begins once the medicine wears off and we return to our routines, making new choices that are in alignment with our well-being and highest self.

This project is important to me because
• This is a sacred tradition with incredible healing potential and people seeking alternatives deserve to know about it.
• I want to show its practical application in our lives, through the integration process.
• I am a veteran and have been moved by the profound healing that ayahuasca has initiated in vets suffering from PTSD.
• This is part of my personal integration, stepping forward as a writer, and all around creative.

What You’ll Help To Achieve

In Amazonian traditions, ceremony happens in a tribe and they integrate as a community. As Westerners with individualistic lives, few of us have that option available. We drink the medicine and then return to our lives, now accompanied by feelings of isolation. We’re often scared to make the necessary changes and with no tribal support, life can get worse.

I understand how sacred this medicine is and she deserves the utmost respect. By contributing to this campaign, you will help to give voice to this sacred journey and the importance of integration that follows.

In exchange for your help, you’ll get great perks like backer credits on the website and in the book itself, signed copies, and retreats with me. :)

Other Ways To Help

Spread the word! Please share this on Facebook, via email, or send out a tweet. Anything you can do is appreciated!

I can also use introductions to publishers, professional editors, literary agents, graphic designers, or anyone else you think could be helpful on this journey.

7Vientos - Revival

7Vientos (7V) is a small, independent publishing company based in Chicago, IL and Mexico City, Mexico. After a hiatus (caused by new careers, editions to families, and shifting responsibilities) 7V is back with two new books! But! Danny and Kolin need your help getting them from our hard drives into your hands.

The Project - Continuing the Vision
7V first published Rey Andújar's Saturnario / Saturnalia in its signature hardcover flip style in 2012. Since then we've sold out (!!) but we still have people looking for copies of the book, so we're bringing it back! This time as an English-only paperback featuring a brand new, completely redone translation. Even if you already have the first edition, you're going to want this new version. The new, improved translation lends new understanding and interpretations of Rey's fantastic stories. If you weren't lucky enough to get your hands on the first edition, then this second edition is perfect for you, too. You can't lose!

Héctor Torres is a Venezuelan writer who has been chronicling the ups and downs of everyday life in Caracas for the last two decades. His book Caracas Muerde: Crónicas de una guerra no declarada was originally published in Venezuela in 2012. Since then the situation in Caracas and in the rest of the country has worsened to an almost unimaginable degree. Torres' stories of hope and heartbreak, pain and fear, death and redemption are even more poignant now than ever before. 7V will bring this edition to life as a hardcover flip version in the original Spanish with English translation under the title Caracas Muerde: Chronicles of a Relentless City.
Your support will help us make these two new books a reality and continue our goal of bringing the works of underrepresented Latin authors to a wider, English-speaking audience.
<h3>What We Need &amp

Publishing isn't an inexpensive proposition and to realize this project, we need $25,500. This money will cover the cost of the author's rights, translation, interior and cover design, proofreading and editing, printing, and marketing of both books. It will also allow us to fly Héctor Torres from Caracas to Chicago for the book release party and book tour!*
By helping us fund this project, you'll receive exclusive perks you won't find anywhere else. There will be stickers
column2: limited edition prints of the book cover art
column3: tickets to a dinner in Chicago with Héctor Torres*, Rey Andújar, and the 7Vientos team
column4: and even a special stretch goal.

column1: While we don't want to think about the possibility of not reaching our goal, should we fall short, there's still a lot we can do! Given enough money, we'll fund the complete publication of one or the other of the books. Anything left over will be put directly into completing the other book as soon as we're able to generate enough funds to make up the difference.

Should we overshoot our goal, any additional funds will be put toward the next project. We have a few things in the hopper--so this additional money will help us get those projects into the light of day that much more quickly.
<h3>Risks &amp

While we don't expect any significant roadblocks to realizing this project, we would be foolish to think there could never be any. 7Vientos has a successful track record in this space. Since 2010 we've published four books, three hardcovers in translation and one as a Spanish-only paperback. We've made our mistakes, learned our lessons, and now we know the ropes pretty well. There could always be crashed hard drives, delays in production, boxes lost in shipping, or printing errors. The good news is the texts are 95% complete and saved in multiple locations - with backups!
The second edition of Saturnalia has already been translated, edited, and laid out. Aside from finalizing the cover design, it's ready to print.

Caracas Muerde is 80% finished. All that's left is a final review of the text in both English and Spanish, the interior layout, and the cover design. That might sound like a lot, but we're experts at this. Both books will be 100% ready to ship to the printer before the end of the year.

*Héctor's travel to the US is dependent upon securing his visa for travel. The book launch, tour, and speaking engagements we're planning should qualify him for a business-related visa, but these are uncertain times. We will do everything in our power to secure the necessary documents.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help with funding, you can still help spread the word! Post links to this campaign on your Facegram and Instabook! Twit about it with hash browns or whatever! This site has some great share tools, so check them out and scream it from the mountaintops, or if you don't live by any mountains, head up to the top floor of a tall building and tell the world about this awesome project!

""This book will not only entertain and enlighten, but it's my hope that it will help empower women to solo travel.""  James A. Owen

column1: <span style=""font-size: 16px
column5: >“I could never be as brave as you!”

column1: How many times have I heard this?
Or the more descriptive version. “I don’t know how you can just go off to all these crazy, exciting places all by yourself! Aren’t you afraid?”
Or the WORST “Women should never travel alone.”
Perhaps not, perhaps she needs the world’s best travel companion, a perfect backpack!
I was seventeen years old when I met “Old Blue.” She emerged from a large box that was encased in festive green and red wrapping paper, accompanied by a card.

“For your world travels! We love you,  Grandma and Dad.” It was the coolest backpack I have ever seen in my life and radiated with support from my family toward my dreams of solo travel around the world. There was no question of me wandering the world on my own. Just the perfect desire to make me prepared for the journeys. And that is all I think ANY woman needs to adventure on her own! That and maybe this book. And a bit of it’s life-lived wisdom and encouragement!

In the last 15 years I have been diving head first into cultures and countries, adventures and experiences, always with my “Old Blue” pack nestled firmly to my back. I have been held at gunpoint in Northern Ireland before the ceasefire, I have hiked along the Mediterranean wearing nothing but my little backpack appendage, “Baby Blue,” and hiking boots! I had an affair with a member of British Parliament, road horses in Ireland’s emerald fields, lived on a canal boat, and performed in plays in New York City and London! I ran along the Great Wall of China, sailed into the East China Sea on a quest to find Yellowfin tuna and have cooked for Iron Chef Morimoto! I was held hostage in France. I moved to many countries to live, without much more than a few bucks in my pocket. Many times. At least. Always carrying only my Big “Old Blue” pack. Blue and I have lived an extraordinary life that will be chronicled in THIS BOOK!

For one last hurrah, one grand, great chapter, Old Blue and I are endeavoring to circumnavigate the globe together, so that we might live, love and embrace new places as well as visit people and places from the first adventure! All this to share with you all the stories we can possibly stuff in her canvas innards! But more than that, I want to impart a strong sense of possibility for all women who dream of travel. Adventure!!!!
IT IS POSSIBLE!
Your dreams are possible, but I need your help to make this happen!

• This endevor is going to cost at least $8,530.  $5,000 alone is going to airfare.  $1,000 is going to a Eurail pass and emergency travel. $1,000 is going to lodging and accommodations.  The rest will be used for gas, meals and Indiegogo fees.

Little Tyke

As a father and a kid at heart, I have always enjoyed books for children, they are informative and super creative, with influence from my first born, and childrens movies, I came up with this character and have a few great artistic people to help me bring this character to page:

  • I am Josh Mihal, Father, film maker, writer, kid at heart and artist.
  • This Campaign is to add yet another great story to the plethora of kids books out there, with a fun character to allow kids to become more familiar with what they do in certain situations, like waking up and getting ready for the day, which is a glimpse into the first part of the first book .
  • With so many people that have children and those who just enjoy reading the creative children's books themselves, I feel that this should reach its goal in no time, once those who are interested feel they can relate to what the main character is doing.

Your Contributions and Perks

To be totally transparent so all cards are on the table, we will list the funds needed and where they are going, as well as of course the fun perks that you will receive for contributing:

  • So for the not so fun part, the listing of the funds, We have totaled everything to just under $1,000.00, Yes expensive but worth it.

• First I'm paying the illustrator that creates such great work, total for the finished pages of full color is $210.00 which is 11 more great illustrations and 3 illustrations as perks for the campaign.

• Self Publishing through www.blurb.com, total for that is $359.80 and that makes 20 books at $17.99 a book, that includes 12 full color pages and two black and white pages and the front and back color covers, size will be standard portrait (7.75 x 9.75), Softcover (Its $10 more for hard cover and though I'd prefer hard cover, I want to eventually sell these at a reasonable price, it's not that I care to make  profit, I just don't have the funds to buy nearly $30 books, all willy nilly like). The pages will be standard 80# semi-matte, The price also includes the websites logo on the back of the book, this could easily help gather more customers for a great self-publishing company. I want to turn it into a digital book as well, but that will just be free because I can do it by hand, well by computer, using Adobe Pdf creator, also converting the file into .cbr file format, so that it can be read on other ebook/comic book readers. I also want to start a website for the main character, to have other media outlets, (maybe a cartoon, but that's just a dream), I know i would like to do printable activity sheets for kids and an interactive online story, but all that is after the book is finished. $60 for 5 medium sized posters for promotional work. $80.00 for a table at Sac-anime Convention, where I will also be selling printed sketches of the main character (with permission from the illustrator of course). $70.00 for 20 bumper stickers from vistprint.com (to help with further promotion of the book). $20.00 for 100 postcards of the Main image of little Tyke, printing from visitprint.com. The remaining funds will be used for gas for getting back and forth when printing out more post cards (if needed) and other promotional use.
• All right, so now comes the fun stuff, PERKS!
• What to give, what to give?

• We have of course copies of the finished book, Crocheted Tykes, bumper stickers with the title image on it, postcards with images (only available via this campaign, choice between three) of little tyke not included in the book, digital copies of the finished book, two signed copies of the the finished book (may only include my signature as the writer, unless i can get it to the illustrator as well, which i will try, but who is located in the UK, so this book is being created between continents, how neat), of course lots of thank yous and once the campaigns, no matter what the out come is I will be adding a video to thank everyone for their contributions and have details of the what's to come.

• If the goal is not reached, which I don't see not happening with all those gorgeous people awaiting to contribute, than the funds that were gathered will be used to just create as many copies of the books as I can afford and promoting as much as I can, to gather more of a following and more potential buyers.

    • Tyke Impact

    When thinking up Tyke and his zany (soon to come) adventures, I had in mind myself as a child and my son, who is now 2 years old, what can Tyke do to help children learn? Then it came to me, just daily things you would normally do, get dressed, brush your teeth, eat a healthy meal, get a good night sleep, so by adding in the Tyke as the child like fun factor and the knowledge of daily duties, Little Tyke was born:

    • As contributors, you are making a huge impact, not only on the creation of something great, but on the world, I feel the children (and some adults) of the world could benefit from the creation of this book.
    • My only successful project, that is even close to the same vein as a children's book, is the comic book I did, which is nothing like ""Little Tyke"", it's more adult in nature, as in scariness. I also write weekly, mainly short film scripts and wanting to make a longer book, many chapters, but that's just not in my currently. Writing Little Tyke is a great experience and will lead into even greater projects, some of which you as contributors will see, here on Indiegogo.

• Why can't I just fork over the cash to get this book done already? Good question, because like most of the world, I lack the funds, so I'm relying on beautiful people such as yourself to lend me a hand, no one got where they are with out some kind of help, that's all I'm asking for is, a little help.

    • Risks &
Okay as much as I'd like to call all risks &
column3:
fun, we all know there is so much involved in the creation of anything, so there is risk, I'm putting my name out there, to catch a dream and the Challenges will be not making the first book into a novel, since there is so much Tyke can do and say, sure he's a mouse so he's tiny, but he has a big heart and is full of adventure. Some real challenges will be doing all the promoting and keeping on track.

column1: • So, I, such as many people did not grow up with a normal childhood, sure it was all starlight and mud-pies, up until My father passed when i was 12 so you think that's a lot for 12 year old to take right, but there's more, 2 years pass and i lose my older brother, Wow, how did you cope? I didn't I mainly shut down inside, yet was always putting up a brave front, feeling the need to be the rock of the family, and to this day, i still do so, I also found out I suffered for going on 22 years now from PTSD, but wait Josh I don't remember you saying anything about being in the military, well I was but that's not what the PTSD is from, it's from never dealing with the trauma of my father and brothers passing, Then the hurdle of school and becoming a working stiff, many mood changes and an even more sad portion of my life, I'm still here. Life finds a way. So no matter what hurdles life throws at you, if you can't jump them (i'm no athlete), just slowly climb over or under, either way pass them as best as you can. Ask for help if you need it, but you're not finished yet. Just keep that in mind. So as with all the challenges I've faced in my day to day life, I've over come those and I can overcome the challenges presented before me in this campaign.
Other Ways YOU can lend a hand

Hey I understand, the picture of the person pulling out their pockets and it comes up empty or worse, lots of lent, ewww, look below for more ways you can help out:

  • All those currently viewing this, there's a good chance 90% of you are on a social network, or know someone who is, click that LIKE button and share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and any other social networking site that you are involved in.
  • Remember it's easiest with useful Indiegogo share tools!

• Also for those who rather not share on social networks or would like to share in lieu of social networks, I'm thinking a printable post card you can hang up in coffee shops and book stores (if allowed).

You as contributors are making it all happen for myself and millions of children that will benefit from ""Little Tyke"". THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU , in advance.

column1: Why Am I Doing This?

I'm doing this because I love teaching and I really love teaching people something they are actually interested in learning! While teaching my classes at Udemy I have heard from many students who tell me how the class has changed their lives and how happy they are to finally realize their dream of making and selling their own video games. That is a very pretty crazy and exciting thing to hear the first time a message like that crosses your inbox! My hope is that this book will help others live out their dreams as well!
What is Gamesalad?

Gamesalad Creator is a modern 2D game development kit (GDK). Over 750,000 developers in 189 countries around the world use it and it has been used to make 70 of the top 100 games in the U.S. Apple App Store.

One of the highlights of Gamesalad is that you DO NOT need to learn how to write traditional computer programming code to make your games. Gamesalad offers a simple, yet full featured, drag and drop interface that lets you build commercial quality games much quicker than learning traditional programming. Once you are familiar with Gamesalad you will be able to prototype a game in a few days and complete the entire project in as little as a few weeks instead of the typical months or years in could take to develop a game with another GDK.

The Columnist magazine was born in 2014 with the hopes of providing a platform for students to publish their opinions within the Edinburgh community. As a current affairs, social commentary and opinion magazine, our intention is to promote student opinion and provide alternatives for mainstream student journalism, while reducing editorial control and maintaining it at a minimum.
column3:
/>


One year on, we have successfully published four issues and would like to continue doing so, in print with no cost to our readership.  For this reason we are asking for small donations to support our work, and ensure that The Columnist remains a viable print project. Every donor contributing  5 pounds or more will receive a copy of The Columnist Issue 5 at their doorstep. Issue 5 will be printed during Edinburgh University's Innovative Learning Week (15-19 February)


We want to ensure that student voices are heard, and we believe that print publications are still central forums for discussion. We also have a website where you're more than welcome to read over our past articles, as well as our exclusive online content, published periodically at  www.columnistmagazine.co.uk . 

We urge you not just to donate but to join us. Comment, rant, draw, write— whatever your talent is, share it with us and with the world. Welcome to your magazine. Welcome to our magazine.

Let’s makes our voices heard.

This beautifully illustrated picture book is on the way!  BUT....We need YOU to help us create it, print it and celebrate diversity for our children!  Out of 3,200 American children's books created in 2014, only 93 books were for kids of color.  Wow!  So...Let's make a small change to those numbers with this book!   I'M A LOVELY LITTLE LATINA! is a book created to celebrate and honor little Latina girls with love, honor, cultural appreciation and delightful fun!  Told in English and Spanish with a ""Let's Learn Some Spanish"" glossary and geographical map of many Spanish speaking countries, this book serves as an entertainment and learning tool for readers of all ages! Visit girls in Mexico, Guatelmala, Nicaragua, Puerto Rico, Cuba, El Salvador, Cuba, Domincan Republic and many other countries to enjoy the special culture and activities!

Maria dreams of faraway places and the exciting fantasy of other
countries. But most of all she wants to meet wonderful girls like her

from all around the world who also say, “I’M A LOVELY LITTLE LATINA!” 

With
a brightly colored magical balloon as BIG as her imagination, Maria and
her cute little doggie float up to travel high above the clouds and
across the skies!  She visits other girls to sing songs in Spanish and
have lots of fun as she sparkles up the day with colorful ribbons,

confetti, chocolates wrapped in gold and lots of JOY!

Maria finds
that her dreamy travels can be lonely.  But love for her family leads
her all the way back home – with a marching band, piñatas and a big,

HAPPY parade -- just for her!

So let's do this for our Latina girls!  They need a glorious glitter covered bling'd up book to show them that we care.  To show them at an early age that they are pretty, lovely, beautiful, smart, culturally relevant and most of all...LOVED!!

This book follows the quality publication, I'M A PRETTY LITTLE BLACK GIRL! book.

Major publishing companies all turned down the book because they wanted to make changes more ""universal"" and remove the cultural relevance for our kids. So, to keep the cultural elements that are important, please join our campaign.  Help us show our kids that who they are is important and celebrated...just as they are!

BKB.

Short Summary

I am a professional mental coach. Everywhere I go I meet someone who wants to get rid of anxiety. My answer is always the same: a basic exercise I have invented and experimented that always works. It is easy if you know how to do it.
This is why I want to share this exercise with the greatest audience I can. I don't want people suffer of anxiety: we have a way to solve the problem. And the world will be better. Even for you.
I want to write a short book\ebook to explain in details how this exercise works to let everybody get rid of anxiety.
More about me
www.paologambi.com
I just need 2500 euros to make a professional ebook. The costs cover the time I need to write and prepare the ebook, and the editing of the text, since English is not my first language.
If I reach 5000 euros I shall print the ebook and make it available in online stores.
If I don't reach 2500 euros I shall do my best to write a shorter version.
If you help me, besides gratitude from all those who suffer of anxiety, you will receive the possibility to have skype free sessions with me.
Besides perks, consider how much better the world could be if everyone had an instrument to drive anxiety away. I am trying to make this instrument available to everybody.

I have been working as a professional mental coach for several years. Before I used to work as a journalist and I have written more than 20 books. I think I am the right person to write this book. Help me finding time to do it.

Who we are:  Ayeish!  A startup nonprofit working to equip political leaders with tools to transform conflict into solution and connection

This initiative: Equip civilian Syrian opposition leaders with mediation tools to forge lasting agreements for peace.  The war in Syria has been raging for 4+ years and over 200,000 lives have been lost -- Let's partner to help usher in peace!

How: A training series of unique empathy-based conflict resolution and agreement-building tools, rooted in skills to create connection, understanding, and solution amidst intensity

Solution Model, Core Skills:

Our agreement-building process consists of three basic steps that repeat until solutions are reached:
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Clarify parties’ underlying needs and desires, as separate from the strategies they say or believe they want

column1: <li><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Facilitate parties hearing each other’s deep needs, and foster connection in that understanding

column1: <li><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Help parties identify solutions that will meet the underlying needs of all parties

column1: Our workshops offer a set of supporting skills, including two key skills:
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Self-Connection Practice, to have a moment-to-moment awareness of one’s own intense reactions and needs during an interaction, in order to simultaneously represent one’s own positions effectively and stay centered to facilitate solutions and connection

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >A four-component Empathy practice that cultivates real understanding between all parties

column1: These tools are applicable to situations like the following:
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >“In forming a coalition, how can I get other factions to reform certain extremist positions anathema to my values and to external support, despite their attachment to those strategies?”

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >“How can I deal with my own anger, frustration, and sadness that arises when meeting with certain parties, to stay focused on facilitating negotiations toward a real path for peace?”

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >“In meetings with foreign leaders, how can I support their broader goals around safety and the perception of strength while making progress toward peace in Syria and the region?”

column1:
Methods

Our current model is a sequence of multiday workshops between which participants practice to build habits. Workshops include the following for each skill or process offered:
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Conceptual explanation and role-play demonstration at the front of the room

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Participants role-play practice in pairs and triads using real situations from their lives

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Group reflection session to share insights and ask questions

column1:
We support participants with coaching calls between trainings to prepare for high-stakes conversations.

Curriculum to be determined in collaboration with participants and Syrian American Council advisors.

Trainers
column5: >Our trainers have been teaching and refining our curriculum for over a decade, helping individuals, organizations, and families around the world improve outcomes and relationships in the midst of conflict. Our primary curriculum developers,
column8: >John Kinyon
column12: > and Ike Lasater, are coaches, mediators, trainers, and authors. Their collaboration began with a highly-charged – and successful – mediation skill-building workshop for Afghan elders in refugee camps in Pakistan post-9/11.
column20: >After contemplating entering politics, Ayeish founder Leah Wolfthal realized she could magnify her impact if she could bring tools to other elected officials that would support them successfully mediating the positions they held so deeply, across the political spectrum. After participating in a range of mediation and conflict transformation classes and workshops, she approached Ike Lasater and John Kinyon, co-developers of unique empathy-based conflict resolution techniques, about bringing their curriculum to political leaders. Ayeish is doing just that. The name Ayeish combines the Hebrew word for “fire” and the Arabic verb “to live,” connecting us to our passion of transformative leadership in the service of others. We are a 501c3.  Find us at www.ayeish.org

","Who we are:  Ayeish!  A startup nonprofit working to equip political leaders with tools to transform conflict into solution and connectionThis initiative: Equip civilian Syrian opposition leaders with mediation tools to forge lasting agreements for peace.  The war in Syria has been raging for 4+ years and over 200,000 lives have been lost -- Let's partner to help usher in peace!How: A training series of unique empathy-based conflict resolution and agreement-building tools, rooted in skills to create connection, understanding, and solution amidst intensitySolution Model, Core Skills:Our agreement-building process consists of three basic steps that repeat until solutions are reached:

column1: Clarify parties’ underlying needs and desires, as separate from the strategies they say or believe they want
Facilitate parties hearing each other’s deep needs, and foster connection in that understanding
Help parties identify solutions that will meet the underlying needs of all parties
Our workshops offer a set of supporting skills, including two key skills:

Self-Connection Practice, to have a moment-to-moment awareness of one’s own intense reactions and needs during an interaction, in order to simultaneously represent one’s own positions effectively and stay centered to facilitate solutions and connection
A four-component Empathy practice that cultivates real understanding between all parties
These tools are applicable to situations like the following:
“In forming a coalition, how can I get other factions to reform certain extremist positions anathema to my values and to external support, despite their attachment to those strategies?”
“How can I deal with my own anger, frustration, and sadness that arises when meeting with certain parties, to stay focused on facilitating negotiations toward a real path for peace?”
“In meetings with foreign leaders, how can I support their broader goals around safety and the perception of strength while making progress toward peace in Syria and the region?”
MethodsOur current model is a sequence of multiday workshops between which participants practice to build habits. Workshops include the following for each skill or process offered:
Conceptual explanation and role-play demonstration at the front of the room
Participants role-play practice in pairs and triads using real situations from their lives
Group reflection session to share insights and ask questions

We support participants with coaching calls between trainings to prepare for high-stakes conversations.Curriculum to be determined in collaboration with participants and Syrian American Council advisors.TrainersOur trainers have been teaching and refining our curriculum for over a decade, helping individuals, organizations, and families around the world improve outcomes and relationships in the midst of conflict. Our primary curriculum developers, John Kinyon and Ike Lasater, are coaches, mediators, trainers, and authors. Their collaboration began with a highly-charged – and successful – mediation skill-building workshop for Afghan elders in refugee camps in Pakistan post-9/11.About AyeishAfter contemplating entering politics, Ayeish founder Leah Wolfthal realized she could magnify her impact if she could bring tools to other elected officials that would support them successfully mediating the positions they held so deeply, across the political spectrum. After participating in a range of mediation and conflict transformation classes and workshops, she approached Ike Lasater and John Kinyon, co-developers of unique empathy-based conflict resolution techniques, about bringing their curriculum to political leaders. Ayeish is doing just that. The name Ayeish combines the Hebrew word for “fire” and the Arabic verb “to live,” connecting us to our passion of transformative leadership in the service of others. What we are about.
Ever since I can remember I have always loved telling stories and
illustrating characters. As a kid I loved exploring the colorful action
filled pictures of comic books and reading science fiction and fantasy
books, which led me to pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Animation and
working on graphic novels and film editing. It was only when my wife and
I had two children of our own that I saw the importance of using my
talents to teach children the moral values and life lessons that I had
been taught to me by my mother and father as a child. God has always
given me a desire to use my art for storytelling. It has always been a
dream of mine to produce art forms that have strong entertainment and
moral values. Though I have worked on many projects, this is my first
fully finished book. Thanks to my wife for all her support, to my family

for standing behind me, and too you the reader for supporting my dream!

King Grumpylib and the Grumpy town of Fairness is a humorous family
friendly children's book that teaches kids life long lessons about
fairness, working hard and contentment. Adults will laugh and children
of all ages will understand the moral values taught as King Grumpylib
carries out his mission. Enjoy the first book in a 3 part series King
Grumpylib and the Grumpy town of Fairness.

book, a personal thank you email and a character illustration.

The Cause

As a caring parent in today's society I have seen a lack of children's books that teach personal responsibility and contentment. Two things that build character and sculpt the way we appreciate life.  I want to continue making books for children to help them learn the values that I was taught as a child, values that are often overlooked or hard to explain but make us productive members in our society.  I know there are parents, teachers, hard workers, and good people who support my views and want more books like this available.
The Struggle

Taking time out of a busy schedule to write and illustrate a childrens book was no easy task but it was definitely worth it, especially when seeing the look on my children's faces as they read it.  With your help we can make this book into a physical copy and even a book series of books that addresses numereous social issues.  Through out the process I have realized that I can not do this alone but Indiegogo is a great way for me to accomplish this dream.

En bok om kärlek

Jag grundade Good News Magazine för att sprida konstruktivt engagemang och medveten optimism. För att visa på att vi människor är födda goda och att vi alla har den lågan inom oss. Men den behöver näring, den behöver syre och vi alla behöver bli påminda om den. Om vår godhet. 

Under åren jag arbetat med magasinet har jag märkt att det inte räcker med magasinet och att i det lyfta fram de goda exemplen. Av alla hundratals samtal jag haft efter mina föreläsningar, av alla tusentals mail, brev och meddelanden jag har fått, växte en övertygelse sig starkare inom mig. För när jag har betraktat samhällen, våra liv, medmänniskor jag mött, vardagshjältar vi skrivit om, mina men även andras barn, hur världen ser ut, hur vi har det, naturen och så mycket mer så har jag mer och mer insett att vad vi skriver för lite om, vad vi pratar för lite om, är något jag vid några få gånger, i mina texter, nuddat vid men aldrig fördjupat mig i.

De flesta, i Sverige är det nog över en halv miljon personer, som via mina texter, radio, tv och tidningar fått ta del av min bakgrund känner delvis till hur jag gjorde för att överleva fysisk och psykisk misshandel. Hur jag gjorde för att stå emot all ondska jag som barn utsattes för. Vad jag alltid sagt höll mig, min själ och min kärna vid liv var framför allt två  drömmar. Drömmar som blev min trygghet under en period där allt annat kändes som ett helvete. 

Men ovanstående är bara en del av sanningen. Den andra delen, den som få, kanske ingen, känner till, är att det framför allt var tron på kärleken, som höll mig vid liv. Med det menar jag
column2:
det som höll min låga tänd, som höll min själ intakt.

(Plats: Babels bibliotek i Palma, Mallorca. Jag tillbringade över 100 timmar på den platsen och det mesta av boken skrevs där. Babel blev lite av mitt andra hem.)

Jag skapade Good News Magazine för att hjälpa andra att lyckas med samma sak. Och jag har nu skrivit boken Den Enda.  Där jag skriver om det som livet egentligen för mig handlar om
column3:
kärlek. 

(Grunden till omslaget. Illustratör: Yanella Ekman)

Boken är först och främst en kärlekshistoria om Elma och Nathaniel.  Två vackra själar med både sår och ärr. I dem finner vi lågan vi alla har. Den jag så mycket försökt, genom magasinet och med mina föreläsningar, att påminna oss om. De är lika starka som sköra. Lika hela som trasiga. Boken är en resa två människor gör för att en dag komma hem. Ett hem de delvis först måste finna inom sig själva, ett hem de senare enbart kan bygga tillsammans, och där grunden är kärlek, respekt och omtanke. För varandra, till varandra och för livet. 

Vem är då Elma? Elma är kvinnan som räddade min själ. Elma kanske är du. Elma och Nathaniel kanske är en helhet av alla pusselbitar jag samlat i varje möte, med varje medmänniska, som genom åren korsat min stig. Är jag Nathaniel? Kanske. Men spelar det någon roll? Kanske är allt fiktion.

Jag är övertygad om att du kommer att känna igen dig. Att något inom dig kommer att le, något inom dig kommer att skratta och något inom dig kommer att gråta. Min förhoppning är att få dig att se det vackra i dig. Men även det vackra i vår värld. Det vackra du kan dela med någon annan. Min förhoppning är också att hjälpa dig att öppna ditt hjärta. Och kanske någonstans på vägen, genom Elmas och Nathaniels kärlek, vill jag hjälpa dig att läka din själ. 

Precis som med Good News Magazine vill jag att Den Enda sprids. Därför vänder jag mig nu till dig med denna vädjan: Om du tror på det jag gör, om du tror att mina texter kan hjälpa någon, om du tror att en bok om kärlek skriven av någon som idogt försökt motbevisa en hel bransch genom att sprida optimism och framtidstro kan vara samhället till nytta, någon som vänt totalt mörker till något positivt, om du anser att kärlek är något vi aldrig kan skriva, prata eller få för mycket av, om du vill hjälpa mig att bidra till en bättre och vackrare värld... köp Den Enda. Köp den till dig och/eller till någon du värnar om.
