","M4F ORIGIN STORY

Every so often a book comes along that has the power to foster powerful change in the way people think. Packed with heart and wisdom gained from four U.S. Supreme Court and three Arizona Supreme Court appearances, author Morgan Joseph Langan brings forward such a book:
A MANUAL FOR FREEDOM – THE PEACEFUL SOVEREIGN’S PATH (M4F)

M4F was borne of adversity when a bank using fraudulent paperwork, invoked non-judicial foreclosure to evict Morgan and his family from their home --using nine fully-armed sheriff deputies. Additionally, they had invested over $2 million dollars and 7 years of their lives building their home into Grace Grove Retreat Center where they have guided hundreds of individuals through life transforming experiences. None of this mattered to the banks. The law did not require them to answer my questions while local courts accepted the bank's fraudulently recorded documents as proof of title.

As you witness in the video, Morgan is peacefully explaining that the matter was in the Supreme Court. You witness his disbelief that a Yavapai County Sheriff held more power over his land than the U.S. Supreme Court. Morgan honestly believed that Article lV of our Constitution meant that he and his family were secure in their home against this unreasonable and unlawful seizure. The Manual outlines how this situation highly motivated him and has now placed him in a unique role to lead by example of what not to do!  However, even Morgan's harsh lessons will shine the light for others seeking sovereignty. The manual outlines a simple step by step ""Sovereignty Process"" so that others may chose their own unique and more graceful path toward this freedom.

Holding to his belief in the Supreme Law of the Land and holding rightful title, his journey was not always easy and required thousands of hours of research on Equity and the Law. Discovering this distinction was the key that not only redeemed the family home, it is the grail to lead America back onto a peaceful path.

Using foundational principles of equity, justice, honesty, and good faith, he shares in M4F how he won his beloved property back using Equity. His book lays out the path to peaceful sovereignty, founded in trust law, equity maxims and the Constitution. You'll learn in the manual how to become self-governing so that together “We The People,” may actively form “a more perfect Union,” just as the Founding Fathers intended in their revolutionary Constitution.
LEAVING YOUR LEGACY

Ever wondered how the wealthiest people in America manage to own nothing and control everything at the same time, protecting their assets from seizure in spite of massive corporate losses and frauds associated with their wealth? Morgan's manual reveals secrets of how this is possible and makes the knowledge available to all Americans in open-sourcing fashion.

M4F is the distillation of thousands of hours of Morgan’s personal research, court appearances, document preparation and fellowship with some of the most brilliant law researchers of our time. Through this process, Morgan beat the banks using the rules adopted by our founders. The manual describes his lessons (like don't try to beat them at their own game) and methods to claim the hidden system of equity guaranteed in Article 3 of the Constitution. Equity is the power  predatory banking enterprises are attempting to usurp this has allows them to destroy our economy without going to jail. Are you convinced they are too big to fail? Protect your family,  assets and legacy now.
M4F HIGHLIGHTS

In a nutshell, M4F teaches you how to change your status & your standing to align with equity in order to have the capacity to represent your private interests--without an attorney you will learn how to navigate this confusing court system. Here are a few of the hard-won lessons you’ll learn from M4F:
The treasure the Founding Fathers gave us in this Constitution that is the most uniquely empowering to life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness in world history.
The shared foundations of spiritual and constitutional freedom--our inherent right--is affirmed and established in the U.S. constitution.
How a criminal commerce system has taken control of our legal system and government, establishing itself as the major power in our country.
How your inherent rights guaranteed in the Constitution have been transferred through hidden rules of contract law and common legal relationships to benefit commercial enterprises.

How America has arrived at this pivotal choice point in history where individuals must establish status and standing under equity while refusing to ""do business with"" criminal commercial organizations in order to save our country.
Ideas to gracefully reverse engineer the financial bankruptcy of the united States of America.
Valuable principles on the formation of business using the power of trust law for preservation of your legacy.
A long look into our society’s future when enough peaceful sovereign Americans learn to utilize the inherent power of our Constitution and take positive entrepreneurial action.

“By itself alone, Chapter 4 has the potential to earn back your contribution many times over, by providing you with a template to set up Constitutional trusts. These trusts empower you to protect your business interests and private assets while giving you more privacy and freedom to create your own legacy.”  Morgan Joseph Langan
MASTERMIND PERKS

The M4F book will beautifully introduce you to the concepts of self-governance and provide you with useful instruction. The book provides you with the basics to begin implementing these principles in your personal life. It also provides a basis to commence civil discourse. Our founders did not always agree yet they all believed in the principles and values which allowed them create our Constitution. Our membership system allows us to learn from each other. Together we learn from each member's private ""mistake"" and/or ""victory"".  Morgan and his M4F team will lead the discourse via the educational perks shown in the campaign.

Haunting stories of loss, hope, courage and heroism.

Joyce Ng’s 9/11 Hotel Survivors: An Oral History eternally preserves a monumental tragedy in American history through the voices of the people who were in the 9/11 Hotel that day.  

The stories that Joyce Ng has compiled comes from a diverse group of individuals: people who managed to escape from the famous 24-story hotel that was destroyed on 9/11.  The book contains oral histories of harrowing escapes from firefighters, economists, lawyers, hotel guests, employees, business travelers,  individuals from other countries.  One of the stories of survival include the author, Joyce Ng, who was a recent college graduate traveling on a business trip to the World Trade Center and narrowly escaped death.  The book also speaks to the heroes who risked their lives to help others, and the bereaved of 9/11.

These are individuals whose lives will be forever impacted by the horror and chaos they witnessed.

Joyce Ng’s moving oral history chronicles the stories of a group of people who miraculously made it to safety: It covers survivors who were caught in the rubble, to the priest who narrowly escaped while in the gym on the 24th floor, to the heroes who risked their lives to rescue a disabled woman in a wheelchair, to business travelers, to firefighters who risked their lives to save others. There are many amazing stories, including the journey post-9/11 of uniting with other survivors.

  The faces of 9/11 hotel survivors 

  These are the faces of the survivors and the bereaved
column7:
>Stories of miraculous escapes

Joyce worked with the History channel on a documentary focused on the hotel, and the video can be found in the clip above.

column1: 9/11 Survivors: Joyce Ng and Dick Stark at the new 9/11 National Museum (2014)
There are amazing stories of escape and triumph in the book

Dick was 80 years old and in the hotel when the building collapsed on him. Trapped in the rubble and dust, Dick could not breathe. At 80 years old,  he thought he would perish in the hotel amidst the dust and rubble.  Miraculously, Dick was saved by a firefighter, who guided Dick to leave.  He made Dick cross the steel beam and lead him out to safety.  Although Dick was hospitalized, he lived for nearly 14 more years after 9/11 due to the bravery of the firefighter. His story is an amazing tribute to survival.
With 50 years difference between the two survivors, it showed that 9/11 impacted people of all ages, and diverse backgrounds, but it also brought people together.

9/11 National Museum and BOOK For 9/11 survivors, it is important to have the survivors and the building we escaped from be represented as part of  the historical telling of 9/11.   Having history be told through personal artifacts, photographs and first-person testimonial is an essential and powerful way  to remember 9/11. With museum artifacts and a book, it will help tell the full historical stories for future generations.
Please support our project

About the Author

The author, Joyce Ng was traveling to New York on one of her first consulting assignments.  She was a recent college graduate and as a young adult, witnessed a major event that forever changed her life.  On 9/11, when the first plane crashed into the North Tower, she was trapped on the 13th floor of the hotel. The plane's landing gear fell onto the roof of the hotel, and the building caught on fire.  While the hotel was burning, debris was falling around the area and she witnessed people getting killed or injured.   Joyce, and many others, had to flee the burning building.  For Joyce, witnessing a devastation at young age left a devastating impact.   There is not a day that goes by that she doesn't think about 9/11.
On a mission to help others, she has founded a non-profit to unite 9/11 survivors from the hotel and bring awareness to the trauma and plight from everyone who witnessed terrorist attacks.

The cover is scheduled to be completed in late June and the editing is scheduled to be done in mid August. My tentative release date for the novel in both digital and print form is the first week in October. I'm currently on page 140 after three months of writing and I should finish by June, my projection for book length is 60-75k words and 240 to 300 pages, I'm well ahead of my August editing deadline and will have no problem finishing. 


I highly suggest that everyone thinking about donating go check out the wonderful work being done by the folks at www.bookflydesign.com They're worth every penny and then some.


To be honest, this is all a bit awkward for me, I never ask for money, I'm usually a do-it-yourself kind of guy. That said, I really want to do this right, I want the finished product to look nice with an outstanding cover that welcomes and intrigues the reader and I want it to read like a professional piece of writing, my prose is pretty fun but I can't wait until I get the opportunity to re-write everything after it's been edited by a professional 3rd party.
column17:
>I believe in the story I'm writing. Hannah, The Huntress is a celebration of the tropes that I love, if you read it you're going to see some old friends that you'r familiar with. The characters are purposefully diverse because I believe that's important in modern storytelling and the protagonist is the most nuanced and delightful female lead that I could imagine, because I love strong women main characters with weapons and questionable supernatural backstories that beat the hell out of people. 

It's also a book for the over 18 crowd, because we need those too. There's swearing, there's blood and gore, there's sex, there's questionable choices by the characters (and probably the author), what happens in these pages isn't black and white, it's all a touch of gray depending on your pov. Initially I started writing a YA novel but quickly realized that isn't how I write, I enjoy four letter words too much, so essentially what I then wrote was a YA novel for grown-ups, Hannah, The Huntress still feels a bit like your classic teenage coming of age story but it veers off into Rated

What is a ""USAP""?

If you use a smartphone, odds are that you have taken a handful of ""USAPs"" yourself. USAP stands for ""unedited smartphone aesthetic pic(s),"" -- as well as a community of smartphone photographers and their shockingly incredible body of work.
by Vim Ala

It was some ungodly hour on December 3rd, 2014 when Kayleigh Cox was messing around with images she had taken on her phone and feeling frustrated by the process of Instagram and the culture of filters. Her pictures were good as they were. Editing was unnecessary for most of the photos and the hallmark square-cropped look that Instagram was known for would often destroy the composition of most smartphone photography. There were too many steps. She wanted a place to post raw smartphone images with likeminded photographers.

She created the Facebook group ""unedited smartphone aesthetic pics"" to start dumping what was mostly an archive of interesting photos featuring subjects and scenery from her iPhone 4s. After adding other photographers, Kayleigh never thought the group would amount to anything special. The group now has 8,117 members -- and that is just of this morning, with numbers growing every day.

""I think the 'aesthetic movement' in the modern art scene amongst millennial artists and Internet meme-makers may have had something to do with the immediate popularity, meaning that I never had to do much advertising to get it to take off. Apparently, the space for unedited smartphone aesthetic pics was, in fact, already desired and needed by weird art kids like me all across the country and world,"" Kayleigh writes.

by Angus Lang

***You can check out the public page on Facebook, or email me at usapzine@gmail.com if you want to be added. Otherwise, you have to know someone to get in. It's sort of like a club. You probably already are friends with a USAPer on facebook.
So, why am I reading this?

You're reading this because you have the potential to participate in the genesis of the next big art magazine. What we have online in the form of hundreds of thousands of photos in a weird secret facebook group, we want to print onto glossy paper and put it on your coffee table.

Your contributions would go directly into the pocket of the photographers, of the small team behind USAP, and to cover the cost of printing a magazine.

>Anyone can participate in submitting to be featured in the USAP mag by posting in the facebook group or by contacting us personally. You don't even need a smartphone, as proven by our avid flip phone photographers.

column1: There are enough people and submissions already involved that we could, hypothetically, be putting out issues on a monthly basis. But that's only if we have the funds and resources.
How can I participate in ""the genesis of the next big art magazine""?
by Julianna Salguero

At this point, the creative work as well as the less creative work that is already going towards this first issue has been done for the low, low cost of free. The staff behind the magazine are students, professionals, published writers, curators, and artists. We would love to pay our staff.

Megan Lazarou, Director of Print of IQ Total Source, quoted the first issue with associated costs to cost $4,000 and $6,000 for a 50 page magazine with more than 50 images.  If there is anyone reading this with access to affordable printing -- email us.

by Matt Storto


Although all of our current submitters are not expecting pay at this point, guess what? We want to pay them, too! Any photographer featured in the mag will get paid. This is the highest priority behind the magazine itself being printed and distributed. The more money donated to this campaign, the more money we give the artists.
To break that $8,000 number down:

Sample draft spread by Rylie Butner Thanks to everyone who has been with us since the beginning, who has posted pictures of their cats in mid-jump, who snapped a pic of a weird shadow outside their church. Thank you for being a part of the USAP community.
We've already redefined the scope of modern photography -- so let's redefine scope of modern magazines.

column1: Backer Rewards

Since Bonkers will be a free publication, we plan on rewarding our backers with physical rewards, from koozies to a gaper makeover to a sweet pair of custom skis. While our goal is to raise money, we want to offer concrete rewards to our backers. All of our perks are either physical objects (t-shirts, stickers) or experiences (adventure with us, etc.).

Risks &

Magazine publishing is a big undertaking. Creating great content is time consuming and difficult. Adventure stories are logistically and physically difficult.  By forgoing print we will be able to focus our energies on telling great stories, and by basing ourselves in the American west we will be able to launch ambitious adventures from our backyard.
While this is a first for us, our team's work has appeared in Gear Patrol, Active Junky, Liftopia, the Colorado Independent, KRCC, Backpacker, and others.
Q: How much will an issue of Bonkers Magazine cost?
Bonkers will be free. We plan on supporting ourselves with advertising revenue in the long term.

How we plan on spending the funds we raise depends on the amount that we raise. If we raise $15k we will spend it differently than if we raise $10k. Some of the money will go towards paying freelancers, some of it will go towards logistics and travel, and some of it will go towards design. Our $15,000 goal will cover a season's worth of operating expenses.

column4: >Q: Why don't you have stretch goals?

>A: We want to focus on making the best publication we can make.  If we exceed our goals, we can travel farther afield, have iOS and Android apps, and publish more often, but we don't want to make promises we can't keep, and if we have to chose great content over something like an app or a special issue, great content will win  every time.
>Q: When will I get my backer rewards?

column1: A: We will start sending desktop wallpapers on a monthly basis once Bonkers #1 launches, as the wallpapers will be based on each issue's content. We will start shipping apparel, including the gaper makeover, a month after the campaign concludes. The skis will start shipping two months after the campaign concludes (handmade skis take time to make). If you chose a reward that includes an experience, we will work closely with you to make sure that the reward fits your schedule.
Q: Why do you think Edward Abbey or John Muir would want to read your magazine? Are you an environmentalist magazine?

A: We think that Abbey or Muir would read our magazine because we are as much about the places that we adventure as the things we do. To us, nature is more than a backdrop against which adventures happen-- it's why we adventure. While we hope that people will read Bonkers and be inspired to protect the places they love, we're not a magazine about activism.
Q: Are you a crew of professional badass adventurers?
Nooope. We probably won't be the first to summit something, but we might be the first to hike a keg somewhere. We're aware of our limits.
Other Ways To Help
If you can't contribute, the easiest way to help us is to read our magazine! We would also appreciate it if you would share this campaign on social media.

>""The White Man and the Pachinko Girl"" is the debut novel and book 1 of the series ""Tokyo Faces"" by Asian writer Vann Chow. 

I have written the book The White Man and the Pachinko Girl over the course of many years. The book is self-published and released end of last year and is available in digital and printed formats. Now I would like to bring the book to an even wider audience by creating and audiobook, as well as translating it into Chinese and Japanese. 

I appreciate the support from the wonderful Indiegogo community for this endeavor.

Motivation to write the book: 

Japan has always fascinates me, yet the more I learnt about it, the more I have come to realize that this amazing country with its unique cultures and rich history often times offered so much distraction through its dazzling, energetic, relentless representations in anime, movies, pop music and world-class innovations that they masked the diverse voices of the people behind.

On the surface, The White Man and the Pachinko Girl is a murder mystery. In fact, I tried to use this work to explores many human rights issues such as gender inequality, hyper sexualization of teens, homosexual discrimination, racial discrimination and workplace bullying among others in Japan through the eyes of a foreigner with his friends from different walks of lives and professions. Through the protagonists' adventures, we can experience first hand the alienation, the suppression, the abuse, the emotional struggle that they are going through.
column6:
/>

Synopsis: 

An American business man who liked to linger in Pachinko parlor every night in his lonely life as a foreigner in the city of Tokyo met Misa, a young Japanese hostess that worked at a Pachinko parlor by chance. Knowing her personal woes, he gave her his winning as an exchange for Japanese lessons. That large sum of money incriminated them to false accuse of sex trade. Meanwhile, an ex-adult film producer investigated the death of a certain foreign producer who happened to have filmed Misa in his legendary work, in which she was seemingly strangled to death.

Praises for the book:

White the book has only been recently published, it has received stellar amount of requests on Goodreads during both times of book giveaway events as well as excellent reviews from readers who were offered the book for honest reviews. Here are some of the praises for the book. 

""I read The White Man and the Pachinko Girl in one sitting. I was completely transported to Tokyo, Japan, forgetting where I was. It was an epic novel. Vann's story is emotionally complex and filled with passion. I am sure it will captivate readers from East and West."" ― Damien Baker, writer.

""Vann has a unique knowledge of the Japan. Her perspective feeds my interest in their often contradictory but nonetheless endlessly fascinating culture. "" ― Leanne Kalney, writer. 

""The White Man and the Pachinko Girl is the ultimate psychological thriller featuring Japan."" ― Eden Watts, blogger.

""I found The White Man and the Pachinko Girl absolutely riveting! I started reading it one night after supper with every intention of reading just a few chapters for that evening and could not put it down. Not only is it an emotionally engaging story with well-drawn characters whom you grow to care about deeply, but it is also entertaining. Read this book. It will keep you guessing throughout about the three main protagonists, Smith, Misa and Tanaka, all of them with something to hide from the world which would bring the story of one unnamed girl together."" ―Liz Spence, blogger.

Author biography:

Vann Chow was born in Hong Kong. She graduated with honors from Carnegie Mellon University with a Chemical Engineering degree and has lived and worked as a scientist in three continents by age twenty eight. Her life experience has granted her unique insights into interactions between different cultures which inspired her writings. Her stories often confront human rights and social issues. Oscar Wilde, William Somerset Maugham and Alain De Botton are her favorite authors.

Your Contribution:

Your contribution is going to be used wisely in 

1) the production of an audiobook. 

The prologue of the book has been produced as a test and could be view in the Youtube link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m7fbYJK1GpU

2) Translation of the book into Chinese and Japanese. 

Reward:

Thank you to all of your passion in supporting English language literature by international writers.

Allegiant Publishing Group

Our company has three unique imprints with which we plan to shake up the publishing industry. We want to give advantages back to authors. Our imprints include:

Snow Leopard Publishing - We want to roll out a program that allows authors to pick their own contracts, ensuring that they get a good deal that works for them. We want to end authors having to jump through hoops to get a literary agent then having to pay that agent 15% of royalties. Snow Leopard also offers a unique ""Profits to Authors Program"" that lets authors ""invest"" in the company and earn even higher royalties in return. This program is very popular with our current authors and is growing and evolving as we grow.
<li>

Centum Press - We want to give every flash fiction and short story author the money he or she deserves. We don't pay flat fees or tell authors that the exposure they get is payment enough. We pay authors who are published in our anthologies real royalties, and we believe that the royalty checks that we send out will be sizable for short story and flash fiction contributions. Each contributing author becomes a member of the team and we all work together to make the authors a decent profit.
<li>

Wizards Keep Publishing - We just acquired this imprint, and we plan to relaunch it in April with a ""Book Family Program"" that will allow new authors to write and traditionally publish series. So many publishers won't even touch series or trilogies written by new authors, but we are going to guarantee any author who publishes with us that we will publish, if he or she so chooses, all of the books in his or her series or trilogy as long as the series continues to meet our guidelines.

The art and literature of a society is where it's true beauty lies. Authors deserve much better than they currently receive, and our mission is to give them back the advantages that have been taken from them. Will you help us in our mission?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We have specific plans for these funds:

  • We need a lawyer to help us with drafting all of the individualized contracts for Snow Leopard Publishing's Pick Your Own Contract Program.
  • We need more people to help us go through Centum Press' submissions so that more authors can get the money they deserve for their work.
  • We need a variety of things for Wizards Keep Publishing's Book Family Program that includes: a unique contract that we need a lawyer to draft as well as website edits and capabilities that will help us manage the program.

column1: • As all three imprints continue to grow at their currently rapid rate, we are going to need to bring on more readers, editors and staff to aid in getting our books out in a timely fashion.

• We want to add to our advertising budget to bring even more attention to the talented pool of indie authors that we are representing.

    • The Impact On Authors

    We're not fat cats sitting in a smokey back room. Your contribution won't line our pockets. It will help us give back to our authors. Specifically, your contribution will help us:

    • Give authors who don't have the time to get a literary agent, authors who don't want one, and authors who can't get one, the chance to get contracts perfectly customized for them.
• Give authors a fair compensation for their flash fiction and short stories rather than giving them less than we'd spend on a cup of coffee.

• Give new authors with series or trilogies a chance and the guarantee that their future books won't be orphaned.

    • Risks &
column2:
Challenges

As with any project, there will be challenges in making this one happen. Industry big wigs won't like what we're doing, but they aren't the people we want to impress. We want authors' support. If we have that, we've won in our book. We aren't afraid to admit that if an author doesn't make money, we, as publishers, don't make money so we pledge to work hard to make sure we all win.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, consider submitting to us or letting an author friend know about one or all of our imprints. Our ultimate goal here is to give authors back the advantages that used to be standard for talented writers. Anything that you do that aids in the accomplishment of that goal would mean a ton to us.

Lukas sources low-rez clips of violent protests to the news feeds. His reputation is his only asset. That and his willingness to be in the fray. Overnight, his reputation flatlines and the only explanation is that he saw something that he wasn't meant to see. Lukas must figure out what he saw before whoever is responsible, finds him.

What's the point?

I am an independent author, about to break into the publishing world with a little something that I call, The Sky’s Eyes. I enjoy getting my hands dirty and being involved in the process. That is why I decided to go the route of self-publishing. I want to be involved in every step and make sure that the story is given every opportunity to shine. I need your help to make it happen because professional editors don't work for free. But, I don't want your charity, I will give you something in return. I want us to feel like we are in a reciprocating relationship
column2:
I give you something for your trust and willingness to help out. So, I have created a structure that creates value for both of us. Seriously, take a look.

A preview of the story:

Chapter 1:

“How do I look?”

“Off tint.”

“Gimme a sec...Dirty white behind scratched plexi is the best I can do for now.”

“Hold still. Calibrating. Better, but if you find something cleaner, give me 10 seconds.”

Lukas turns away from an ad for pharmaceutical-grade intestinal bacteria on the side of the bus stop, pulls his hood forward and begins walking. He joins a sparse tide of people that is slowly and steadily growing. Some carry signs, a few have cameras or bags with a large red cross on a white circle. Some nearly bubble with excitement, some run, some bounce and some move with steady efficiency. Others wear the grim face of one who has a job to perform and some of the grim-faced are spectators, which should cause concern among those who watch for these things. Lukas moves from the waist down, upper body nearly immobile
column3:
a compromise between an effort to look normal and the desire to keep the camera steady.

A low-profile pack with no hanging tabs or straps is secured firmly across Lukas’s back. The hooded shirt and pants fit closely with no loose material to be grabbed onto or inadvertently catch on anything and are made of a high-tech performance material that marry mobility and sturdiness. Lukas taps the side of the tintless eyeglasses and a faint translucent screen pops up in the space a few feet in front of him and off to the left. After a short boot-up sequence, an image of a mass of people in an open square which updates every few seconds appears. A news feed superimposed over the image begins scrolling across the image consisting of short phrases describing the chaos.

“I've got the feed,” Lukas mumbles, attempting to not draw any attention to himself from the people around whose numbers have increased while the audible din they have been approaching also grows. His effort is unnecessary because those around him, beginning to feed off of the chaotic energy of the crowd up ahead, have broken into a steady jog. Still and video camera operators are holding their hands to their ears and talking as they inform someone that they have reached the day's event. Lukas keeps one eye ahead so as not to stumble and the other on the bird's eye view of the crowd in his news feed, trying to determine the best location to move toward.

If you are interested in reading the rest of the rough draft of Chapter 1, follow the link to the website. Just make sure you come back.

The perks

As I mentioned above, for very little money, you will get some worthwhile rewards. Ebooks start at $3 (but only for the first five backers that want it), paperbacks starting at $12 (for the first 5 backers). But even the regularly priced books are reasonable, $6 for an ebook and $15 for the paperback and you also will receive the postcard and bookmark in these packages.

Like all of the other campaigns, there are variations and packages for everyone. You can purchase multiple items, be acknowledged in the novel for your generous contribution and receive a signed copy. But, we have created something really special: You will have an opportunity to name one of the main characters in the story. There is an opportunity to name a male character and and female character. Imagine knowing that you were memorializing someone, anyone, forever in this book. Maybe a favorite grandmother or a best friend. Of course, if it is your name that you want to put in print, that is fine as well.

The details (without the devil)

The book is written. In fact, some of the prep work has already been done: One round of proofreading is complete and the cover has been designed.

So, all we need to make this book a reality is $1900. Why $1900, you ask? That money goes to paying professional content, copy, layout and design editors. I am looking for another round of proofreading as well. Once all that is done, then I need to create the eBook, have the printed copies made and ship off everything that goes to physical address. That is where you come in: For as little as $3, you can be a part of something big
column4:
you can help to bring this story to the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps this story is not your cup of tea, or you are not in a position to invest at the moment. Or, you are participating and want others to have the opportunity as well. Whatever your situation, you can help make this potentiality a reality. You can help an author break away from the old-fashioned machinery of the publishing world.

Let your friends and family know about this campaign. You will find quick and easy buttons at the top of the page on the right side. Use those buttons to signal your support and share this campaign. You can help me reach a much wider audience than I could ever approach on my own.

Thank you for taking the time to read all the way to the bottom. Now, go and tell some people. No, first make a pledge, then tell everyone you know. Have a great day. Unless it is night time when you are reading this, in which case have a great night.

","Lukas sources low-rez clips of violent protests to the news feeds. His reputation is his only asset. That and his willingness to be in the fray. Overnight, his reputation flatlines and the only explanation is that he saw something that he wasn't meant to see. Lukas must figure out what he saw before whoever is responsible, finds him.What's the point?I am an independent author, about to break into the publishing world with a little something that I call, The Sky’s Eyes. I enjoy getting my hands dirty and being involved in the process. That is why I decided to go the route of self-publishing. I want to be involved in every step and make sure that the story is given every opportunity to shine. I need your help to make it happen because professional editors don't work for free. But, I don't want your charity, I will give you something in return. I want us to feel like we are in a reciprocating relationship
column5: I give you something for your trust and willingness to help out. So, I have created a structure that creates value for both of us. Seriously, take a look.A preview of the story:Chapter 1:“How do I look?”“Off tint.”“Gimme a sec...Dirty white behind scratched plexi is the best I can do for now.”“Hold still. Calibrating. Better, but if you find something cleaner, give me 10 seconds.”Lukas turns away from an ad for pharmaceutical-grade intestinal bacteria on the side of the bus stop, pulls his hood forward and begins walking. He joins a sparse tide of people that is slowly and steadily growing. Some carry signs, a few have cameras or bags with a large red cross on a white circle. Some nearly bubble with excitement, some run, some bounce and some move with steady efficiency. Others wear the grim face of one who has a job to perform and some of the grim-faced are spectators, which should cause concern among those who watch for these things. Lukas moves from the waist down, upper body nearly immobile
column6: a compromise between an effort to look normal and the desire to keep the camera steady.A low-profile pack with no hanging tabs or straps is secured firmly across Lukas’s back. The hooded shirt and pants fit closely with no loose material to be grabbed onto or inadvertently catch on anything and are made of a high-tech performance material that marry mobility and sturdiness. Lukas taps the side of the tintless eyeglasses and a faint translucent screen pops up in the space a few feet in front of him and off to the left. After a short boot-up sequence, an image of a mass of people in an open square which updates every few seconds appears. A news feed superimposed over the image begins scrolling across the image consisting of short phrases describing the chaos.“I've got the feed,” Lukas mumbles, attempting to not draw any attention to himself from the people around whose numbers have increased while the audible din they have been approaching also grows. His effort is unnecessary because those around him, beginning to feed off of the chaotic energy of the crowd up ahead, have broken into a steady jog. Still and video camera operators are holding their hands to their ears and talking as they inform someone that they have reached the day's event. Lukas keeps one eye ahead so as not to stumble and the other on the bird's eye view of the crowd in his news feed, trying to determine the best location to move toward.If you are interested in reading the rest of the rough draft of Chapter 1, follow the link to the website. Just make sure you come back.The perksAs I mentioned above, for very little money, you will get some worthwhile rewards. Ebooks start at $3 (but only for the first five backers that want it), paperbacks starting at $12 (for the first 5 backers). But even the regularly priced books are reasonable, $6 for an ebook and $15 for the paperback and you also will receive the postcard and bookmark in these packages.Like all of the other campaigns, there are variations and packages for everyone. You can purchase multiple items, be acknowledged in the novel for your generous contribution and receive a signed copy. But, we have created something really special: You will have an opportunity to name one of the main characters in the story. There is an opportunity to name a male character and and female character. Imagine knowing that you were memorializing someone, anyone, forever in this book. Maybe a favorite grandmother or a best friend. Of course, if it is your name that you want to put in print, that is fine as well.The details (without the devil)The book is written. In fact, some of the prep work has already been done: One round of proofreading is complete and the cover has been designed.So, all we need to make this book a reality is $1900. Why $1900, you ask? That money goes to paying professional content, copy, layout and design editors. I am looking for another round of proofreading as well. Once all that is done, then I need to create the eBook, have the printed copies made and ship off everything that goes to physical address. That is where you come in: For as little as $3, you can be a part of something big
column7: you can help to bring this story to the world.Other Ways You Can HelpPerhaps this story is not your cup of tea, or you are not in a position to invest at the moment. Arsenal is a glamourous club – a global brand that has always attracted the rich and famous – British Royalty, Pop icons, Olympians and Hollywood stars have all rubbed shoulders at matches down the years. However, there is one breed of celebrity which Arsenal have lured in bizarrely high proportions... COMEDIANS!

Our book features a vast array of Gooner Comedy Royalty, interviewing them about the passion and support for Arsenal FC – from international super-star funny men Paul Kaye and Matt Lucas, the elder statesmen such as Clive Anderson, Laurence Marks and Maurice Gran, through to the current sitcom, panel show and stand-up kings, including Alan Davies, Romesh Ranganathan, Hugh Dennis, Ian Stone, Dara O’Briain, Milton Jones, Tom Rosenthal and Alex Brooker... Plus  rising stars in the shape of Gary Marshall, Chris Martin and Jim Campbell.
The book is in support of Comic Relief, with a percentage of every sale donated to the charity.
So, please click one of the purchase 'perks' and help us bring this superb book to life by reserving your copy.

Short Summary
The #Choose Happy Journal is designed to help you  focus on your well-being and inner happiness.
<ul>
• Motivating stories
• Weekly priority lists
• My day to do list
• Morning and Evening gratitude
These  tools will help you  create a life of lasting energy, happiness and success.
The #Choose Happy Journal is Viviana’s brainchild. It's a replica of what she used to overcome a difficult period in her life. It has helped her find a way to turn setbacks into comebacks.

Then, fate brought Viviana, Marion and Michelle together. Three women doing their own thing, and with their own axes to grind and difficulties to overcome. When the trio put their heads together the  original idea of the journal began to evolve and take shape.

Their hope for the #Choose Happy Journal is that it will give others the same motivation, inspiration and outcomes that it has given them. They want to help other people who have to overcome the challenges of life, so that they can be happier and also more productive. We all deserve to live an inspired and happy life, being able to overcome any challenge and  live a fulfilling life.
How You Can Help Us Reach Our Goal
Some of you may not be able to  contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
<ul>
• We need 12,000 USD to make the #Choose Happy Journal become a reality.
• Help us  get the word out  to your friends and family  everywhere, and make some noise about our campaign.
• Share this campaign on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter using the share tools on the sidebar.
• We have created amazing bonuses for our supporters. We want you to be part of our new community.
• The project will go ahead even if we don't reach our full goal. We are passionate about bringing happiness in people's lives every day.
Benefits
The important elements of the journal are a system that will help you be accountable for your every day emotions and things to do.
The journal will help you:
<ul>
• Focus on your well-being.
• Become aware of your emotions.
• Reconnect with gratitude.
• Be and stay organized.
• Become proactive.
• Get you out of your comfort zone.
• Keep your motivation high.
• Be Happy.
<h3>Our Commitment Despite Risks &amp

Life challenges have prepared us to face its many obstacles.  We have gone through the ups and downs of life, in so doing we have realized that unless we have happiness in our life we will live a life devoid of gratitude.
Our commitment :
<ul>
• We will  work hard to make this project a reality not just for us but for all those people who believe in us and the #Choose Happy project.
• We are strong and determined to make #Choose Happy a reality.
• We will ensure that all challenges be dealt with promptly and professionally to ensure that not only the best quality is delivered to you but that you can also count on our commitment to you.

​

Short Summary


    I did 6 1/2 years in prison and with each waking day in there I knew that I never wanted to return to that place again so I spent my time sketching out business plans of things to pursue upon my release. I wrote 8 full novels, over 1,000 songs, 25 short stories and more. When I ran out of paper I'd write on anything I can find, the back of old letters, the back of Request Forms. With the money sent to me by friends and family I'd exchange snack items for magazines, dictionaries, things to concur with my writings. After reading over 200 books by other authors I got tired of their endings and storylines and I said you know what, I can write my own book. And I did. No notes, no list of characters, just a pen and a blank page where I started with the first line and the rest just flowed.
  • I came home March 25, 2015 and I started working immediately for my dad doing sales for his Pressure Washing business. My wages was $200 per week plus 10% salary on every new account I landed. With 8 handwritten manuscripts in my closet I had to pick which one to pursue first. I chose ""Only If I"" because the contents made it a book for everyone, an unlimited target audience. After picking ""Only If I"", I began typing the manuscript. After that was completed I used all the money from my job to do the designs for the cover and flyers to promote my original gofunding campaign (which only raised $140). I thought that with my original campaign I would get all the money I needed to get it published with Xlibris, a company that sells self publishing packages to aspiring authors. To make a long story short, the campaign failed. Maybe I should've listened to my mom and added the prison part. I was afraid to because people in this world can be so cruel and judgmental. I thought that it would run people away. So what I ended up launching was a half assed campaign, which probably made people look at it and say why doesn't he just get a fucking job like the rest of us, not realizing there's a reason why I'm 30 years old and still living with my parents.


What I'd Do With the Money


  • Instantpublisher.com

column1: is a site that prints books for independent authors. My first purchase with
them was for 25 copies which came to a total of $272, a little over $10 per
copy. The more books you order the cheaper the price is to print. To print
1,000 copies it would cost $3,500, reducing it to $3.50 per book. If I was able
to purchase 1,000 copies I could then reduce the retail price to $10 each and
even be able to give some away to give me a better chance of my book landing in
the right persons hands.
But the cost doesn’t stop there
because once I have 1,000 books in my hands, then it costs more money to get
them to the public. In order to successfully do this I would have to take road
trips, I would have to get more flyers, more signs, attend more events. This is
what I call ‘A Promotional Bank’. A few thousand dollars inside my promotional
bank is absolutely necessary to go hand in hand with my 1,000 book purchase.

What's the Book About Anyway?

What's crazy is, when I approach people in public, it's more like I'm selling them my personal story and not the storyline to the book. When they hear I'm out of prison and heading in this direction they immediately reach into their pocket to support me. But I promise you, the book is just as good as my own story, lol. Instead of telling you about it I'll just let you read the first chapter...
The First Chapter of 'Only If I'
Today she was wearing a shade of cool blue eye
shadow against black mascara making her look icy, chilly even. Bubblegum lip
gloss accentuated her features and she appeared to be in benign repose while
sitting on the passenger side of his Nissan Nismo. Life was good. Every man
wanted a bombshell by his side and Kendrick was no exception. Oakley shades
covered her aqua eyes and her pale blond hair fell in bacon-like crinkles past
her shoulders shielding her breast. When he looked over at her the first word
that came to mind was elegant. Gold bangles and a matching gold Michael Kors
watch was her wrist wear. A smooth tan French Connection dress with a dark
brown blazer over it defined the elegance.
He liked his car to smell manly
but each time Amanda rode with him she left it smelling like Just Cavalli or
her second favorite Gucci Premie’re. Amanda was 20 years old and her family
came from Texas though she was raised right here in South Florida.
Somewhere on Wiles Road a Mexican
had a dark rust colored pick-up truck pulled over with several watermelons on
its bed. A cardboard sign had eight dollars written on in it in huge sloppy
permanent marker. Kendrick pulled over.
“Hola Que Paso,” Kendrick hopped
out speaking in fluent Spanish. Sure he was as black as an ink pen but in South
Florida being bi-lingual was almost mandatory. The land was filled with Cubans,
Dominican Republicans, Haitians and Jamaicans. It seemed only twenty percent of
South Floridians were natural born Americans.
“Bueno Bueno. Mucho acuka,” the
older Hispanic man replied while handling him a cut off piece to sample. “La
Mujer,” through the window he offered a sample to Amanda that she respectfully
declined.
“Acuka ci, tres,” three was a lot
of watermelon for a guy who lived alone. Knowing how much his mom &amp
sister also favored the fruit he naturally bought them some also.
When he’d gotten out the car John
Legend was singing, when he re-entered the I-Pod was terminated and Power 96
was pumping some hard techno dance joint. Ken started bouncing in the driver
seat, snapping his fingers and shaking his arms. This is the guy everyone loved
to be with. He wasn’t perverted, he didn’t use a B or an F every other word and
he was very down to Earth. Everyone accepted Ken, the Blacks, the Whites, the
elders and even the kids.
At 21 years old he was already a
successful small business owner. Perhaps the entrepreneur genes were inherited
from his father Larry, an owner of a 6 figure surveillance company that
installed residential security systems.
At 12 years old Kenny was making
dot coms for mom and pop stores and self-employed boutique owners. Skipping two
grades he was already a freshman. By 16, he had a nice savings from his website
business, lucrative report card money and holiday gifts.
South Florida is made of 3
counties and it seems Dade always got the attention from tourist because of the
main attraction South Beach. That’s why Kenny started a tourist’s website for
Ft. Lauderdale, right from his bedroom. It was a matter of networking with
hotel owners, restaurants, club owners and convincing them why they should
advertise on his site. When you walked into a place and showed them a printout
of a counter saying your site had over 2 million hits to date and averaged
40,000 per month it wasn’t much more convincing you had to do.
That netted the funds for his
3,100 sq. ft. home out in Weston, 2 bed 2bath with a pool in the back that he
enjoyed doing laps in. Amanda also enjoyed the patio whenever she was over,
mostly sun-tanning.
“Every time we pull up at your
mom’s house it reminds me of the old sitcom Full House,” Amanda stated with her
soft, stress-relieving voice. “The architecture in San Fran is way different
than ours so I don’t mean in that way, but like- you feel safe here, homey,
it’s comfortable you know.”
“That’s why they pay the
expensive HOA fees sugar,” he replied as he exited his sports car showing a
pearly white smile.
The Home Owners Association, scam
to rake in the dough or was it actually worth it? These were the rules you had
to abide by in order to live in this gated community. Break your bones to keep
up with the mortgage on a six figure home and a guy gives you a set of rules to
live by, the consequences of breaking them being a lien on your house. It
sounds shabby but no one wants their property value to drop because the
Wilkinsons’ decided to paint their house lime green with hot pink roof
shingles. Or cause Billy three doors down likes to fix on his hot rod in the
driveway with his shirt off and light blue jeans full of grease and oil stains.
A bronze Mini Cooper S Paceman
was parked in the driveway next to a silver Infiniti truck, indicating Catrina
his 17 year old sister was home. She was a little on the heavy side.
The bi-racial couple stepped into
the house, Ken with a palm planted on the small of Amanda’s back.
“Smells like Belgian waffles in
here,” Ken stated.
“That’s your sister in their
burning down the house. Two in the afternoon and that girl is making waffles
and eggs,” Kierra replied.
“Brain food ma,” Ken sat on a bar
stool resting his arms on the granite countertop that resembled a black sky
with cream streaks of lighting. “Speaking of which, I got a few watermelons out-”
“Have,” the 46 year old mother of 3 interrupted him.
“Have what?”
“You have a few watermelons, not you got. You speak 3 languages boy
don’t corrupt your English.” She was a dermatologist with a wide nose that all
her children dominoed.
Truth be told she didn’t even
have to work and since she chose to, she had the means to have her own
establishment. She’d been working under Dr. Kelly for 12 years and earned a
decent salary with welcoming benefits so she saw no need to quit. Some wanted
it all, some were content. Kierra Walker fell into the latter.
Together she and Larry had a boy
they named Clayton. The following year they married and honeymooned in Mexico.
In 92’ they birthed Kendrick. Four years later an unexpected Catrina arrived
two months premature. And there you have Larry’s little branch of the Walker
dynasty.
Their eldest Clayton is a second
string fullback for the Tennessee Titans. He got married three years ago to the
lead singer of a major gospel group.
Kendrick has done excellent at entreprenuing
but still Kierra pushes him to continue his education. He works ten hour days
and takes online classes working toward a business degree.
Last there is Catrina. She’d just
graduated from Marjory Stoneman Douglas a 4.0 student. She won a scholarship
through National Geographic and she’ll be moving up to Daytona Beach in a few
months. For now she sleeps till noon, cooks breakfast at two and gets dressed
at four.
The television was turned on an
afternoon soap. Breaking news interrupted Kelly from finding out Robert cheated
with Stephanie. The news being, Paris Jackson, the late Michael’s fifteen year
old daughter attempted suicide by slicing her wrist with a kitchen knife and
popping twenty ibuprofens. When the cops arrived, she stated, “I wish my daddy
was here.”
Honey, we all wish your daddy was
here. No singer can ever match the influence he left imprinted on this world.
VH1 was running Mike videos to soundtrack Paris’ actions. Kendrick jumped up
from his bar stool and started moonwalking with his head titled down.
He was very athletic and an
excellent dancer. Every kid grew up horrified of the Thriller video and
imitating Mike’s smooth dance moves by grabbing on his crotch and biting down
on his lip asking whomever was around the infamous question, “Whose bad?”
Enters Catrina, plate of
breakfast in hand, pink scarf covering what was no doubt a mess. That girl
slept like she was fighting. She wore brown dog house shoes on her feet with
floppy ears flapping and marble eyes. Whiskers protruding, pink cloth tongue
dangling out of its mouth. BCBG pajama set, shorts and spaghetti top on, she
could stand to lose a few pounds but she wasn’t a sloppy chunk of rolls. She,
like her siblings had Kierra’s nose but Catrina also had wide oriental eyes set
in deep brown skin. Her lips were also chunky. A silver bar bell was pierced
into her tongue. Besides that her 2 lobes and an upper ear stud.
“Hey Bruddy Wuddy,” she said,
reducing Kendrick from a 21 year old successful businessman with an athlete’s
build to the same treatment as a cute little poodle.
“Wassup, no runaways today?” Ever
since the summer started she’d been volunteering at a Broward County Humane
Society.
“Nope, today is National Beauty
Rest Day for all the princesses worldwide,” she replied squeezing onto the
loveseat between Amanda and Ken.
“I wish you would’ve texted me
last night, I was up at six this morning,” Amanda injected herself into the
conversation.
“Better luck next year,” Catrina
was full of sarcasm.
Amanda and Ken had been going
steady the past 2 years and from day one she blended right into this family the
way strawberries and bananas do in a smoothie. These days lots of people were
dating outside their race, even adopting children of different ethnicities. The
new millennium raised the standard on social intertwining. Love knows no shade
it is the most unprejudiced feeling of all time. It can unite 2 men or it can
unite a couple with a 20 year age gap. There aren’t any guidelines, no rules
and love doesn’t discriminate.
A white Ford Econoline with the
words I-SPY printed across the side with a background of a mural of cameras and
surveillance screens pulled up and parallel parked in front of the house.
Everything about Larry screamed
Carl Winslow. His car of choosing was a Cadillac CTS sedan, but as of late you
were more prone to catch him driving one of his work vans. The economy was
slowly recuperating from what history books crooned The Great Recession, and in
a recession people are more apt to be worrying about car notes and mortgage
payments rather than luxuries like surveillance systems.
The tri-county was home to
several gazillionaires who couldn’t tell you what a recession was. For them
Larry was finding himself stuck in rush hour traffic more and more. Rush hour traffic
had an upside to it. It meant he was headed to a client’s home or coming from
depositing a check
column2: or on his way home from ripping and running all day, a

column1: hamster in the wheel of life.
There were five more vans painted
in the same insignia floating around the tri-county. His company employed
twelve technicians, three salesman and six people on the administrative side.
When he walked through the door
the look he gave Kierra and the look she gave him in return would let any
outsider know these people were truly in love. Twenty three years ago they
pledged their vows and twenty three years later they still meant every word.
He greeted her with a kiss and a
bouquet of six white roses were revealed from behind his back. Kendrick rose
from his place on the couch leaving his girl and sister to discuss Sally Hansen
and approached his old man with a firm handshake that evolved into both men
pulling each other in for a quick hug and pat on the back, the scene reminding
you of an old Budweiser commercial.
Kierra was off to find water and
vase for her roses.
“I may need you next week, will
you be available?” Father asked son. Their bond could be tested at extremely
high temperatures like gold and wouldn’t quaver.
“What’s going on dad?”
Larry Walker was not one to
dwindle away funds and he’d instilled the same principle into all his children.
Still he was no millionaire, but with the help of a trusted partner he had
taken out a hefty loan and invested into a 7 building, 42 unit apartment
complex a little ways north in Lake Worth. Some of the units required
remodeling and to cut back on labor the partners agreed to do some of the
fixing with their own hands.
“You aren’t too busy to lay some
tile with your old man are you?”
“Not at all dad, I can bring
Jeremy too.” He and Jeremy had been friends long before he even knew Amanda
existed.
“Jeremy’s a good kid and I’m
proud of you for your ability to pick strong minded individuals to keep in your
circle. But for this project he’d be a 3<sup>rd</sup> wheel if you feel my
drift.”
With the recession causing Larry
to be more in the field, Kendrick’s girlfriend and own business, there wasn’t
much time for them together like before. The days of putting together model
cars together were ancient history. It was to moments like this that instilled
Kendrick’s morals and values.
Late afternoons of throwing the
pig skin with his first born turned into Larry coaching Clayton’s little league
team, taking them for ice cream after a game win lose or draw. Now, Clayton was
in the NFL with several endorsements and publicity, thanking God first, then
his father every time a microphone was slammed into his face.
Coral Springs,
Florida wasn’t a major city but it wasn’t some small rural town either. One
could go through their whole time on earth never hearing of the city. But for
the Walkers it was their home, their foundation and the groundwork to their
stability.
The plate of waffles gone and
Catrina was now showing Amanda a pair of brown thick strap heels made by DMSX
Donald J. Pliner’s Spring Collection with the matching bag. Every girl loved
designers, rags, sales and malls. Catrina was without mate but she was no
exception. If anything she’d look good for herself.
“That’s so cute, what are you
wearing with it?” Amanda complimented her taste. Catrina had a closet with
10,000 outfits and 20,000 accessories and she was dumbfounded by this question.
“Two words- Town Center,” was her
reply.
Coral Springs was approximately
twenty minutes from Boca Raton where the Town Center Mall was located. It was
built just for women it seemed with stores like Nine West, Phillip Lam and
Coach. The mall was so upscale it offered valet parking, housed a massage spa
and a Ruth Chris Steakhouse.
It took over an hour for Catrina
to get showered and dressed. She came down the wooden stairs in a Stella
McCartney floral print dress and a pair of black flats and a slim black belt
all the red carpet stars were wearing. Small clutch in hand her hair was curled
and left a lingering scent of Orange Citrus &amp
Fructis shampoo. Women were such beautiful and unique creatures with their
mixtures of fragrances and garments. The smell of a certain perfume could take
a man back 12 years to his first girlfriend.
In the time it took Catrina to
finally emerge from her cave of toiletries Kendrick had fallen asleep on the
couch with his baldhead nestled onto Amanda’s lap. Larry was also asleep on the
other couch and the TV was on CNN talking about the NSA snooping into Facebook
accounts and monitoring citizen’s privacy labeling it counter-terrorism. The
next thing you know they’ll be telling us we have to store a copy key of our
home at the local police department.
Kierra was in the kitchen ‘MOM’
apron sprawled around her petite frame measuring ricotta cheese for tonight’s
lasagna and garlic bread supper. Raising three kids she was accustomed to
cooking.
“Mom, can we take your truck?
Daddy’s van is blocking me in the driveway,” Catrina stated as she stumbled
into the kitchen with her forehead perspiring from just one step into the
almighty Florida sun.
“Go get my keys out of my purse
honey and don’t eat while you’re out I’m making dinner.”
Life, one minute it could be as
normal as a 72 BPM heart rate, the next everything around you can start falling
like Job. That is why we must live it to the fullest, enjoy every moment and
cherish our loved ones like there’ll be no tomorrow.

The First Chapter of 'Only If I'
Today she was wearing a shade of cool blue eye
shadow against black mascara making her look icy, chilly even. Bubblegum lip
gloss accentuated her features and she appeared to be in benign repose while
sitting on the passenger side of his Nissan Nismo. Life was good. Every man
wanted a bombshell by his side and Kendrick was no exception. Oakley shades
covered her aqua eyes and her pale blond hair fell in bacon-like crinkles past
her shoulders shielding her breast. When he looked over at her the first word
that came to mind was elegant. Gold bangles and a matching gold Michael Kors
watch was her wrist wear. A smooth tan French Connection dress with a dark
brown blazer over it defined the elegance.
He liked his car to smell manly
but each time Amanda rode with him she left it smelling like Just Cavalli or
her second favorite Gucci Premie’re. Amanda was 20 years old and her family
came from Texas though she was raised right here in South Florida.
Somewhere on Wiles Road a Mexican
had a dark rust colored pick-up truck pulled over with several watermelons on
its bed. A cardboard sign had eight dollars written on in it in huge sloppy
permanent marker. Kendrick pulled over.
“Hola Que Paso,” Kendrick hopped
out speaking in fluent Spanish. Sure he was as black as an ink pen but in South
Florida being bi-lingual was almost mandatory. The land was filled with Cubans,
Dominican Republicans, Haitians and Jamaicans. It seemed only twenty percent of
South Floridians were natural born Americans.
“Bueno Bueno. Mucho acuka,” the
older Hispanic man replied while handling him a cut off piece to sample. “La
Mujer,” through the window he offered a sample to Amanda that she respectfully
declined.
“Acuka ci, tres,” three was a lot
of watermelon for a guy who lived alone. Knowing how much his mom & little
sister also favored the fruit he naturally bought them some also.
When he’d gotten out the car John
Legend was singing, when he re-entered the I-Pod was terminated and Power 96
was pumping some hard techno dance joint. Ken started bouncing in the driver
seat, snapping his fingers and shaking his arms. This is the guy everyone loved
to be with. He wasn’t perverted, he didn’t use a B or an F every other word and
he was very down to Earth. Everyone accepted Ken, the Blacks, the Whites, the
elders and even the kids.
At 21 years old he was already a
successful small business owner. Perhaps the entrepreneur genes were inherited
from his father Larry, an owner of a 6 figure surveillance company that
installed residential security systems.
At 12 years old Kenny was making
dot coms for mom and pop stores and self-employed boutique owners. Skipping two
grades he was already a freshman. By 16, he had a nice savings from his website
business, lucrative report card money and holiday gifts.
South Florida is made of 3
counties and it seems Dade always got the attention from tourist because of the
main attraction South Beach. That’s why Kenny started a tourist’s website for
Ft. Lauderdale, right from his bedroom. It was a matter of networking with
hotel owners, restaurants, club owners and convincing them why they should
advertise on his site. When you walked into a place and showed them a printout
of a counter saying your site had over 2 million hits to date and averaged
40,000 per month it wasn’t much more convincing you had to do.
That netted the funds for his
3,100 sq. ft. home out in Weston, 2 bed 2bath with a pool in the back that he
enjoyed doing laps in. Amanda also enjoyed the patio whenever she was over,
mostly sun-tanning.
“Every time we pull up at your
mom’s house it reminds me of the old sitcom Full House,” Amanda stated with her
soft, stress-relieving voice. “The architecture in San Fran is way different
than ours so I don’t mean in that way, but like- you feel safe here, homey,
it’s comfortable you know.”
“That’s why they pay the
expensive HOA fees sugar,” he replied as he exited his sports car showing a
pearly white smile.
The Home Owners Association, scam
to rake in the dough or was it actually worth it? These were the rules you had
to abide by in order to live in this gated community. Break your bones to keep
up with the mortgage on a six figure home and a guy gives you a set of rules to
live by, the consequences of breaking them being a lien on your house. It
sounds shabby but no one wants their property value to drop because the
Wilkinsons’ decided to paint their house lime green with hot pink roof
shingles. Or cause Billy three doors down likes to fix on his hot rod in the
driveway with his shirt off and light blue jeans full of grease and oil stains.
A bronze Mini Cooper S Paceman
was parked in the driveway next to a silver Infiniti truck, indicating Catrina
his 17 year old sister was home. She was a little on the heavy side.
The bi-racial couple stepped into
the house, Ken with a palm planted on the small of Amanda’s back.
“Smells like Belgian waffles in
here,” Ken stated.
“That’s your sister in their
burning down the house. Two in the afternoon and that girl is making waffles
and eggs,” Kierra replied.
“Brain food ma,” Ken sat on a bar
stool resting his arms on the granite countertop that resembled a black sky
with cream streaks of lighting. “Speaking of which, I got a few watermelons out-”
“Have,” the 46 year old mother of 3 interrupted him.
“Have what?”
“You have a few watermelons, not you got. You speak 3 languages boy
don’t corrupt your English.” She was a dermatologist with a wide nose that all
her children dominoed.
Truth be told she didn’t even
have to work and since she chose to, she had the means to have her own
establishment. She’d been working under Dr. Kelly for 12 years and earned a
decent salary with welcoming benefits so she saw no need to quit. Some wanted
it all, some were content. Kierra Walker fell into the latter.
Together she and Larry had a boy
they named Clayton. The following year they married and honeymooned in Mexico.
In 92’ they birthed Kendrick. Four years later an unexpected Catrina arrived
two months premature. And there you have Larry’s little branch of the Walker
dynasty.
Their eldest Clayton is a second
string fullback for the Tennessee Titans. He got married three years ago to the
lead singer of a major gospel group.
Kendrick has done excellent at entreprenuing
but still Kierra pushes him to continue his education. He works ten hour days
and takes online classes working toward a business degree.
Last there is Catrina. She’d just
graduated from Marjory Stoneman Douglas a 4.0 student. She won a scholarship
through National Geographic and she’ll be moving up to Daytona Beach in a few
months. For now she sleeps till noon, cooks breakfast at two and gets dressed
at four.
The television was turned on an
afternoon soap. Breaking news interrupted Kelly from finding out Robert cheated
with Stephanie. The news being, Paris Jackson, the late Michael’s fifteen year
old daughter attempted suicide by slicing her wrist with a kitchen knife and
popping twenty ibuprofens. When the cops arrived, she stated, “I wish my daddy
was here.”
Honey, we all wish your daddy was
here. No singer can ever match the influence he left imprinted on this world.
VH1 was running Mike videos to soundtrack Paris’ actions. Kendrick jumped up
from his bar stool and started moonwalking with his head titled down.
He was very athletic and an
excellent dancer. Every kid grew up horrified of the Thriller video and
imitating Mike’s smooth dance moves by grabbing on his crotch and biting down
on his lip asking whomever was around the infamous question, “Whose bad?”
Enters Catrina, plate of
breakfast in hand, pink scarf covering what was no doubt a mess. That girl
slept like she was fighting. She wore brown dog house shoes on her feet with
floppy ears flapping and marble eyes. Whiskers protruding, pink cloth tongue
dangling out of its mouth. BCBG pajama set, shorts and spaghetti top on, she
could stand to lose a few pounds but she wasn’t a sloppy chunk of rolls. She,
like her siblings had Kierra’s nose but Catrina also had wide oriental eyes set
in deep brown skin. Her lips were also chunky. A silver bar bell was pierced
into her tongue. Besides that her 2 lobes and an upper ear stud.
“Hey Bruddy Wuddy,” she said,
reducing Kendrick from a 21 year old successful businessman with an athlete’s
build to the same treatment as a cute little poodle.
“Wassup, no runaways today?” Ever
since the summer started she’d been volunteering at a Broward County Humane
Society.
“Nope, today is National Beauty
Rest Day for all the princesses worldwide,” she replied squeezing onto the
loveseat between Amanda and Ken.
“I wish you would’ve texted me
last night, I was up at six this morning,” Amanda injected herself into the
conversation.
“Better luck next year,” Catrina
was full of sarcasm.
Amanda and Ken had been going
steady the past 2 years and from day one she blended right into this family the
way strawberries and bananas do in a smoothie. These days lots of people were
dating outside their race, even adopting children of different ethnicities. The
new millennium raised the standard on social intertwining. Love knows no shade
it is the most unprejudiced feeling of all time. It can unite 2 men or it can
unite a couple with a 20 year age gap. There aren’t any guidelines, no rules
and love doesn’t discriminate.
A white Ford Econoline with the
words I-SPY printed across the side with a background of a mural of cameras and
surveillance screens pulled up and parallel parked in front of the house.
Everything about Larry screamed
Carl Winslow. His car of choosing was a Cadillac CTS sedan, but as of late you

slowly recuperating from what history books crooned The Great Recession, and in

had an upside to it. It meant he was headed to a client’s home or coming from
depositing a check

About the Campaign...
<h3>Help bring the Witch &amp
column2:
Wolf Novels back into Print!

Not a week goes by without a reader asking when I'll be bringing my Witch &
column3: Wolf novels back into print. Admitting the real reason they aren't in print right now is a blow to my pride in many ways. At the end of the day, the answer is simple: money.

column1: I have time, I'm willing to put in the effort, but the simple truth is this: I am so not qualified to create the cover art required to make a good print book. The cost of creating print covers is a stumbling block.
I'd like to knock that wall down and get these books back into print.
My name is RJ Blain, and I'm the author of the Witch &
column2: Wolf series, proud member of the SFWA (the member directory is currently offline, but you can check out this article I wrote for the SFWA when they opened their doors to self-published authors), and a lover of books and the arts. I'm living the dream, but like most other humans, I want something more.

column1: My cover artist and print designer is Holly Heisey. Check out her work. She's an illustrator, designer, and all around awesome woman. She has done several covers for me already, all for digital edition. This one, for Pack Justice (Coming in 2016!), is one of my favorites.

I'm a pretty straight-forward type of gal. I like paying my own way, I like pushing my limits, and I love writing novels. I've been publishing since 2012, and over the years, I've learned a lot. I've made a lot of mistakes. I've even learned from them, which I count as one of the greatest accomplishments of my life.

Let's Talk Money

Let's get to the chase. I need a certain amount of money to make it happen. Here's a rough breakdown of my costs:

  • $550 for an omnibus edition of Books 1-3 (Inquisitor, Winter Wolf, and Blood Diamond in one book.)
• $550 for book 4. (Silver Bullet.)
• $150 for Beneath a Blood Moon (Standalone.)
• $150 for Pack Justice (Standalone.)
• $150 for Shadowed Flame (Standalone.)
• $300 for Copyright fees
• $50 Misc. Expenses
Each contributor receiving physical goods will pay a minimum of $5 in shipping. Perks including physical novels will have higher shipping costs. Shipping will be factored into the perk cost.

In total, I'm looking for $1900 USD. You'll notice there's nothing in here about formatting, editing, and so on. Why not? I pay for that myself out of my royalties and business earnings. I just don't have the wiggle room in my budget for the print editions. It's a huge expense.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

Publishing is a pretty risky business, and $1,900 is a lot of money. Here's the deal: One way or another, I will be getting these books back into print. (I will not go quietly into the night!)

column1: You will be helping me make it happen a lot faster--and without me having to eat Kraft Dinner for the next six months of my life.

By focusing on creating line art for coloring pages, I have fun, you get something awesome to print out and color, and we're all happy. I draw, you color, I color, we all color, and let's face it: coloring is fun, and I still have no idea why we, as a society, waited so long to figure out adults can enjoy coloring books, too.
I risk some time and effort creating the coloring pages. I risk my plans being delayed.

I am releasing a very limited number of signed books, as this perk will take the longest to fulfill. This is best for you, and it is best for me, too. Considering the digital versions of the books are already released or are in late stages of production, the risk is about as low as I can get it without being a 100% guarantee.

You Can Help.

Some of you aren't interested in coloring books. Some of you already have all of my titles. Some of you aren't interested in print editions.
Maybe you don't have a lot of money. It happens to all of us. There are ways you can help.
<ul>
• Share this campaign. Let people know it's around. Talk to your friends. Telling people about my books really helps.
• Leave a Review. Read my books? Loved them? Already have one of the rare print copies from the original print run? Tell other readers what you loved about my books. It really does help.
• Contribute. Even if it's a $1, it helps.
Thanks so much, lovers of books.
