I'm expecting no more than a week after the conclusion of the campaign for the coloring pages to be ready.
3: What format will the coloring pages be in?
Undecided, but either JPG/GIF and/or PDF.
4: When will the print books be ready?
Later in 2016 and into 2017, depending on the title. I've already booked Holly Heisey for much of the work, but it depends on funding.
5: When will the ebooks be ready?

They'll be ready when they're ready, but I'm expecting all of the W&W novels (the unreleased ones) to be ready by the end of 2016. The already published ebooks will be delivered within a week of campaign completion.
6: When will the original line art ship?
Within a week of campaign end, approximately.
7: When will the signed copies ship?
When they're ready. It is dependent on Createspace and finalization of the unpublished novels. Signed copies ship as a set.
8: When do unsigned copies ship?
They will be shipped via createspace to their new homes on their release day.
About the Campaign...

Help bring the Witch & Wolf Novels back into Print! Not a week goes by without a reader asking when I'll be bringing my Witch & Wolf novels back into print. Admitting the real reason they aren't in print right now is a blow to my pride in many ways. At the end of the day, the answer is simple: money.

I have time, I'm willing to put in the effort, but the simple truth is this: I am so not qualified to create the cover art required to make a good print book. The cost of creating print covers is a stumbling block.
I'd like to knock that wall down and get these books back into print.

My name is RJ Blain, and I'm the author of the Witch & Wolf series, proud member of the SFWA (the member directory is currently offline, but you can check out this article I wrote for the SFWA when they opened their doors to self-published authors), and a lover of books and the arts. I'm living the dream, but like most other humans, I want something more.

My cover artist and print designer is Holly Heisey. Check out her work. She's an illustrator, designer, and all around awesome woman. She has done several covers for me already, all for digital edition. This one, for Pack Justice (Coming in 2016!), is one of my favorites.

I'm a pretty straight-forward type of gal. I like paying my own way, I like pushing my limits, and I love writing novels. I've been publishing since 2012, and over the years, I've learned a lot. I've made a lot of mistakes. I've even learned from them, which I count as one of the greatest accomplishments of my life.
Let's Talk About the Perks
We all love stuff. I sure do. Here's a breakdown of the perks you can choose from.

Digital coloring pages, drawn & inked by RJ Blain: Regardless of funding, there will be a minimum of 50 line art images (for you to color!) of various sizes. Check out one of the pages below. All images will be cleaned to B&W for easy printing. Originals are inked in black and sepia. Image subject matter includes:
Flowers
Dragons
Unicorns
Anything RJ wants to Draw.

Originals of the Coloring Pages: Contributors of this perk will receive one of the coloring pages, selected at random. (There will also be a perk level allowing contributors to select a theme for a coloring page.) Sizes vary. Images are drawn on 140 pound watercolor paper. (Yes, the paper stock is high enough quality you could choose to paint when you color (watercolor, acrylics, and other mediums).)
Print Copies: Signed and unsigned books will be available.

Digital Copies of the Witch & Wolf Novels: e-book versions of all books, in epub, mobi, and pdf formats. (This the only way to get epub versions of the books, as I am exclusive to Amazon at the moment.)
Stretch Goals: Should this campaign exceed funding, contributors (depending on perk level) will receive the following:
Additional Coloring Pages
Additional Titles (Tales of the Winter Wolf, Requiem for the Rift King, Titles from RJ Blain's pseudonym, which include urban fantasy/dystopian/sci-fi books.)

Let's Talk Money Let's get to the chase. I need a certain amount of money to make it happen. Here's a rough breakdown of my costs:  $550 for an omnibus edition of Books 1-3 (Inquisitor, Winter Wolf, and Blood Diamond in one book.)
$550 for book 4. (Silver Bullet.)
$150 for Beneath a Blood Moon (Standalone.)
$150 for Pack Justice (Standalone.)
$150 for Shadowed Flame (Standalone.)
$300 for Copyright fees
$50 Misc. Expenses
Each contributor receiving physical goods will pay a minimum of $5 in shipping. Perks including physical novels will have higher shipping costs. Shipping will be factored into the perk cost.

In total, I'm looking for $1900 USD. You'll notice there's nothing in here about formatting, editing, and so on. Why not? I pay for that myself out of my royalties and business earnings. I just don't have the wiggle room in my budget for the print editions. It's a huge expense.

Risks & Challenges Publishing is a pretty risky business, and $1,900 is a lot of money. Here's the deal: One way or another, I will be getting these books back into print. (I will not go quietly into the night!)
You will be helping me make it happen a lot faster--and without me having to eat Kraft Dinner for the next six months of my life.

By focusing on creating line art for coloring pages, I have fun, you get something awesome to print out and color, and we're all happy. I draw, you color, I color, we all color, and let's face it: coloring is fun, and I still have no idea why we, as a society, waited so long to figure out adults can enjoy coloring books, too.
I risk some time and effort creating the coloring pages. I risk my plans being delayed.

I am releasing a very limited number of signed books, as this perk will take the longest to fulfill. This is best for you, and it is best for me, too. Considering the digital versions of the books are already released or are in late stages of production, the risk is about as low as I can get it without being a 100% guarantee.
You Can Help. Some of you aren't interested in coloring books. Some of you already have all of my titles. Some of you aren't interested in print editions.
Maybe you don't have a lot of money. It happens to all of us. There are ways you can help.
Share this campaign. Let people know it's around. Talk to your friends. Telling people about my books really helps.
Leave a Review. Read my books? Loved them? Already have one of the rare print copies from the original print run? Tell other readers what you loved about my books. It really does help.
Contribute. Even if it's a $1, it helps.
Thanks so much, lovers of books.",4.0,0,"5 Campaigns

We have saved ALL proceeds from our first book to put towards this one but we still need your help. Estimated costs are: Printing  $4500, stickers $600, ISBN# $200. If we can meet our campaign goal of $3000 it will put us very close to the number we need to break even. Please help us spread silliness into the world.

The book will be 8x10 with approximately 48 pages. We have doubled the size and hope to go to print by mid June. Printing takes about two months. We have poured so much work and love into it and we can't wait to share.

Scarily There is the story of a  ghostly little girl who haunts the attic of a house and a big hairy monster who lurks in the closet of a child's' room. They both have the same goal, to scare the kid who lives there but that's hard to do when they are scared of each other.  The story is largely inspired by Kevin's interest of all things paranormal and Emily's love of drawing cute yet slightly creepy monsters.

 It is sure to be a classic loved by the whole family!  If for some reason it is not then it will make one adequate coaster, you  really can't lose!

The Story of Miriam's Well

In this modern day retelling of the Exodus, Miriam wanders the political and spiritual desert of a changing America, torn between her roots as the Jewish daughter of a Black father and white mother, her yearning for home, and her brothers, Aaron, a successful New York City attorney, and Moses, an autistic artist living in Kansas. An astonishing cook and singer, Miriam has a knack for showing up to feed and help people at landmark events, including People's Park during the Summer of Love, the Wounded Knee encampment in South Dakota, the AIDS epidemic in San Francisco, the Oklahoma City terrorist attack, 9/11, and Hurricane Katrina. As she seeks the promised land, she shows her people, and eventually herself, how to turn the chaos and despair of our times into music, meals, and miracles.

The novel also includes over 35 pages of real recipes from the fictional cooking and baking Miriam does throughout the book, including delicious delights by Nancy O'Connor's The Rolling Prairie Cookbook, Jayni and Frank Carey's The New Kansas Cookbook, Janet Majure's Recipes Worth Sharing, and Meghan Heriford of the Ladybird Diner in Lawrence, Kansas.
Why a Book Tour Campaign

Like most writers, I've been pretty much funding my own book tours for many years, which has limited my travel and reach. I'm thrilled to be working with Ice Cube Press, publishing the finest of Midwestern writers for many years, which is giving the book all it needs in terms of great design, wide distribution, and a fabulously hard-working publisher, Steve Semken. Like most presses, this one doesn't have resources for a book tour. So I'm turning to you to help me visit many communities (events in the works or plans for Kansas, Missouri, Vermont, Wisconsin, Arizona, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Florida, Texas, Iowa, Oklahoma, Oregon, Washington, Colorado, and more). In return, you can get your own copy of Miriam's Well or many other vivid perks.
<h3>What Miriam's Well Needs &amp

The campaign goal of $4,900 will give this novel legs to reach more readers in more communities by covering reasonable costs of travel (watch out, I could be sleeping on your couch soon!). Here's what the funds will go for:
<ul>
• Travel expenses for in-person readings at libraries, community hubs, bookstores, synagogues, and colleges, plus writing workshops related to the novel throughout the country.
• Connecting with book clubs and other reading communities across the country to offer video-conference visits at their convenience.
• Sharing the book more widely through social media and printed materials.
• Filming short videos and recording podcasts of sample readings, questions and answers about the book, and the mythical and contemporary dimensions of this story.
My part is putting in lots of time and love, and also paying my way for a share of the travel expenses.

What you get, beyond of the satisfaction of helping a workaday writer fulfill one of her dreams, are signed copies of Miriam's Well for you and friends or family, baskets of books, in-person workshops and readings, and poems or even a song written just for you or a beloved.
Early Reviews

""Caryn Mirriam-Goldberg's retelling of Exodus is a sprawling tapestry, woven of all the threads of a modern-day Miriam's ancestors, and her own present and future. From the Badagry Point of No Return and a sukkah in the Sinai Desert to a series of camps, communes, and cafes all across America, Miriam's Well delves into the mystery of how we find our place in the world, within our families, even within ourselves."" ~ Bryn Greenwood, New York Times bestselling author of All the Ugly and Wonderful Things

""I fell in love with Miriam’s wisdom and her sweet engagements with the people she meets along her lush and vibrant travels. I was plunged to the depths of her nightmares, soared with her song, and emerged blessed to have made the journey with her. ~ Jocelyn Cullity, author of Amah &

""Miriam’s Well is truly a hearty feast and a song of life’s bounty, of its “fragile miracle,” of its sorrows and its cycling, its joy, its mystery, its sorrows, its journeying. The vibrantly moving and compelling storytelling is immediate, intimate, and resounding
column2: bringing us into a complex weaving of tales, told and untold, from the Biblical epic to the painful legacy of United States, which frame the story of one brave woman with an inexhaustible well of caring."" ~ Gale Jackson, author of Put Your Hands on Your Hips and Act Like a Woman: Song, Dance, Black History and Poetics in Performance

column1: ""Miriam’s Well is a page-turner that gently pulls the reader into the heroine’s quest. A compelling writer, Mirriam-Goldberg’s Miriam’s Well captures a quintessential American story, its multitude of nations, of immigrants and indigenes, in the quest towards a meaningful national identity."" ~ Omofolabo Ajayi-Soyinka, Professor of Theatre, and Women, Gender and Sexuality Studies, University of Kansas

See more as they come in here.

 

Risks &

Travel and sharing a book even from home takes time and thoughtful planning. I also have the 20/20 hindsight vision of doing book tours from writing or editing over 20 other books. I have spent the last year researching how to best reach people who would appreciate and find meaning in this novel. To this end, I'm aiming the tour as much as possible toward events where I can meet readers directly as well as readings in independent book stores, which I'm committed to support however I can. I've also developed plans for reaching people from afar because, like many of you, there's only so much travel I can do without ending up sick and exhausted on my recliner. This plan includes video-conferencing into book groups, and widely sharing podcasts and videos. Most of all, this book tour is a way to help bring greater meaning to all our lives through exploring who we are and what our callings are through the lens of the novel.
Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone has some extra cash to contribute, and also, there are pressing issues we all need and want to support. If you're not able to chip in, please share this campaign via Facebook, Twitter, and the Indiegogo tools (buttons not to the pink ""back it"" button in the upper right-hand corner). Good wishes also happily accepted.

Stretch Goals *New!

Goal $300 GEAR UP GOAL MET! 
All backers up to the $300 mark will be entered in a drawing to receive EITHER a ""Watcher Key"" T-shirt OR a leather bound journal as featured in the book!

Goal $500 Coffee with Watchers  
All backers (including those before) up to the $500 mark will be entered in a drawing to receive a handmade ceramic Watcher Key coffee mug courtesy of Megan Smallwood of Smallwood Arts!

Goal $1500 What a Review!
All backers (including those before) up to the $1500 will have the opportunity to obtain an ebook of The Watcher Tower first! All backers will be entered as well for the chance to have one of three softcover copies of The Watcher Tower to be released in 2018! AND, one lucky backer will have the chance to have their review of The Watcher Key in print on the back cover!

Goal $3000 Star the Watcher!
All backers will be entered to win a 4K sports action camera package, one of three softcover copies of The Watcher Tower to be released in 2018, AND have the chance to win a role in our next book trailer release! As an added bonus, all backers will be sent the ebook of the second book before print!
A Young Adult Spiritual Fiction Thriller
Read the first chapter at www.watcherkey.com!

In a world so polarized by good and evil emerges a new perspective on the fight for the soul of mankind from a spiritual perspective. In the book, readers are immersed in a fictional setting to walk alongside a young man who discovers that he is, in fact, a part of this hidden world where celestial beings war for control of both the land of Watchers and of Creation.
Through this rich fiction-fantasy novel, we hope to convey a message to young readers that they are indeed responsible for the outcomes of their choices.
Our Hope

We hope, above all, that our first book The Watcher Key will captivate readers with an exciting, thought provoking, and spiritually challenging message. Young adults resonate with exciting stories, and The Watcher Key is no exception.
The Series
<ul><li>

The Watcher Key is the first of the series, about a boy who discovers Lior, a land created for the ancient celestial beings the Watchers and their descendants. Upon his arrival, Sam begins to realize the vital part he will play in the ultimate fate of mankind, and his fellow members who follow the light. The Darkness, however, is cunning and powerful, seducing both man and Descendant to evil, and many have fallen into its powerful grip. Charged with the ultimate task of saving Lior from destruction, Sam and his friends must find the Key that will lift the curse that has been placed over the land by one of the Fallen Watchers, Kachash, the lord of deception. Sam will discover many fantastical things on his adventure, some that will leave an everlasting impression on his life.

I don't think I'd be much good at writing a novel. 

On the other hand, I seem to be damn good in real life at finding weirdness and trouble, particularly when to my mind all involved were just wandering around looking for a safe haven…or a good party. 

Couple this strange talent, if talent it be, with a propensity for feature writing and you have Tales From The Day (TM).  Tales From the Day, the book, is well underway, with the pitch for TV/Movie rights looming.   Parts of it have already been published and have enjoyed some traction (more about that shortly).  You'll be able to read completed chapters of it before you decide if you want to help fund this thing.
column3:
>WHAT THE HELL AM I TRYING TO DO, ANYWAY?

At the outset, let me make clear that as far as I'm concerned books which lovingly recall the ""old days,"" and God help me, I was there, of gas being 25 cents a gallon or using clip on rollers to sidewalk skate are a boring and increasing irrelevant waste of time.  Such epistles are important only to those who write them--plus, of course, the Vanity Press industry which exists, to quote Bob Ringer, solely to fatten the ego and slim the wallet.

On the other hand, “The Day We Went Shark Fishing In Our Underwear” is a true story one can get behind no matter when it happened, and it is instructive for anyone into the avoidance of being stupid or not acquiring unwanted teeth marks.  And there are a couple of other reasons these kinds of true life episodes have traction:  it is my belief that while our surroundings and technology will continue to be vortices of massive upheaval, the core part of our humanity--human craziness, wandering around, falling into crap, courage and cowardice, ethics and immorality, ferocious protection of family and most of all wry laughter remain universal, valued and timeless, regardless of era and circumstance.
column4:
>

Tales From The Day (the book) is structured as a series of stand-alone vignettes from my grandparents day onward, all of which can ""flow"" into a full script or can provide individual ""script seeds"" for TV/movie production or creative expansion.

You can see a short synopsis of my background here in the profile section.  Let’s just say that the story of my career is one of running away from a small, mid-western farm town to the California circus, and what happened thereafter:  TV, live productions, a lot of writing and head shaking over the craziness of it all).  Tales from The Day is designed to stand on its own as a book, and will be published as such initially, regardless of any production work drawn from it.
column5:
>BUT BEFORE YOU GO ON

I’m writing this to invite you to take a ride on the Crazy Train.  And I’m hoping you’ll spring for a ticket.  But now’s the time to see if what I’m doing and the approach I’m using is one you like and would feel comfortable in getting behind.

First Go here:  www.talesfromtheday.com (Copyright 2016, Wayne McFarland &
column6:
Gloria McFarland, All Rights Reserved)  It is a blog which contains only completed work which will appear in the book.  There you will find and can read:

 

THE DAY WE BLEW TOWN WITH THE MONKEY  Under option as of March 2017 for publication. Rights retained.

""I hated the monkey and the monkey hated me. I cannot tell you why I hated the monkey. It might have been because...""

 

THE DAY THEY TRIED TO KILL US IN ARKANSAS AND IT REALLY IMPROVED MY SOCIAL LIFE  Rights retained

""It was 1966.  We were young.  We were immortal. And for that we almost got ourselves murdered one night in Arkansas.  We were four fraternity brothers at a small Minnesota College.  We decided that...

...the instant our car moved, the back window blew inward.    I heard Mike who was sitting beside me cry “Owwww!” and something slammed into my face.  Yep, I had just been shot, although I didn’t figure that out until later...""

THE DAY WE SPARKED A RIOT IN FARGO, NORTH DAKOTA  Under option, as of March 2017 for publication.  Rights retained.

""When I was introduced to the manager of Paul Revere and the Raiders, he didn't even shake my hand.  He just stared fixedly through the curtains at the boiling crowd.  ""Jesus Christ,"" he kept saying, ""Jesus Christ!  Where the hell are we?  Fargo? Fargo!  Jesus Christ!""...""

 

THE DAY WE ROPED THE BEAR  Published in OZY, January 2017 under the title:  The Day A Bear Gave Me A Golden Shower, which says something about either my piece or their audience. Rights retained.

""If we hadn’t been so bored, I swear to you we would not have roped the bear. I was 19 and grass green. After shanghaiing a buddy, I had team hitched a couple of thousand miles to nail a summer job with the forest service..."" 

 

THE DAY I WAS SAVED BY MICKEY MOUSE  Rights retained.

""She was undoubtedly stoned to the gills.  It was 1970.  She was riding around on the circular luggage delivery system in the baggage Area of the San Francisco airport.   She would hand a flower to every passenger she passed, all of whom were looking at her in complete bafflement.   Grinning hugely as she circulated around with the growing mound of luggage, she kept handing out flowers...""

 

 THE DAY THE GAME WARDEN DIED  Published in OZY, January 2017 under the title Of Shotguns, Syphilis, And Sworn Enemies.  Rights retained.

""My Granddad shot Blackie under the big old tree in the center of the barnyard.   My cousin Janet was lounging on a low branch, Alice in Wonderland style, with me down below.   I don’t remember what kid stuff my cousin and I were discussing, but...""

 

THE MAKING OF A PSYCHOPATH  Rights Retained.

""...Sighting that storm was a moment so looming with dread and the prospect of unthinkable catastrophe, that my Grandmother trembled years later to tell me of it.   There was no one else to help...""

 

THE DAY WE WENT SHARK FISHING IN OUR UNDERWEAR  The most popular piece published thus far.  It appeared in OZY in December 2016.  Rights retained.

""The three of us were standing in waist deep surf. In our underwear.  In the dead of night. Shark fishing...    

...He started skidding out to sea.  We grabbed him, and the line, and soon the three of us...""
column8:
>COMING SOON

In the hopper, as yet unfinished, are the following, plus there will be more (I just haven’t blocked them all out yet). These Titles are copyrighted:

• The Day We Lost 10 Grand At The Hollywood sign.
• The Day Kenny’s Cousin Tried To Kill Everyone In The Bunkhouse
• The Day I Jumped The Wrong Way On A Million Dollar Trampoline
• The Day The Auction Turned Violent
• The Day We Got Ripped Off in 6 Languages
• The Day A 100 Year Old, Huge Victorian House Rolled Across The Beans
• The Day We Got The Hell Beat Out Of Us In The Cornfields
• The Day Our Business Ran Aground On A Worm.
• The Day The Norwegian And I Ran With The Bulls
• The Day We Started A Santa Claus business
• The Day Johnny Cash Hit On My Wife

column3:
>IF YOU ARE STILL INTRIGUED

With your help, there are two things I will accomplish with the funds raised here:  first is to really speed up the completion of Tales From The Day (the book) and get it out there.  The second is to shop the book and its contents with the TV and Movie suits on both coasts...and for that kind of thing, there's just no substitute for being there (yes, I do know how to use Skype).

As you can see from the section below entitled “And Speaking Of Buzz,” some of the completed chapters written for Tales from The Day have been published.  We’ve gotten enthusiastic response and serious traction from this, with more publication of completed chapters optioned. As a dinged-up veteran of L.A. and New York sales and pitches, I can tell you that having some chapters of a book published ahead of time and then, because of the response, having other chapters optioned for publication, gives us a real leg up when it comes to selling publication and production rights for the completed project.
column4:
>AND SPEAKING OF BUZZ

You’ve seen the name OZY pop up here a few times.  OZY is an online news/feature site that focuses on news and original content and has pretty much taken the industry by storm.  They currently boast a monthly readership of some 25,000,000 folks (yep, really—25 million).  Their contributors include among others Bill Gates, Condoleezza Rice, Bill Clinton...and me.  No, I don’t hob nob with these folks, but I do read their stuff…don’t know if they read mine. 

OZY has published a number of the completed chapters written for Tales From The Day and optioned more (and yes, they pay for them). 

          

 One of those published, The Day We Went Shark Fishing In Our Underwear, is as I write this at some 33,000 “shares” and climbing (“shares” are when readers pass along articles to colleagues and friends).  The piece has been, it seems, picking up about a thousand more shares every couple of days. 

        

A Senior Editor at OZY just informed me that this is a pretty big deal, as most articles are felt to have traction if they pick up a very few hundred shares, as in two or three hundred.
column5:
>Updated 4/30/2017

         

Another of the pieces they published, The Day The Game Warden Died (after changing the name to Of Shotguns, Syphilis, and Sworn Enemies), is now edging up on a thousand shares. 

This is a “hurray” of course, but is germane here because it clearly indicates that the subject matter, approach and writing style of Tales From The Day is current and resonates with a wide and eclectic audience. All of this will give the project a leg up as together with you, we run for the prize: publication in book form and subsequent TV/movie production.
column6:
>WHY SHOULD YOU CARE?

Because together we can bring folks, events and social times that are gone back to life. And we can do so within the context of how people really behave, with all the craziness and courage which is usually involved.  Because together we can change the “write about how it was” genre to one of writing about how people act in human ways regardless of the times. Because you can be a part of creating something new, based on the old, into print and beyond. And because sometimes you should care…just because you should care.
column8:
>SCHEDULE AND USE OF FUNDS

As you know from this posting, we are hoping to raise at least 85K.  The majority of these funds will be used for marketing of the finished work, both for a major publishing deal and the offering out of production rights.  Assuming we are successful with fund raising, Tales From The Day (the book) should be all wrapped up in about six months or so, after which the full court marketing press will begin for at least another six months.  During the initial six months, as the book is being completed, I will continue to offer out completed vignettes for publication, plus amp up social media to keep the buzz going. Publication credits and buzz REALLY help when it comes to locking up book or production deals.  If we exceed the funding goal, it will just speed everything up. Don’t know about you, but I’m pretty much over delayed gratification.
column9:
>WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

This may well be the best part for me actually, and hopefully for you as well. 

As you can see from the perks, part of them involve your getting access to a special blog which will detail what we do to publish the book and sell related production rights.  If my time in LA../Hollywood taught me anything, it was that a lot of really good stuff never sees the light of day. This was almost always due to the creators being either really bad at deal making or not knowing what to do or how to go about selling/producing their creative work, which is pretty much all I did for a number of years.

As a perk for getting involved with this project, you’ll see this process unroll from start to finish, in detail.  One perk involves us actually having a face to face (lunch or skype) to discuss what you’ve got going and how to get it out there…or anything else you might want to kick around.

I’m not allowed to offer you a slice of earnings.  A signed copy of the first run of the book for contributors of course, plus t shirts…but that’s just a big whoop unless the book gets legs or is visually produced in some way.  Truly, I think the real “perk” value here for you is getting a detailed  insight into this whole process.   Some contributors will get a first look at all new vignettes as they are completed, plus a ringside seat as tales from the day gets marketed, published and beyond. I very much hope that getting detailed insight into this process will help some of you who want to do the same thing with your own work.

But mostly what’s in it for all of us is a hell of a ride and a big ration of fun.  And at the end isn’t that the dreamed-of essence for our endeavors?

Contact me any time:

Wayne D. McFarland

talesfromtheday@gmail.com

Twitter:  @talesfromtheday

www.talesfromtheday.com

As a dinged-up veteran of L.A. and New York sales and pitches, I can tell you that having some chapters of a book published ahead of time and then, because of the response, having other chapters optioned for publication, gives us a real leg up when it comes to selling publication and production rights for the completed project. AND SPEAKING OF BUZZYou’ve seen the name OZY pop up here a few times.  OZY is an online news/feature site that focuses on news and original content and has pretty much taken the industry by storm.  They currently boast a monthly readership of some 25,000,000 folks (yep, really—25 million).  Their contributors include among others Bill Gates, Condoleezza Rice, Bill Clinton...and me.  No, I don’t hob nob with these folks, but I do read their stuff…don’t know if they read mine. OZY has published a number of the completed chapters written for Tales From The Day and optioned more (and yes, they pay for them).            One of those published, The Day We Went Shark Fishing In Our Underwear, is as I write this at some 33,000 “shares” and climbing (“shares” are when readers pass along articles to colleagues and friends).  The piece has been, it seems, picking up about a thousand more shares every couple of days.         A Senior Editor at OZY just informed me that this is a pretty big deal, as most articles are felt to have traction if they pick up a very few hundred shares, as in two or three hundred. Updated 4/30/2017         Another of the pieces they published, The Day The Game Warden Died (after changing the name to Of Shotguns, Syphilis, and Sworn Enemies), is now edging up on a thousand shares. This is a “hurray” of course, but is germane here because it clearly indicates that the subject matter, approach and writing style of Tales From The Day is current and resonates with a wide and eclectic audience. All of this will give the project a leg up as together with you, we run for the prize: publication in book form and subsequent TV/movie production.   WHY SHOULD YOU CARE?Because together we can bring folks, events and social times that are gone back to life. And we can do so within the context of how people really behave, with all the craziness and courage which is usually involved.  Because together we can change the “write about how it was” genre to one of writing about how people act in human ways regardless of the times. Because you can be a part of creating something new, based on the old, into print and beyond. And because sometimes you should care…just because you should care.SCHEDULE AND USE OF FUNDSAs you know from this posting, we are hoping to raise at least 85K.  The majority of these funds will be used for marketing of the finished work, both for a major publishing deal and the offering out of production rights.  Assuming we are successful with fund raising, Tales From The Day (the book) should be all wrapped up in about six months or so, after which the full court marketing press will begin for at least another six months.  During the initial six months, as the book is being completed, I will continue to offer out completed vignettes for publication, plus amp up social media to keep the buzz going. Publication credits and buzz REALLY help when it comes to locking up book or production deals.  If we exceed the funding goal, it will just speed everything up. Don’t know about you, but I’m pretty much over delayed gratification.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?This may well be the best part for me actually, and hopefully for you as well. As you can see from the perks, part of them involve your getting access to a special blog which will detail what we do to publish the book and sell related production rights.  If my time in LA../Hollywood taught me anything, it was that a lot of really good stuff never sees the light of day. This was almost always due to the creators being either really bad at deal making or not knowing what to do or how to go about selling/producing their creative work, which is pretty much all I did for a number of years.As a perk for getting involved with this project, you’ll see this process unroll from start to finish, in detail.  One perk involves us actually having a face to face (lunch or skype) to discuss what you’ve got going and how to get it out there…or anything else you might want to kick around.I’m not allowed to offer you a slice of earnings.  A signed copy of the first run of the book for contributors of course, plus t shirts…but that’s just a big whoop unless the book gets legs or is visually produced in some way.  Truly, I think the real “perk” value here for you is getting a detailed  insight into this whole process.   Some contributors will get a first look at all new vignettes as they are completed, plus a ringside seat as tales from the day gets marketed, published and beyond. I very much hope that getting detailed insight into this process will help some of you who want to do the same thing with your own work.But mostly what’s in it for all of us is a hell of a ride and a big ration of fun.  And at the end isn’t that the dreamed-of essence for our endeavors?Contact me any time:Wayne D. Why a Cookbook for Your Pup?
Dogs are no longer just our trusted companion
column2: they have also become a furry member of our family.  Welcoming a new puppy can be almost as exciting as welcoming in a baby.  Why wouldn't we give our furry loved one nothing but the best.  If you can't pronounce it, would you want to eat it?  The same should go for your puppy.  This book will teach you easy recipes, with not only limited ingredients, but things you can buy right at the local market.....and pronounce!  Within no time you'll be making gourmet recipes that will have your pup licking their chops and your family grinning from ear to ear, knowing that you're giving the best you can to them.

column1: Contribution Levels

We are looking to raise $4,000 to cover the graphic design and publishing of the books.  We think we can easily do this by having 200 of our fans pre-order the book.  Below are the three contribution levels:
<ul>
• Two Paws Up : $10 Contribution - This is a great contribution for those looking to help the cause but not interested in purchasing the cookbook.
• ""Bury the Bone"" Book Pre-Order : $20 Contribution - What greater way to support the cause, than to pre-purchase the cookbook itself!

• Tail Waggin Thank You : $30 Contribution - Not only will you get the cookbook, but your name will also be listed on our ""Thank You"" page.  You've helped made the cookbook possible, so why not have your name permanently in it!
Recipe Sneak Peak
Here's a sneak peak to some recipe names that will be in our cookbook:
<ul>
• Howlin' Half Moon Cookies
• Pupsgiving Turkey Dinner
• Apple Roll-Over Birthday Cake
• Gingerbread Dog Houses
